text: The Kimberly Hotel is the best spot for families in NYC. From the minute you step out of the car, every member is so helpful, kind, and attentive. We stay here every time we are in NYC because of the location, the LARGE rooms, and the impeccable service. We traveled with our 3 kids and my mom, and had needs like milk, etc. late at night. Room service was always so helpful, and fast! The suite rooms are unmatched in Manhattan for size and value. Service is clearly top priority at The Kimberly, and we will always stay there while in NYC.

title: Great Service
text: We stayed 3 nights. We had a one bedroom suite with two beds. When the kids started to shower the water came out yellowish and would not drain. We called front desk and they immediate sent someone this was around 8pm. Since they could not fix it they offered another room. When we moved to the new room the same issue with water not draining. And also the sofa bed in the living room was broken.  They offered another room and we did not want to move anymore it was late and kids were tired. So they offered another room juts for us to shower for the night and they would fix the shower the following day and since they could mot swap the sofa, they offered a roll in twin size bed. Due to all this, they offered us a free breakfast the following day. All through the mishaps, all the staff was always very willing to help, very caring and very friendly. Overall it was a great experience.

title: Second time coming to the Kimberly Hotel
text: This was our second time staying at the Kimberly Hotel. And we could not be happier. It is our go to hotel when we stay in the city and we will come back. Everything is just a short walk away. After a long day outside, you feel at home in their spacious rooms. All their services are great. We flew in very early into the city and when we arrived (I had asked for a early check in ahead of time) we were given our room two hours before without problems. They also have bag storage available if you arrive earlier and the room is not ready. Their terrace is gorgeous with great views. And their menu is offering great food. Overall they really go above and beyond for their guests and I highly recommend the Kimberley.

title: The home away from home
text: Everything about this hotel exceeded my expectations. The location is perfect, away from the crowds but a quick walk to  shopping streets, and many of the main attractions. The subway is a two minute walk away. The room we had was spacious with a very comfortable bed and great storage. The thing however that sets the Kimberly above other New York hotels I’ve stayed in is the staff. They are very friendly and helpful and customer service is amazing. They set a tone for the hotel that is relaxing and welcoming. I will always stay here when I visit New York now that I have found it.

title: New Years Eve 2023 at the Kimberly Hotel
text: I spent my New Year Eve 2023 at the Kimberly Hotel and spent at Upstairs at the Kimberly Hotel. I had another great time at the Kimberly Hotel. The people who work at the Hotel always have treated me with such kindness. I have been going to the Kimberly Hotel for many years and I would suggest for people to stay at the Kimberly while staying in Manhattan. The Rooftop of the Kimberly is simply amazing. Fantastic views of Midtown Manhattan. Once again, thank you  all of your hospitality and I have wonderful memories staying at Kimberly Hotel 😊

title: Good stay at the Kimberly
text: Great location in midtown away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, 5th Ave, Rockefeller areas. Easy access to subway stations too. The PH buffet breakfast was lovely and service was great. Dated style in the rooms but they are in keeping with the rest of the hotel.  Overall, a good stay at the Kimberly.

title: Lovely stay
text: Had a one week stay at The Kimberly Hotel for Christmas Holidays/New Years Eve with my family, and it was a very pleasant experience. The staff was very welcoming, and the nice one-bedroom suite well suited for disabled people. Recommended.

title: A Great Find
text:
My family of 4 stayed here for 2 nights before the Christmas holiday, and for the location and pricing-was such a great find! We had a King Suite that included a balcony, wet bar and kitchen conveniences such as refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher and even plates & utensils! The bed was plush, sofa was a pullout and 2 TVs between the rooms. Bathroom was a little small, but can’t complain because it was updated and marble. L’occitane toiletries. Very nice. Lots of closet space too. Basically, an NYC apartment. The doormen and front desk personnel were super professional and made sure we had everything we needed. I love that this hotel offers valet parking, which is a major convenience given the NYC streets and driving. On the top floor of this hotel, there is a restaurant and lounge where we ate breakfast every morning. It is a buffet and offers omelet station, french toast and the usual other finds. We went here twice-simply because the service and seating is quick and convenient, and the food is SO good. The omelets and french toast are stand outs. 
As for location of this hotel, it is a straight shot down, a few blocks from Rockefeller, St Patrick’s Cathedral and other landmarks. Though it takes a bit more walking to get to Times Square, this hotel is in a quieter, more upscale neighborhood. Duane Reed, Starbucks and bakeries are within a block. Recommend Schnipper’s for lunch and dinner-it’s a fast-casual place that serves good burgers, salads and kid-friendly foods. Located around the corner, great for take out after a busy day. Overall, we’d come back here and have only praise for this hotel.

title: Really enjoyed our time here!
text: Clean rooms, very helpful staff and great location. I recommend it to the families visiting Manhattan! We have not visited the restaurants linked but we visited  a nice American diner style breakfast and lunch place that we very much enjoyed. Also you are walking distance to best Bagel in town :)

title: Still my favorite hotel
text: I have stayed at the Kimberly three times in the past twelve years, and I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in New York. The accommodations, service, and location are close to perfect. The city was overflowing flowing with tourists this last time (the week after Christmas), and I couldn't wait to get back to my room. I said it after only a few minutes during my first visit, "I could live here." That's how nice it is.

title: Excellent Hotel in NYC - Highly Recommend
text: This was our first time staying at The Kimberly Hotel in NYC. The hotel was recommended by a friend of the family and it did not disappointment. From the welcoming hotel porters that are quick to help you as soon as you pull up, to the efficient and courteous check in staff, everyone is so friendly and helpful. The room was lovely and smelled so good. It was definitely much larger than the typical NYC hotel room and was very well maintained. The beds were so comfortable and the window shades kept the room nice and dark in the morning, so much so that our whole family slept in late every morning. The location in midtown is great and easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, Times Square and Central Park. I could go on and on, but overall I would definitely recommend The Kimberly to anyone visiting NYC. I can't see myself staying any other place when I visit the city again.

title: Amazing NYC Boutique Hotel
text:
The Kimberly is an amazing experience - the rooms are impeccable, the staff make you feel like family and the rooftop views are amazing!  Our family had a fantastic experience.  

The beds are incredibly
Comfortable and the rooms are quiet with fantastic views.

Finally, the location can’t be beat for getting around NYC.

title: Wonderful Stay and friendly Staff!
text: Great location. Walking distance to the Rockefeller center, 5th street and many NY attractions and restaurants. Their bathrooms are huge considering we are in NY and I love that we have a mini suite with doors closing to the bedroom so my snoring husband can sleep in the other room if needed :). Perfect space for party of 3 (my teen daughter and husband ). Also be sure and try out their breakfast at the pent house. Highly recommended.

title: A hidden treasure of a hotel!
text: I have to give The Kimberly a 5! Friendly, attentive service, welcoming atmosphere, delicious food Awesone location! We have been coming to this hotel for almost eight years.. it’s like a home away from home! We walked to rockerfeller center and enjoyed dinner at empire steak house, right next door!

title: Absolutely Wonderful!
text: The room was beautiful and simply amazing. Plenty of space, shelves, drawers for 2 people! The rain shower head...loved it!! Everyone from the bellman to concier abd front desk were so pleasant and i felt it was truly genuine. My daughter and i will never forget our experience here Christmas 2022!!!  Oh and the restaurants were top tier!  We most definitely will stay here again on 23rd floor. The view was also amazing!

title: This Kimberly loved The Kimberly !
text: It’s been a bucket list for me to spend Xmas in NYC and this hotel did not disappoint !  I selected based on reviews and location buy my namesake sealed the deal.  Service is impeccable and I love the old style NY furnishing and decor.  The Empire Steak restaurant is off the lobby and was a wonderful Xmas Eve dinner.  St Patrick’s Cathedral is just 3 blocks away!  Highly recommend and will definitely come back !

title: Long time favorite.
text: We have been staying at the Kimberly during the Christmas holidays for over 15 years.   We have never been disappointed in any aspect. They have made many upgrades over the years in order to improve the hotel.  Everything about the hotel is excellent, especially the staff.  We always get a one-bedroom suite which is spacious and comfortable.  I highly recommend The Kimberly.

title: Lovely Christmas Weekend!
text: I LOVE The Kimberly! It’s us the only place we stay when we come to the city. It is so charming and the staff is amazing! The rooms are beautifully decorated and the beds super comfortable. It’s also very centrally located so it’s close to anywhere you want to go. Highly Recommend!!!

title: Outstanding Hotel
text:
We came for a short pre-Christmas visit and have been SO impressed with The Kimberly. Every staff member from the doorman to the cleaning crew is amazing! The suite is perfect for our family and having dishes, and a small dishwasher is so helpful for cups and glasses. The beds are comfortable, the street is quiet for NYC standards and the hotel could not be cleaner. The location is great and easily accessible to subway stops with the most used lines for attractions. 

We ended up having our flight cancelled on Christmas Eve while we were having breakfast upstairs. I ran down to the lobby and they managed to move things around so we could stay in our same room for an extra two nights. They made Christmas in a hotel extra special for our family. It felt like a little home away from home. 

I highly recommend The Kimberly and plan to stay here on all of our future visits.

title: Christmas celebration
text: Very classy but older hotel.  The staff is so helpful and friendly.  The room was dated but very clean, large and functional.  Separate bedroom suite and kitchen was fantastic.  The Upstairs restaurant has amazing views.

title: Lovely Hotel
text:
This hotel is a gem. Friendly staff, beautifully appointed and conveniently located on New York’s upper East side. It doesn’t disappoint.
Don’t miss the penthouse bar and restaurant, which offers spectacular views of the surrounding area especially the Chrysler Building.

title: Great location and fun old world charm
text: My mom, my daughter (8yr old) and I stayed at the Kimberly during our 5 day visit to NYC.  The staff was great and the room was beautiful and very spacious -a rarity in NYC!  Only complaint was that our housekeeping was inconsistent.  Two times we came back to the room in the evening and we had not had housekeeping yet and two times we had housekeeping, they did not replenish the toilet paper and the sugar, creamer, and tea.  When we called, the staff was quick to remedy the situation.  Would definitely recommend the Kimberly as the location was safe and convenient and the accommodations were top notch!

title: Elegant property in the perfect location for Christmas fun
text:
This is a boutique hotel whose staff goes the extra mile to make guests feel comfortable. The kitchenette is well stocked with coffee, tea, and snacks. The bathrooms, though small, are elegant and include fine toiletries. The location is in walking distance from the Rockefeller Center Christmas tree, Radio City Music Hall and the historic Saint Patrick’s Cathedral. We felt safe walking around at night.

I would suggest the management add rubber mats to the floor of the bathtubs. The water is soft, so the bathtub floor becomes slippery and even more so when applying shower gel. Also the sofa beds have seen better days—time for replacements, IMO.

title: Girl’s weekend in the City
text: Had a fantastic family girls’ holiday weekend in NYC. My first time staying at the Kimberly but the rest of our group comes every year. Felt incredibly welcomed after a difficult trip from Penn Station. Beautiful room with amazing space and helpful staff. Despite the cold and rain our stay was delightful. Would highly recommend the Kimberly for folks who want a central location that is still restful with amazing amenities (great restaurants, lively bar, gorgeous rooms).

title: Service is very important at the Kimberly
text: We stayed three nights in a wonderful suit with nice views and a great bed.  The staff were really nice and professional.  A slow drain was fixed before we knew it.  They recognized our anniversary with a gift and greetings.  A great find.

title: THE BEST OF THE BEST
text: AMAZING location. AMAZING suites. AMAZING & CARING staff. The list goes on.. it doesn't get better than this folks. We were traveling with young children, and it was so nice that they had their own space all week and we also had our privacy! The jetted tubs were so fun. As silly as it sounds the water pressure in the shower is probably my favorite accessory of the hotel! The beds are very comfortable. Even the sofa bed was super comfortable. The kids wanted to "take it back home" with them. On the day of my birthday, they surprised me with complimentary champagne and fruit. All in all, 10/10 experience. Thank you for making our trip great!

title: Amazing Experience!!!
text:
positives:
-  Sadie at the front desk, who was very accommodating of our family in every way that she could.  We are extremely appreciative and hope that her management sees this review and appreciates her as well!
-  wonderful location for what our family was choosing to do.  easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Bryant Park, Central Park,...  a little more challenged walk to the American Museum of Natural History but we still managed it.
-  on-site restaurants or easy access to off-site locations to grab a meal
-  our 2-bedroom suite was very comfortable and spacious
-  the doormen were extremely helpful and polite.

areas for improvement:
-  of 3 TVs in the suite, only 1 worked properly;  an attempt by Engineering to fix the other 2 was unsuccessful
-  certain dining staff.  We ate at Bistango 1 night and our server was not attentive at all.  Thankfully, his peer servers covered for him and took care of us in his extended absence and forgetfulness of certain requests.

All-in-all, we had a wonderful all-around experience at the property and would highly recommend.

title: Still As Wonderful As Ever
text: After missing out on NYC for many, many months due to Covid-19, we finally made it back for this year's Christmas season.  Would we stay elsewhere, I think not.  Such a great hotel with a professional and attentive staff.  Great restaurants and Upstairs at the Kimberly being the best of them all.  A great location with easy mobile or leg-powered access to the best parts of Manhattan.

title: Wonderful Experience!!
text: The Kimberly Hotel exceeded our expectations! We stayed for one week while celebrating my birthday.  Happy to say we were so pleased with every aspect of the hotel.  Check in was a breeze, the bellmen were always pleasant and attentive, the room was very clean and the beds were amazingly comfortable!  Housekeeping did an amazing job everyday plus the location was great!  We stayed in a one bedroom suite that had a balcony.  We will definitely stay at The Kimberly Hotel on our next visit.

title: Great hotel and location
text: I stayed at this hotel for the first time this weekend and it was great! The service and staff were friendly, helpful and knowledge about the city. The location was perfect. The rooms were clean and very nice. I recommend this hotel and plan to return.

title: Disappointing
text: Given the reviews I had read prior to booking this hotel I was disappointed.  The hotel is indeed in a great location, and the rooms are ok (even if tired and in need of a refresh, especially for the prices they charge), but the front desk staff were less than helpful.

title: Christmas Weekend at The Kimberly
text:
The BEST experience at The Kimberly.
Service was impeccable the location you can not beat. Amazing breakfast on rooftop and signature Empire Steaks in lobby area. We will be back to NYC soon and this will be only place we stay. 

Thank You entire staff at Kimberly you made our experience awesome.

title: Perfect Home base for NY trip
text: The Kimberly is a perfect spot for a business or leisure trip to NY. Terrific location. Rooms are cozy and elegant. One bedroom is perfect for a visit. Good size LR. Bathroom tiny but it is NY so expected. Great service from front desk to doorman and all staff. Definitely our go to place in NY.

title: A Gem of a Hotel
text: Let me tell you how special this hotel is.  Last night we missed our train home to PA and at the last minute had to find a hotel room.  Anywhere else that we called we were transferred to reservations and it was someone living in another country. We called the Kimberly hotel and are transferred to the front desk--someone who is actually at the hotel with whom we can share our problem. I tell the wonderful Dusty our situation and she gets us a room, a decent price, and is there waiting for us. We had no luggage and they got us tooth bruses and paste, extra towels, sent housekeeping upstairs to make sure we were settled and had everything we needed.  Wow. Our room was beautiful and immaculate.  The towels and bathmats were the very softest I have ever experienced at any 5 star hotel. That might seen small, but considering how many times you go into the bathroom during your stay and how comforting it feels to dry yourself off with a sumptuous towel rather than a stiff and hard one--it makes a difference.  It really is a special hotel.

title: Great stsy
text: The hotel the staff doorman in front desk in particular and the rooftop we're so friendly and accommodating.  Everything was Top Notch truly enjoyed thie stay and would definitely come back. Thank you Kimberly Hotel

title: The perfect hotel for our family holiday in NYC
text: What a great hotel. Spacious and superbly decorated rooms. It seems to be in one of those beautiful Christmas movies. Comfortable beds. All the personnel was lovely and welcoming. Location is also perfect for all midtown attractions and also close to subway stations.

title: you made an awful situation much easier
text: our one night stay was perfect. our room was spotless, comfortable, quiet and beautifully finished. we so appreciate that you are affiliated with Sloan. this made an awful situation more pleasant. Thank you.

title: Love The Kimberly!
text: I love The Kimberly. I’ve stayed here many times. Location is pretty good in Midtown. Rooms are well set up especially if you have more than two in your party. The sofa bed gives everyone plenty of space and an extra tv. Lastly the service is always excellent

title: Christmas in New York
text: The Kimberly was the perfect boutique hotel for our family visit to NYC. The doormen were super friendly, there was a large decorated tree in the lobby and the hotel felt lively and festive. We had a one bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms for our family of 4. The kids slept on the pullout and we had a very comfortable king bed. And robes and slippers. And l’occitane toiletries. Two restaurants on the main floor. Centrally located and east to walk to main sites from there. We would often cut through Grand Central Terminal on way back from Theatre District. Definitely recommend.

title: Spacious, comfortable and wonderful staff!
text: We LOVED everything about this hotel from the exuberant doorman Ralph, to the very pleasant and helpful front desk crew! The suite was fantastic! Spacious living area, kitchenette, great shower and bathroom with another sink outside the bathroom which was great to have! The bed was very comfortable, and the room dark and quiet, (as quiet as you can get in NYC! ;) we did not have the occasion to dine in any of the restaurants or go to the bar area. The location is also fantastic, very accessible to shopping and loads of restaurants. We felt it was also a great value given this time of year.

title: Great hotel in a central location
text:
Really spacious rooms in a great location. The lobby area is lovely, staff very friendly, and hotel is really worthy of the excellent reviews it's been getting. 
We stayed in a room with two double beds, and it was so spacious. The beds themselves are so comfortable. Decor is a little dated, but your not really going to New York to stay in your hotel  
Will definitely be staying again.

title: Brevity not a virtue.
text: Lovely boutique hotel. Prompt, attentive service. Beautiful rooftop dining, though breakfast wait staff needed better training. (And there’s a great diner next door). A favorite. Must type more b/c reviews must be at least 200 characters.

title: Very good hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed here for a quick overnight-vacation in the city. The hotel is beautiful and everyone that works there is friendly and helpful. You can tell when a business treats its employees well - they treat their customers well. 
I am allergic to feathers and they made sure to remove all down items from the room. 
The bed was very comfortable. We were o the 12th floor and it was so quiet. We slept well. 
The rooms are spacious and well appointed. Thick towels, robes, slippers. Very clean.  
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location/beautiful room. Gorgeous bar Upstairs
text:
It’s a beautiful hotel!! Close to everything. We walked everywhere. Shopping, Empire State Building, Central Park  and Rockefeller Center.
The room was gorgeous.
We ate at The Benjamin Steak house and watched the World Series at the Empire Steak house; a bar/restaurant connected directly to the hotel.

title: The right location for our visit, "classy" place
text: We needed a bigger room with two beds, which is not easy to find in the NYC Budget tier hotels near Times Square. This fit our needs pretty well. We arrived by cab from La Guardia, and departed by cab as well. The closets (2!) and bathroom were larger than I have seen in many hotel rooms. The appointments were what my parents would call "classy". It was in the part of town we needed to be. Our room was in the 151 building, not the main building at 145. That has a separate elevator and is the building that currently has the Empire Steak house. If you have never been to Manhattan, you have to know there is no "quiet" area. There are vehicles and sirens at all hours. The higher up you are, the less the street noise is. One thing that just does not fit in the streetscape is the temporary pavilion for street dining. That just looks trashy. Somebody maybe thought that has merit during the pandemic. It is time for those to go. The city of New York will add more than 14% tax to your bill as well as flat fees in separate categories.

title: Great place
text: The accommodations and location was great.  The staff and people throughout the hotel are excellent. We enjoyed all our experiences while we were there.  It has excellent rating from us overall. We will be back again.  In the future we plan to stay here.

title: Another great stay at the Kimberly
text:
I almost hate to say what a terrific place the Kimberly is as I’d like it be a well kept secret but I’ve stayed several times and it never disappoints. The nicest staff - from front desk to housekeeping to restaurant. 
Always a pleasure.

title: Excellent as always
text: We stayed at The Kimberley on 3 different occasions during October. Each time our stay was excellent. Rooms are large, spotlessly clean. Comfortable beds. Service is always excellent, obliging staff. And the rooftop bar and eatery is a bonus with wonderful views. We will always return to The Kimberley on our return to NYC.

title: Magical
text: I cannot imagine a better location in NYC. Fast check in and okay service in reception. Great service in breakfast area. Excellent cleaning service. The rooms are charming and oldfashioned. The hotel has an English colonial feel to it. The breakfast was excellent and very American. The bed is the best I have ever slept in! The cherry on top, however, is the roof top bar «The Upstairs» which is maybe my new favorite place on planet Earth.

title: Good location, but old hotel that needs some love.
text: The Kimberly is a in a good location.  It is an older hotel, so you do get a nice large room.  Big for NYC standards.  But being an older hotel you do get the problems.  The A/C in our room never cooled the room.  The toilet constantly ran and the furniture was breaking.  When we mentioned these items to the front desk, the response was always just "sorry".  Plenty of hotels in the city, the Kimberly needs to step up their game to stay viable.

title: Love this hotel
text: The service and quality of this hotel is top notch!  It is in the perfect location and everything from the doorman to the rooms are what make this hotel truly a gem in the city.  The size of the rooms are amazing for a NYC hotel. They have a great rooftop bar as well for a late night drink.  I will continue to stay here everytime I am in NYC!

title: Consistently wonderful!
text: Pre-Covid, the Kimberly was my go-to hotel for all my New York business trips. It’s great to be back! The old world charm, with all the modern amenities one requires and terrific service is so consistent in this beautiful, centrally located, boutique hotel. I was looking forward to being back and all my expectations were exceeded!! Thank you, Kimberly staff!

title: Great family room
text: We are family of 4 visiting from the Uk and were lucky to find / stay at the Kimberley.  Lovely big rooms, two double beds and large sofa bed in a large room.  Kitchenette (fridge, toaster, microwave, coffee machine) was also really helpful and meant we had a relaxed breakfast in the room ahead of each busy day seeing the amazing city!  Well done team Kimberley.

title: Great hotel in  a great location !
text:
We had two rooms for my son and grand daughter and for my wife and myself.  rooms are very large, very unusual for a hotel at the center of Manhattan. The decor is a but old-fashioned but the service is super modern and professional. we stayed on the 23rd floor for 6 days in the second week of October and enjoyed also excellent weather.
Breakfast on the top floor is a feast, with beautiful views and a lovely and very helpful staff !!
The central location - close to subway stations lines 6 E and M , and the ease of moving around and the sympathy of the close by avenues Lexington and Madison and 5th is also a great advantage
We shall return to Keimberly whenever visiting New York !!

title: Lap of luxury
text: The Kimberly was truly a wonderful experience. The bed was like sleeping in a cloud,  the bathroom really well appointed and huge,  the living room of the suite was beautiful and perfect to hold a meeting in.  The restaurant and bar in the premise was perfect and the staff super professional and attentive! Great experience overall

title: NYC Weekend-Look No Further!!!
text:
This is THE place to stay in NYC, whether it is for fun or business.  My gfs and I wanted to celebrate a bachelorette weekend in NYC.  We stumbled upon The Kimberly when we were researching best rooftop brunch in NYC.  It went from just brunch to the focus of our weekend! 

First off, The Kimberly is centrally located in NYC on 50th Street, easily accessible to anywhere you may want to go in NYC. There is a lobby cafe, the Rooftop (more on that later), Bistango (an Italian restaurant), Burger House & Bar, and the Empire Steakhouse.  There are ample places to eat on-site so if you don't want to leave the hotel, you don't have to. 

We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite.  All of the rooms at the hotel are spacious and beautifully appointed. From there, after a brief respite, we made our way to the Rooftop. The Rooftop offers expansive views of NYC with a glass-encased rooftop which is partly retractable during warmer months. There is nothing better than starting out your weekend in NYC enjoying the sunset with cocktails and snacks.  The food is excellent-we had sliders, truffle fries and mac and cheese.  The menu is expansive.  The breakfast buffet is excellent. We ordered meat and cheese plates for the room-all beautifully presented and excellent.

Service was top-notch and exceeded our expectations.  When you enter the hotel, you are greeted by uniformed doormen, all courtly, courteous and professional.  Front desk service is excellent and very responsive.  Everyone at the hotel went out of their way to make our weekend great.

I can't say enough about how wonderful this hotel is. I'm sure it is THE place to be, not just for business but for any and every celebratory occasion.  New Year's Eve-here I come!

title: Wonderful experience
text: The Kimberly Hotel never disappoints! The staff is professional and friendly and the rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The roof top is the perfect place to have drinks or breakfast…or both! We have stayed at The Kimberly several times and we will definitely be staying on a return trip to NYC!

title: Very good boutique hote
text: Excellent boutique style hotel with large suite sized room and very good front desk service.  I would recommend to other travelers seeking larger room and smaller property.  Very Good central location.

title: Kudos to the doormen!
text:
Overall, a pleasant experience that lived up to the promise.  I chose it over the other numerous luxury hotels on these couple of blocks along Lexington primarily because the rates were similar, but did not require a non-refundable reservation.  So a plus right off the bat.  

What was good:
1. The doormen, especially Ralph, were just the best.  Very attentive and very friendly, they also anticipate your every need.  In fact, the one bad experience I had regarding lost laundry was resolved by the door staff
2. The room was spacious and clean, and the little kitchenette is a bonus for those staying more than a night or two.  One strange thing was that there were no stirring sticks or spoons or anything to stir the complementary coffee with, even there were pots and pans and glasses and full condiments for the the coffee
3. Relatively spacious bathroom, plus the l'Occitane shampoo, soap etc.  But for some reason housekeeping only decided I needed one replacement for the shower gel, which is only good for one shower's worth of washing, even though I stayed 4 nights.  Soap and shampoo were sufficient
4. Big pillow top bed.  Also kudos for noting my pre-arrival request for something thinner and cooler than a big fluffy down comforter, which for all its luxury is simply too hot for me
5. The room was in kind of a corner (but windows on one side only) next to the emergency stairs and separated from other rooms by the elevators, and the closest room was across the hall.  It was apparently a complementary upgrade and resulted in privacy and quiet nights for sleeping
6. The rooftop bar was a very cool place for some cocktails, and the bartender knew what he was doing

Not so good:
1.  Staff other than doormen were largely indifferent.  One specific instance: I sent out laundry the morning of my last night, and when I returned late that night it had not been returned.  I called housekeeping but since it was around midnight the front desk answered and said they will look it into in the morning and have it back to me by 10 am, but it was not very reassuring.  Next morning at 10, there was no sign of it being returned, and since I needed to check out in a couple hours I was getting concerned so I called housekeeping again, who again said they will "check" in a rather indifferent manner.  But Ralph the doorman came through and was up with the laundry within 5 minutes of calling
2. The "view" was of the apartment building next door, but I realize this is Manhattan so one cannot be too choosy unless paying a hefty upgrade

title: Timelessly classic
text: My mom & I stayed at The Kimberly for a week and we were so impressed with the entire experience. The location is fantastic, close to subway stations, many restaurants and shopping. We booked a one-bedroom suite and it was fabulous. So spacious and perfect with the kitchenette. The beds, including the sofa bed, were so comfortable! Best sleep I've ever had in a hotel. Our room had a balcony as well and we loved taking in the view of all the beautiful buildings in the area. Special shout-out to Gregory (and Happy Retirement, Gregory!), Jose and Ralph who all went above and beyond, during our entire stay, to make sure we were comfortable and well taken care of. If I am fortunate enough to return to NYC one day, I won't look to stay anywhere else but here. Thank you for making our week in Manhattan so very memorable and special!

title: Pleasure
text:
It was amazing experience and amazing times to stay
In the Kimberly Hotel. Professional and kind clerks and staff. And special plus the to Empire steakhouse!!!
Looking forward to stay in the future again and yes I would recommend to my friends.

title: Still the Best Hotel
text: I wrote a review for the Kimberly in 2017 and continue to stay here.   I book the Luxury Suite with 2 double beds.  There is a huge living room, a bedroom, full bath and kitchenette.  The doormen are all so friendly and will hail a taxi for you whenever you want. (and pretty quickly)  The front desk is extremely welcoming too.   The restaurants, Bistango and Upstairs are both great and reasonably priced for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  I will continue to stay only in this hotel for our mother/daughter yearly trip to NYC!  You get what you pay for, but at the Kimberly, it seems you get more than you pay for.  Thank you for yet another wonderful experience.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The staff go above and beyond to make sure it's an incredible stay. Lola in reservations make sure this was the perfect 55th birthday celebration and decorated the room beautifully. The staff from check in to the lovely bellman at check out are all so friendly and lovely. The rooftop bar is beautiful. The hotels are so large-the largest I have been in NYC. Highly recommend this hotel-clean and beautiful.

title: Number 1 Hotel in New York City
text: Beautiful, nicely appointed, spacious rooms with a magnificent staff ready to assist with a smile. Great location near many attractions and businesses. Terrific roof top dining and club with delicious food options.Very fairly priced for what you receive. My choice for years; no reason to look elsewhere when I can find everything here.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: What a beautiful place to relax and unwind. Very spacious clean and the staff is very helpful. The location is perfect. We loved staying here and know we'll be back next year. Centrally located near cross town buses for the theater district, restaurants and NY sights.

title: Weekend getaway
text: Clean, quiet and well-appointed room with plenty of space. Very comfortable beds. Balcony but no view from our room. Pleasant check in and friendly staff throughout. Lovely lobby. We'll stay here again.

title: Location, Size, Staff!
text: Booked two rooms, both one-bedroom suites so a family member could join me and my wife. Had a great stay. Rooms are more like small apartments with a separate bedroom and living room. You don't find that in NYC hotels very often. Staff were friendly and helpful, especially the doorman, Harry. He hailed taxis and got us in and out with our packages and luggage and always with a smile. Rooftop bar was spectacular! Room decor was comfortable and interesting, certainly not typical hotel furnishings. In the heart of Midtown East. Easy walk to restaurants; two blocks from Madison, Park and Fifth Avenues; 20 minute walk to Times Square. Rates were reasonable considering all the bang for your buck. Definitely would be my first choice next time.

title: Roomy, quiet, great for family
text: Great for family of four.   I read every review across midtown looking for a bit more space for 4 than the typical nyc hotel that wasn’t ridiculously priced.  This hotel Met the bill.  We stayed in the 1 bedroom, and it worked great.   I get up early and could sit in the living room while everyone else slept.  It even had a balcony that the kids loved.  We faced the ally and it was awesome - obviously not the view but the fact it was perfectly QUIET.   Really cute restaurant on the roof for breakfast.  Reasonable and great view.  Staff were super nice.  Great experience all around.

title: Nice location
text:
We went to this hotel for a long awaited family hol
We pushed the boat out a bit and wanted a hotel that was a great central location and this is definitely that 
It is an old Worldy vibe to it with the gold accents and marbled effects
In the foyer , the door staff and all concierge were lovely x
The room we had was very nice 
Although the balcony was not facing anything but some old office buildings
The air con in the main bedroom broke twice  and when fixed it wasn’t working well and was very noisy ! My husband felt the room was tired and could do with a bit of make over also we did see that housekeeping hadn’t either not been on the lats but one day or hadn’t looked to stock up
Toilet paper ?! 
We had food in the Italian one night which was nice but not amazing but nice and easy after long day 
Nice service from the staff we encountered 
Great location but would deffo look for deals  etc to take price down a bit 

Over all I would say it is great for location a lot of the staff were nice

title: Our New “Must Stay” place!
text:
Fantastic hotel.  Good location.  We had an easy walk to Times Square and Hells Kitchen.  
On check-in we were immediately upgraded to one BR suite. Really nice room and bathroom.  Living area very comfortable.  There is a balcony! With a great view! Service was top shelf.  We had a cheese plate and champagne as soon as we were in the room.   Rooftop bar was great with terrific view down 50th street.  There are 2 other dining options also - Bistango and Empire Steak House.  Fantastic food!  Will stay here in the future.

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
The hotel room was spacious and one of the quietest stays I’ve had in NYC!! I can’t stress enough how wonderful it is to drown out the city at night and we were only on the 4th floor!!! Definitely stay here again!
Centrally located as well. There is a metro line a few blocks away. We also went to the Penthouse bar and although the food was good, it was extraordinarily loud in there on a Saturday night.

title: Extraordinary
text: Room was impecable and confortable.  Great service and staff. We will  definitely como back.  We had a very nice two bedroom apartment. Perfect location.  The Italian and de Empire Steak House offer good food.

title: Summer family vacation
text: This boutique hotel is in a perfect location and the staff and customer service was fabulous always friendly and helpful. My only disappointment was the view from my room balcony as it was of an old empty building behind the hotel and I was on the 20th floor. The last time I was here in 2017 I had a fabulous view from my balcony but can’t remember floor or room. Other than that I highly recommend this boutique hotel. The Empire Steakhouse is joint to the hotel and has exceptional food and servers, opposite is an Indian and Chinese restaurant called Spice Symphony and has absolutely delicious food and next door is The Luncheonette restaurant for affordable breakfast lunch and dinner meals.

title: Best Hotel in New York
text: This is definitely my go to hotel in New York. It was my third time at the Kimberly, and every stay there has been fantastic!! The rooms are oversized and very comfortable. The rooftop breakfast was delicious, as was the Italian food at Bistango. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Gregory meets you at the front door with a big smile, Rudy makes great omelets, and Nina was very helpful sending me the AirPods my grandson left in the room. I can’t wait to stay at the Kimberly again when I visit New York!!

title: Perfect room for girls’ weekend
text: This hotel was perfect for myself and 2 girlfriends to enjoy our weekend away in NYC. We had the Luxury One-Bedroom with 2 Double Beds. This gave us each our own bed to sleep in as there is a pull out couch in the living room. The kitchenette was great for breakfast and snacks. The rooftop lounge is the best place to be on a Saturday night in Manhattan. No line up, DJ and beautiful views. Hotel location is in the middle-ish of Manhattan so getting most places isn’t too far. My friends both said they’d stay here again when they return, and this is my second stay. Staff are lovely.

title: Review of stay at The Kimberly
text:
Was a great stay, nice huge suite with balcony and very comfortable! 
Looking forward to our return in the near future!
From beginning to end all went smoothly…..enjoyed the roof top bar a lot too as well as Bistango on the street level…..BEST negronis 😊

title: Parfait à Manhattan
text: Très bien situé en plein centre de Manhattan, 15 min à pied de time square et 10 min de Central Park, chambre spacieuse, classe et pas vieillot, petit balcon, bon petit dej, ambiance et décoration à l’américaine sympa, un petit rooftop pour brunch, 2 restaurants. 3 nuits au top !

title: Lovely!
text: Wow. The Kimberly hotel did not disappoint. My suite was beautiful and immaculate. Staff were extremely courteous and helpful. I enjoyed the amazing rooftop for breakfast and also for night time drinking. Central Park and Time Square were in walking distance. This will be my new go to hotel for when I come back to NYC.

title: What a find! Great hotel- spacious rooms, clean, friendly service and perfect location
text: All in all, this was a great find! The rooms were really big for NYC rooms, the service was great (really friendly staff), location was ideal. Would highly recommend to anyone going to Manhattan for a few days whether it be with family or as a couple

title: Kimberly Hotel was GREAT!
text: This was our 1st trip to New York and we stayed 5 nights at the Kimberly and could not have been happier!  Our room was big, bed was comfortable and the room had everything we needed and more!  Fridge, microwave for our leftovers, iron, hair dryer, etc...  Everything was clean and spruced up daily.  The staff was very accommodating with anything we needed, which wasn't much.  For the most part we walked everywhere we wanted to go and never felt like we wished we were in a different part of the city.  Lots and lots to do around the hotel as well as NYC in general.  We will definitely stay here again when we come back!

title: Kimberly Hotel Midtown Manhattan
text: I  had another great stay at the Kimberly Hotel.  Upstairs at the Kimberly is simply magnificent.  The staff at the Kimberly have treated me very nicely and with such kindness. I strongly recommend someone staying at the Kimberly Hotel.⁵

title: A real home from home in New York
text:
Many rooms are suites, which are perfect for families or even if you're staying with a friend or partner who keeps different hours than you do.  And the fridge/microwave is perfect for leftovers-cold drinks.   Breakfast on the roof is a treat, and they keep the rooftop lounge open all day with coffee and pastries (It's a bar with food at night with amazing views.   Great location walking distance from Grand Central, theater district, etc,  And Ess-A-Bagel around the corner on 3rd.   Incredibly comfortable beds.
But the staff really makes the hotel. They  treat you like family.  Actually,  much better than most of our families treat us!

title: Perfect for families and amazing location
text: We just stayed at the Kimberly for the first time since having our son and it was perfect! We have stayed here over the years and always enjoyed our time but this was the first time we had a small child. They made everything really easy! They set up a crib for us which was ready when we arrived. They always made sure it was easy getting in and out of the hotel and cars with our stroller. The rooms are great for kids with a kitchen area to wash their bottles and store food. It really is the best location too which makes walking NYC so easy. We love it!

title: UK police charity have another terrific stay at The Kimberly .
text: A truly fantastic hotel. The staff make it so. Simply the best staff I have ever encountered.  Have stayed here for 17 years. Charity event annually. Hotel is spotless.  Rooms are awesome.  Breakfast to die for. Nothing is too much trouble ot really is a home from home

title: A Gem of a Hotel
text:
We stayed at the Kimberly for nine nights in July. We took two suites, as we were grandparents traveling with two teens.
The suites are old world elegant, but with every modern convenience, including a dishwasher and electrical outlets that are accessible.  

The staff is polite and helpful. From opening the heavy front door to hailing a cab, we cannot think if one complaint in the nine nights we were there .....and we are pretty demanding. Our granddaughters also said that the staff were incredibly friendly.

This is a great choice of hotels...the suites are huge by any standard, the service impeccable and the location could nit be better.

title: Nice for the price
text: The Kimberly is a more traditional style hotel. The location was perfect for our needs. The price was affordable. The decor is dated but tasteful. Housekeeping is still provided daily if you desire. The rooms are spacious and clean. The bathroom was small in comparison to the bedroom and living room but this was not an issue for us. The balcony is a nice surprise it there were no seats and the view leaves a lot to be desired. Again, not an issue for us. We enjoyed having the space. We did not encounter a lot of noise. There were the occasional sounds from the street but not enough to bother us. The doormen were friendly and attentive. The front desk is hit or miss depending upon who was working. Some were kind and others brisk and unwelcoming. The bar/lounge was nice but closed so early that we only visited once. The prices were excessive even for New York. We did not visit the restaurant.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: The staff goes out of their way to make you feel very special!! Gregory Kirkland welcomes you at the front door with a big smile, and Kirt Barrington and Serina Cekovic at the front desk are very pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are oversized with a huge bathroom. We loved having our breakfast at the rooftop restaurant.    This hotel is perfect in every way!!

title: Better Than We Hoped
text:
We needed a hotel for a 5 night visit to NYC as a family of 3 including a teenage boy. One of my criteria for a hotel when we go away for more than two nights is a hotel room with a living room area so we can stretch our after a day of exploring whatever city we are in. The Kimberly Hotel fit the bill with a living room and a balcony on the East side of Manhattan, a few minutes away from Grand Central. 

We are NYers but having moved away to another state a few years ago, we were eager to get back to our city but a little nervous about the size of the room we would be getting for the price and the noise level. We have stayed in other hotels for short stays in the city before and usually they are tiny. We were exceedingly happy to find that our room was very spacious with a separate living room and bedroom, with a little kitchenette, microwave and fridge included. Check in was easy and the Manager on duty the night we checked in was very friendly. 

The room, as we said, was a pleasant surprise. The beds were comfortable and there were more than enough closets with robes, slippers and umbrellas for use during our stay if needed. The only "complaint" that we had was that the AC is very loud so if you're a light sleeper, this would have bothered you. We are not so the AC was just background noise.  We did not hear any other hotel guests in other rooms during our stay. The balcony unfortunately overlooked an alley and directly into a hotel next door so not very fun but that was okay. If you get a higher floor, the balcony may prove more enjoyable. We were on a floor below 10th so not very exciting. This is a traditional style hotel so if modern decor is what you prefer, you may find the rooms a little too old-fashioned and dated for your taste. 

The hotel is conveniently located near Grand Central Station and it's Manhattan so there are many dining and public transportation options available within a stone's throw away. It took us about 45 minutes to get to and from LaGuardia during rush hour via ride share service. 

One minor quibble was our request for some additional paper coffee cups and napkins to be re-stocked in our room on the fourth day or our stay. That request went ignored. 

We would definitely love to stay here again on a return visit.

title: Great place to stay!
text:
The hotel staff was wonderful.  Starting at check in  with Kurt at the front desk to Arion at Upstairs restaurant (breakfast), to the bellboys (great at giving us directions to places we wanted to go, call taxis and give recommendations), to  the staff at Bistango restaurant (diner), to housekeeping, you made our stay memorable  and we thank you. Forgive me if I leave anyone out.  Everyone we made contact with was fantastic.  Keep up the great work and keep smiling 😃.  As a  business owner myself, I  can appreciate that.

The place was cleaned and spacious by new standards. The only thing I  would bring attention to: are the towels and robe (they a little aged). 

5*****

title: Bobby Freeman
text:
Still our favourite New York Hotel-Fabulous Duplex Suite(8i) with ***2*** Outdoor TERRACES (Not Balconies)
And the Best Service in town-Staff are all Fantastic. Try the rooftop restaurant which has a glass roof that fully opens…Amazing…and so is the food!
PS: Great Location at Lexington & 50th!
PPS:All Suites have Balconies-Rare in Manhattan!

title: Great hotel!
text: Great midtown location, excellent service, friendly staff. We had a two story suite…..2 full bathrooms and 2 decks (not balconies but large decks), one off the living area and one off the bedroom. I believe there is only one such suite in the hotel so ask for room 8I. Rooms are large, clean and the bed is very comfortable. Cabs aren’t always easy to get in this city (even though it seems almost every car on the road is a cab) but this hotel is within walking distance of Broadway theatres, shopping, etc! I would highly recommend The Kimberley.

title: Amazing Visit to NYC
text:
This hotel is awesome! I had booked at a chain hotel in time square but I cancelled and booked at the Kimberly last minute. That was the BEST decision we made on this trip. 

I was traveling with my husband and teenage daughter. We booked the one bedroom with a king sized bed. The room was spacious and clean. We even had a balcony, which is a rarity in NYC. Our room was equipped with a mini fridge, a dishwasher, robes and slippers. Housekeeping came daily. 

There is a drug store around the corner to purchase snacks/various items.  Around the other side of the block is a McDonald’s. This hotel is about 8-9 blocks from Grand Central station one way and about the same to Time Square/theater district. We walked everywhere and never felt unsafe, even at night when my daughter and I walked alone to time square.  

This hotel was close enough/within walking distance of everything in midtown but far enough away to escape the craziness of time square.  Next time we visit NYC we will be returning!

title: Stay here!!!
text: This place is AMAZING! Upstairs dinning was also amazing. Close to everything! The room was amazing. The staff was also amazing very helpful the whole stay. Not to mention check out is at 12pm most hotels I’ve stayed at were 11am. Stay here the price is worth it!!!

title: Would definitely stay again
text: From Harry at the front door to all of the hotel staff, we had a fabulous stay and would definitely stay at the Kimberly Hotel again. We were extremely grateful for our late check-out as we had several moving pieces with family member traveling in different directions at check-out.

title: Above and beyond personal hospitality
text: This hotel treats you like family…they make sure you’re happy with everything!  Much different from your basic hotel!  I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Location is very good too. Close to everything but away from the craziness.

title: Four steps forward, one step back
text:
The good:
- The staff were super friendly and helpful.  The bell staff was seriously the friendliest I've met in years and had good suggestions for every question.  Really a great team!  If I was asked to list what I want in front lobby staff, I would just send a photo of these people.  
- The room was large and comfortable.  The kitchen had everything we needed - fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker - and a dishwasher!  Our kid said the shower was the best she ever had.  We had three giant closets, and the beds were comfortable.  The room temp was fully controlled by in-room thermostats.
- The room was cleaned each day.  None of this silly pandemic stuff eliminating room cleaning until you check out.
- The location is very good.  You may prefer to be closer to Times Square, but there are plenty of good restaurants in walking distance and the street out front is easy for pickups.

The bad:
- We showed up 1/2 hour before check-in time and our room wasn't ready, so we walked around the area and came back one hour AFTER check-in time and our room still wasn't ready.  It was finally ready 70 minutes after check-in time.  Not a huge inconvenience, but we were already tired from traveling and needed to get into our room.
- We were charged $13 for minibar items we definitely didn't use.  I think we were charged because of bottles/food wrappers in the trash for items we brought in ourselves.  I notified the front desk clerk, but he just shrugged.  I wasn't going to argue over $13, but I don't like paying for something I didn't use.
- I left an expensive phone charger in the room when we checked out.  Only 3 hours later I came back and they said the room was already cleaned and no charger was found.  They accompanied me to the room to let me look, but it was gone.  I definitely left it in the room.  Ok - this one is 50% my fault for leaving it when we checked out, but still I would hope a high-quality hotel would make sure personal items like this are returned.

We had a great visit to NYC, and the hotel was very good.  With a little different luck, this hotel may have been a 5 out of 5.

title: Perfect suite hotel mid Manhattan.
text: This hotel lived up to its website description and Trip Advisor’s reviews. My two adult sons and I stayed 8 nights in a spacious suite with 1brm ( 2 dbl s) and a large, comfortable sofa bed in the lounge. Very large rooms, perfectly equipped kitchenette, spotless bathroom, luxurious beds. Dark and quiet at night, even at the road frontage side of building. Staff is excellent - courteous under pressure, obliging, with the fastest response from housekeeping I have ever experienced. Spotlessly clean. Our air conditioning in the bedroom broke/flooded on the first night. We were moved to another, equally spacious room for a night while a new aircon unit was installed. Well handled with minimum fuss and fast repair. Staff managed my agitation with equanimity. Even the aquarium in a side room of the lobby is a wonder to behold! This is my favourite property for family accommodation in all my 5 trips to NYC.

title: Anniversary
text: Beautiful hotel. Friendly staff. Great location. Definitely would stay here again. Quieter location for sleeping. Perfect for walking and getting to all the attractions. Beds are comfortable. Bathroom could be bigger. But I loved the balcony

title: Gail AAA Western & Central NY
text: The Kimberly Hotel In NYC has been my home away from home for over 20 years. This property is the closest thing to being home. You are always treated as family by an incredible staff who have been here for decades. The location could not be more perfect. My recommendation is to make the Kimberly your home too.

title: Lovely first time visit
text: Our usual hotel wanted to charge an arm and a leg for the night this summer so we looked for a luxury hotel that was more reasonably priced. We found it!  The female concierge was super helpful in planning our trip—I spoke to her multiple times. We really appreciated that! Shelton was so welcoming when we arrived and made us feel so special. His warmth, charisma and fabulous personality made us feel at home immediately. The rooms were very clean and we especially appreciated the bath amenities that were all high quality! I wished the shower were a walk-in and not a tub. It was hard to stand in, actually. Also the shower was difficult for all of us to work. That was the only negative. We can’t wait to come back and thank you for welcoming us!

title: Fantastic
text: My second visit to this great hotel, this time visiting with family we shared a double double room with suite. The beds are amazing, so comfortable. Staff at reception are kind and courteous, room service was excellent. The area is great, not far to walk to all the city highlights, some nice places to eat around 2nd avenue away from the hustle and bustle. The rooftop area is nice and not too busy if you hit it at the right time.

title: NYC Girls Trip
text: Our stay at The Kimberly was wonderful. It checked all the marks for service , cleanliness, location  and the hotel style. It’s a European style boutique hotel with vintage decor with all the modern amenities. Staff was supper nice and helpful. Only missing thing was the view. Since we had requested a specific type of suite, it didn’t have view.

title: Best Hotel in NY
text: The Kimberly is easily one of the best hotels at which I’ve ever stayed. The staff is extremely kind and helpful. The room was beautiful and very large for New York. The location was excellent and in walking distance to several sites. This is the only hotel I will stay at anytime I visit New York!

title: Fabulous location, service, pricing, rooftop dining
text: Based on a tip from a friend, my 15 yo son and I spent 5 nights at this boutique hotel filled with fairly spacious suites, many with great views.  Terrific service all around.  Breakfast and night bar at the 31st floor rooftop restaurant enclosed by glass and with an additional outdoor area that provide fantastic 270 degree views of the city.  First floor Italian restaurant with high ceilings, old-world feel, excellent food.  Great mid-town location.  The Kimberly has it all.  Enjoy.

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: My 25 year old daughter and I truly enjoyed a weekend getaway stay. We had a huge, well designed two bedroom suite with a living room, kitchen/dining area, two bathrooms and a balcony with views of the Chrysler Building and the East River. The suite was clean, comfortable and bright. What made the experience the best we've ever had (for any of our girl's NYC getaways over the years) were the people. The front desk was helpful and friendly with questions and arrangements ahead. The valet parking was a breeze. The doorman who went out of his way, literally, running a block away to get us a cab. The housekeepers were sweet and accommodating for my down bedding allergy.. The in room dining experience was awesome. The delicious, well presented food was only the beginning. There were two polite and friendly servers that placed a white tablecloth on our dining table and set us all up - one time for a full breakfast, one time for a light, late dinner and one time for just a bottle of wine and desserts. We had cocktails and appetizers one evening and a delicious dinner the next evening in the lobby level Bistango. Hostess and servers were wonderful and even remembered what kind of wine I had the first evening so I could order again the second night. We didn't have ideal weather, but really enjoyed chatting on the balcony with cocktails for hours. I only get to enjoy this time with my daughter every so often and The Kimberly was instrumental in helping us make happy memories to last a lifetime. Thank you to all of you! We already booked our trip for next year - hoping to get the same suite that we loved so much!

title: Wished I could have stayed longer!!
text: This is a GREAT boutique-like hotel. In so many ways. Rooms are easily twice the size of other rooms in Manhattan. Very well appointed. Staff is professional and accommodating. Location in Midtown couldn’t be better. Rooftop for evening or morning (we had their reasonably priced, very good buffet). Even their fitness Center was well-equipped (lacking only an empty fridge for water which I am SURE they would have filled if I called down to them). A real find. Will definitely choose them again for next time I’ll be in NYC.

title: Couples reunion for 4 days in NYC
text: We chose the one bedroom suites and could not have been happier.  The Kimberly has a wonderful rooftop terrace for small plates and drinks with terrific views of the city as well as a casual Italian restaurant and an elegant steakhouse.  The staff was excellent, friendly and attentive.  All in all The Kimberly Hotel provided the perfect venue for our reunion in NYC.  We can't wait to go back.

title: Fabulous rooftop space, excellent food, spacious suite!
text: Terrific, well-trained staff at all levels. It was a pleasure to call The Kimberly Hotel  "our home away from home"  for five days. We lacked for nothing. Lovely suite, excellent service, wonderful ambiance. What could  possibly be better!

title: A quick trip
text: As always, stayed in the two bedroom suite at the Kimberly for a quick Friday night theatre getaway. The staff is always friendly and most accommodating. Everyone goes out of their way to be helpful. The rooms are always comfortable and extremely clean. I highly recommend this establishment.

title: Excelente atención.
text: Excelente atención de todo el personal que en todo momento resolvió todo lo que solicitamos. Destaco particularmente voluntad de la sra Sadie. El hotel es super recomendable por ubicación, espacio y atención.

title: Spacious 2 bedroom suites
text: We stayed in their 2-bedroom suite for a full week in May 2022. We couldn't have been more pleased. It was spacious, with plenty of natural light. We filled the small fridge with our own drinks and snacks. We loved having two full bathrooms. Cleaners visited daily. The doormen were so friendly, especially the morning guy. He exudes kindness! Wonderful restaurants are at every turn as you walk from the hotel. We had never stayed at the Kimberly before, but will definitely consider it as our first option on our next visit.

title: Overall Good Stay!!!
text:
The Kimberly Hotel  was an overall good stay for us. Here is a summary of the pros and cons from our trip. We stayed 4 nights in a one bedroom suite on the 28th floor.

Pros: 
Great location
Room was exceptionally clean and smelled amazing when we arrived
Hospitality and customer service were excellent (very welcoming and helpful)
Nice amenities through out the room

Cons:
Ergonomic bed remote did not work (Maintenance came to repair it immediately)
The bathtub had a very slow drain. During showers water would  just pool around the tub. (Maintenance was able to fix it in about 20 mins)
The toilet stopped working and would not flush properly (You guessed it, maintenance was able to fix it right away).

It's an older hotel, so things are probably just wearing down a bit. 
Nevertheless, if given the opportunity, we would stay here again! 
We would also recommend it to others, but just keep an open mind to potential hiccups. :)

title: Good location, great accommodation, great service, gym needs a little work.
text: Please don't tell anyone about this hotel. They will raise their rates. I have stayed there many times, including last week. The rooms/suites are spacious and well appointed. Everything works, well. The service is warm, friendly and efficient.  My only criticism is that I need an individual TV on my treadmill in the gym. On the two treadmills on one the TV was stuck on a children's cartoon channel and the other was clunky, grainy and had a limited selection of channels. As a heavy duty gym user this was disappointing.

title: Fun 6 day trip to New York City
text: Everything was wonderful.  Beautiful and spacious (for NY) room, lovely bedding, fabulous friendly and helpful staff. Very well located in central Manhattan with good restaurants nearby and close to subway.

title: Best nyc hotel…
text: Once again the Kimberly goes above and beyond! This is truly the “family “ hotel, we have stayed with them many times, when I called to make this latest reservation I explained that we had sold our home and needed a place to stay for a few days, the immediate response without even thinking was “ you always have a home here at the Kimberly “ every employee walking around recognizes you, they are all happy and smiling, the manager sets the stage for happy employees and it shows, the rooms are clean the service is the best in nyc. Trust me, book the Kimberly, you will be happy you did….it’s our second home ! Respectfully….Steven fulco…

title: Always outstanding
text: Many repeat visits. I love the Kimberly experience. The long time, gracious staff and beautiful, large, elegant suites with luxurious beds and convenient quiet location. On business trips I try to build up my Marriott points but in NYC I skip that and come to the Kimberly.

title: An upscale old standby
text:
I have been coming to the Kimberly now for I would say 20 to 30 years obviously I keep coming back. It feels like home when I return every everyone remember you and cannot do enough for you I have made friends with people on the staff.
The hotel is a boutique suite hotel which I personally prefer. The location is excellent on the trendy East side near the subway and near to all the major attractions. Due to the pandemic it is headed it's share of financial issues as has the whole economy and hotel industry. My only observation a minor one is some items have been eliminated from the breakfast buffet namely the daily special such as eggs benedict etc and the charcuterie display of various cold cuts and cheeses. I enjoyed that addition which is relatively new and hope it will be put back. For the type of hotel it is I feel the prices are reasonable and a good deal. They fluctuate obviously with the rule of supply and demand.

title: See a show
text: The hotel is great! Clean, lovely staff, 3 restaurants under the same roof. Felt very European in a nice way. Breakfast on the roof was very good and we had a view if the Chrysler building. Will come back at our first opportunity!

title: Great Hotel
text: I've been staying at the Kimberly for over 20 years.  It is a great hotel.  The suites are comfortable and functional.  The people are great.  My only regret is that the rooftop bar is generally crowded and loud and/or is taken over by special events.

title: Amazing
text: No complaints. I would just kinda forget about the decaf nespresso but the place was great. Rooftop bar! Very clean. Nice beds. The suite was amazing for say 4 single people. If the weather was warmer the balcony would have been the icing on the cake! :) bathrooms great and nice products! Highly recommend the suite!

title: Great hotel, great aquarium
text:
This is a real find. Large spacious rooms, friendly staff, very convenient midtown location. Our room was nice and quiet, clean, and well-lit.  Very comfortable bed as well.

There is a spectacular aquarium in the lobby.

title: they upgraded us to a beautiful suite
text: location is great  the people who work there always  smiling   including the doormen   restaraunt on the roof has a good buffet breakfast beds are very comfortable  nice to have the coffe machine in room     separate thermostats for living room and bedroom

title: Beautiful, spacious, and clean!
text:
What a lovely hotel! 

The location is ideal. You are close to many midtown sights including Grand Central, Rockefeller Plaza, and Times Square but far enough away from the noise and touristy bustle.

Our room was HUGE. We had a double suite, which included a full kitchen (with a dishwasher!), a dining area with table and chairs, a sitting room with a sofa, chairs, coffee table and desk area, an outdoor balcony, a bedroom with 2 beds, and a bathroom. The size of the bedroom alone was bigger then most NYC hotel rooms, but the whole suite was enormous! And there were FIVE closets. Five!

Each room was lovely, although the balcony had no furniture so it was hard to enjoy, and the bathroom was on the smaller side with dim lighting. There was also a peculiar beeping noise in our room that would randomly sound throughout the time we were there. Not sure where it was coming from.

The room was very clean and pretty well maintained. The bedding was very soft and comfortable; each bed had 2 soft and 2 firm pillows to choose from. Towels were ample. There was a nicely stocked mini bar, a variety of snacks, a coffee maker, and nice extras like umbrellas. 

View from our balcony on the 26th floor was nice, but we were on the back side of the hotel so couldn't see the Chrysler Building.

The rooftop was fine, but drinks were overpriced and it was very crowded the night we were there. We didn't go to the breakfast served up there. Ordered a couple of beers from room service one night and it was a bit slow.

Staff was a mixed bag, but the concierge (forgot his name) was the shining star. I believe he said he's been working there for 30 years or so. A delightful gentleman!

title: Golden Wedding Anniversary
text:
Beautiful room, very comfortable. All staff members, front desk, porters, doormen, maids, waiters exceptionally helpful and pleasant. 

Sadly we only managed to access the ‘upstairs’ bar once during our 6 day stay as it was closed to guests on a number of occasions for private functions. 

Overall we had a lovely stat and would definitely stay at the Kimberly again.

title: My favorite NYC home away from home
text: The title says it all. Super convenient, central location. Unfailingly comfortable spacious rooms. Not a big impersonal corporate feeling hotel. Attentive service. And the very BEST doorman staff in NYC!

title: Once again, they knocked it out of the park
text: This must be my 10th time to the hotel and it is always a pleasure. The staff is so attentive and warm. Many of them have worked there for years, so there is a lot of institutional memory, and you can see the difference it makes in customer service.

title: Very comfortable stay
text: Rooms are always clean and the one bedroom suites have more than enough room to make for a very comfortable stay. The decor is a bit old school but the bathrooms and quality of beds are great. Will definitely choose again, especially when with kids.

title: Love this hotel!
text: I absolutely love The Kimberly Hotel, and cannot wait to stay again this Fall.  The rooms are spacious, and the bedding is amazing, so comfortable!  The rooftop bar is beautiful, great spot to relax with friends.

title: Very nice hotel
text: Excellent hotel, very clean and a friendly staff. I have stayed here several times and it never disappoints. The penthouse bar is very nice and reasonably priced for NYC. The breakfast buffet was somewhat limited but still good. I’ll be back next time I am in New York for business.

title: Gold Star for The Kimberly in all areas.
text: My husband and I stay at the Kimberly several times a month.  We stay in the one bedroom suite which has a separate  living room , and a small kitchen/bar area . The bed is extremely comfortable with luxurious sheets and pillows. Furnishings are antique style, very lovely. The suites are very spacious and immaculate.  I am a patient at Memorial Sloan Kettering .  As a patient you can get a reduced rate but the regular rates are reasonable. After chemo I look forward to going back to the comfort of the Kimberly to rest in the luxurious bed! This has become our second home. There are several good restaurants in the area. We order room service from Bistango (onsite restaurant) on treatment days. The food has been very good.  There is a beautiful roof top lounge with an amazing view of the city. We love the Kimberly!  It offers luxury without the enormous  price tag.  We feel very safe here. The staff are wonderful caring people and you can be sure that they will take care of you and your family. I can't say enough good things about them. Lets just say that they know how to treat people. Opening doors, asking how you are doing, doing every thing they can to make you feel at home.  No need to ever stay at a chain hotel again.  Have to give a shout out to  Ralph , Jose, Harry, David, Kurt and Gregory who makes our day when he greets us in the morning.  This is a special place. Think no more, book your stay at the Kimberly.

title: What a gem!
text: My family and I recently stayed at The Kimberly for my daughter’s surprise birthday weekend. Wow, what a wonderful trip!  The suite we stayed in was huge, super comfortable, and had an undeniable charm. The food, including room service, was delicious. I loved the small, boutique feel. Wonderful rooftop views, too! Best of all was hands down the staff!  Harry, Ralph, David, Jose, Darko, and even the staff who we didn’t interact with at great length, were so friendly and warm.  I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. As a travel advisor, this is the kind of place I feel confident sending my clients.

title: Wonderful hotel with excellent staff!
text: My husband and I have stayed at the Kimberly several times and it is our favorite hotel!  The accommodations are superb, and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  They always make us feel welcome and at home.

title: Super séjour à NY! Emplacement de choix et grandes chambres :)
text:
C’est notre 4e séjour à NYC,  mais notre premier avec les enfants ! Nous avons ADORÉ!
C’est un hôtel génial en famille, puisqu’il y a des suites de 600 PC  avec une chambre à coucher lit king et un salon avec divan lit immense ainsi qu’un espace cuisinette.. ce qui est quand même rare à NY.  C’est très grand et les enfants ont leur place. Magnifique hôtel style rustique chic, très bien entretenu. C’est vraiment préférable de demander une suite aux étages supérieurs et face  a l’arrière de la bâtisse, c’est beaucoup moins bruyant. Au départ, nous avions une suite au 7e face devant, mais c’était vraiment bruyant alors ils nous ont changé au 29e étage. Super service de la part de la réception honnêtement. Le rooftop lounge est aussi vraiment très bien (Le Upstair), j’aurais juste préféré que ce soit ouvert aux enfants jusqu’à 20h au lieu de 17h, pour pouvoir bénéficier d’un petit cocktail en apéro avec les enfants. Nous pouvons y déjeuner le matin et la vue est magnifique. 
L’emplacement est aussi très bien, 5 min à pieds du Rockefeller center, 11 min à pieds de la 42th/Gare Centrale/Bryant Park, 15 min à pieds de Times Square et 15 minutes a pieds de Central Park aussi. 

Nous y retournerons avec plaisir!

title: Lovely hotel with old world charm
text:
We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The beds were very comfortable with nice linens.

The staff was very friendly  and helpful. The doormen were so sweet. The hotel was very accommodating about a late checkout.

The only reason I give this hotel 4 stars is that the rooms could use a little bit of updating. The curtains are very old, our door to the balcony was very difficult to open, and it would have been nice if there was furniture on the balcony to sit in.

title: Terrible noise, large rooms, great service, outdated fixtures
text:
Hotel is just above the Police+Fire station, with sirens going off all night. Single-pane windows are a poor choice and the noise is incredible even at the 28 floor. 
Rooms are spacious and the staff is fantastic, providing excellent service for every request. 
The bathrooms are clean, but outdated. The old TV sets only allows watching cable programming, no way to connect your HDMI or stream your own content

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: We travelled there in March 2022. Have returned to this hotel for the past 20 years and wouldn't stay anywhere else. Missed coming here in covid over the past 2 and a half years. Nothing has changed. The staff are wonderful as always. A fabulous place to stay with excellent service in every department. Appreciate Mr Perezic's care and attention to our stay. The beds are fantastic and soft. Breakfast from the Rooftop is absolutely lovely. Can't wait to come back.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
We stayed here with our 3 kids for a couple of nights recently. It is a lovely hotel, with very spacious rooms and very welcoming staff who seem to go out of their way to make your stay comfortable.

One of the best things about the hotel was the beds. We had the best sleep we’ve ever had in a hotel because of this.

We hadn’t originally planned to eat in the hotel as New York as so many restaurants but we are glad we did. We ate in the steak restaurant one of the nights and it was delicious. We also had breakfast in the hotel and whilst anticipating an over priced menu, we were nicely surprised at the reasonable cost and the quality of the breakfast was amazing (the views from the rooftop were equally amazing). The man serving us at breakfast couldn’t have been nicer or more helpful.

We wish we could have stayed longer!

title: We love The Kimberly Hotel!
text:
Best hotel in midtown!
Great hotel for any kind of trip, business or personal. Excellent service from the doormen, to the front desk and housekeeping! Conveniently located to Rockefeller Center and shopping. It is the only hotel we stay at when in New York City! 
A must stay!

title: Love the Kimberly Hotel
text:
My go-to hotel in NYC. Great location, nice clean and sized rooms.
Staff is so very accommodating.  Kirt, the Front Office Manager, is
always available to handle any request and with a great smile.
