Rooms could use more light (maybe LED bulbs)
thank you-Barry

title: Fabulous hotel
text: This was our second time staying at this hotel; the last time was about 7 years ago.  It is still has incredible service and the hotel room (we had a one bedroom suite) was spacious with many amenities.  From Ralph the doorman (loved him! so helpful) to the front desk and cleaning staff, everyone was professional and friendly.  I cannot say enough great things about this hotel.  The mid-town location is perfect for getting to all areas of the city.  Will stay there again!

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Incredible Service and high standards of excellence from all staff. From the doorman (beyond incredible) front desk, concierge, the rooftop bartender and morning servers..and everyone in between…your team makes this great hotel a gem! 

Great location in midtown a little away from the crazy but close enough that a quick cab gets you anywhere fast. Happy I found it, and will definitely stay again when I’m back in NY.

title: A spring break
text: What a great place. The room was spacious and well appointed. The service and staff was well trained, courteous and professional. Thank you for a great hotel experience. We look forward to seeing you next spring. Thank you

title: Not so hidden gem
text: I honestly don't know where to start ...upon arrival I was greeted with the most professional, friendly, and helpful staff! My room was way bigger than expected and super clean- hotel is in a great location and I will certainly make The Kimberly my hotel of choice when visiting the city- perfect!!!!

title: Great trip!
text: Staff were uniformly welcoming and helpful. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we felt safe around the staff even with Covid protocol. Housekeeping staff promptly addressed our requests for extra pillows and a tea kettle . And a special birthday dessert was delivered to our room!

title: Buen roof top !
text: Mi opinión es acerca del roof top del hotel en el cual disfrutamos de unos single malt en un agradable ambiente, buena atención y vista de los edificios de  la zona. Pasamos un momento agradable antes de ir a cenar. Nuestro hotel estaba a pocos pasos de este lugar y volveremos.

title: Perfect Stay
text: I’ve stayed at many hotels in my lifetime, but none as wonderful as the past two days I spent at The Kimberly.  I can’t say enough good things about the staff from the Doorman, to the Bellman, to the Front Desk, to the wait staff who brought in-room dining, to the maid who brought fresh towels.  Every single person delivered exemplary service with a smile.  The beds were so comfortable, the room was very quiet, and the food was excellent.  The Doorman, Bellman, and Valet laughed at me when I generously tipped them as I was leaving this morning.  I was just so impressed with the level of service.  During these extraordinarily challenging times it’s refreshing to be greeted with such genuine warmth and hospitality.  I paused to explain that I simply wanted to return the same generosity extended to me.  I hope to return to this hotel many more times in the future.

title: Kimberly Hotel … simply the BEST
text: We frequent midtown NYC and have stayed at various hotels during these trips. This hotel is the BEST of the BEST. It has become our home away from home while in NYC.  Bistango has ama Inc good and is their onsite restaurant. Additionally there r numerous additional  4&5 star dining in the immediate area. The personnel here are just awesome. Ralph & Gregory excel at their jobs as Doormen for this hotel.

title: A Welcome Return
text: This was my third time staying at The Kimberly Hotel. Always greeted by the doorman--so friendly. Feels like being greeted as a friend. I typically arrive in the morning and my room is always ready. Large, clean rooms with great amenities. Hotel feels intimate. Love the location. The perfect hotel for a NYC stay--short or long.

title: Nice hotel in nice location
text: We had 10 nights here, the rooms are a little dated but our suite was big, clean and comfortable and we were very pleased we chose The Kimberley. The Empire Steakhouse in the hotel is a very classy restaurant with a lovely bar. The Upstairs rooftop bar offered amazing views across Manhatten.  Great location 5 minutes from Grand Central Station, 10 minutes from Central Park, 15 minutes from Times Square. We had our flight home cancelled due to bad weather and the hotel reception were extremely gracious and helpful allowing us a very late checkout at no extra cost which was most appreciated. Would 100% stay here again.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Great location in midtown east. Luxury feel. Rooms are very nice. A little dated, but that’s the intended theme. Only complaint is the bathroom was incredibly cold. Granted it was a very cold weekend, but the bathroom is all tile, windows, on a corner room. It could really use a heat lamp.

title: A Nice, Convenient Hotel
text: The Kimberly Hotel was perfect for our stay during Thanksgiving.  We were traveling with our daughter and the one room suite with a private room met all of our needs.  It was convenient to many locations (Rockefeller Center, Thanksgiving Day Parade, e.g.) and we felt it was a good value.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and would consider staying there in the future.

title: good
text: room very large , fantastic position . the employers are very courtesy and careful. a vintage luxury that immerses you in in the new york of films!!!! the general manager is an exquisite person and careful to the customers. i definitely recommended it to everyone

title: Bad
text: I booked this hotel, among the many in New York city, because from the price and from the images it seemed to be one of the best luxury hotels in New York. In reality I was totally disappointed with the structure, which is old and poorly maintained. The air conditioning in the room makes such a noise that you cannot sleep well at night. I booked for a room of 52 square meters, being my family of 5. The bathroom is so small that it is not even enough for a single room. I had also booked from 04 January to 08 January 2022, but after the first experience in December, I canceled and booked another hotel. Ultimately, for the very high price you pay, it should offer a lot more both the structure and the services. I strongly advise against it at all.

title: Love it
text: We really enjoyed our stay. Friendly staff and lots of room in the suites that we stayed in. Looking forward to staying there again next time I am in Manhattan! Staff were always polite and generally greeted us with a smile.

title: Great week in NYC
text: This hotel is wonderful. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels all over the city but this hotel is one of the best. We stayed in the executive suite and it was large, comfortably furnished and spotlessly clean.  The windows are large and let in lots of light along with a great view.  The decor is classic and comfortable, not the urban chic minimalist style that is cold and uncomfortable.  There were extra blankets, dual heat controls in the living and bedroom.  The bathroom is a little small but easy to organize to meet your needs.  The front desk staff and doorman were very friendly and helpful.  There are many restaurants extremely close and all were very good.  This is really a great hotel.  We will return.  Thanks so much for a lovely trip!

title: Very nice
text: Visited here 3/1/22 for evening meal , this was good for my partner who is gluten free and she stated the bread was excellent . Prices reasonable 50 $ for both of us with drinks . Very quiet for time of year but recommend a visit , the restaurant is quite small but clean and efficient , food was great .

title: Recomendable 100%
text:
El hotel es muy bonito, habitaciones cómodas y bien distribuidas. Súper bien equipados, no nos hizo falta nada.
Mención aparte la amabilidad de la atención y sobre todo al desayuno .
100% volvería mil veces
Por otro lado, está muy bien ubicado, con metro cerca y a pasos de la 5ta.
Tiene restaurantes al lado deliciosos por lo que si estás cansado puedes ir a ellos.

title: Nyc visit such a wonderful place to stay!! Location perfect, staff attentive and friendly ( so needed during Covid)  luv
text: It is an amazing hotel! It’s like a home away from home feeling! Perfect location easy walk to Rockefeller center, restaurants and stores. We were greeted by the attentive staff they parked our car and took all our luggage. Sadia helped us have a perfect room! We’ve been coming for 7 years always the best!

title: A return trip is in order..
text: Such a gem ..Upon entering the lobby I knew I had picked the right spot..Our room (24F) was fabulous..a full suite of rooms with a balcony..couldn’t ask for more..We made two trips to the roof top bar/dining room which has a spectacular view and an outdoor patio....Friendly and helpful staff only added to a very pleasurable experience..I can’t wait to return..

title: Old fashioned hospitality at a great location
text:
After years of staying in hotels on business trips, took a family break to New York City and chose Kimberly purely on location and reviews. Turned out to be one of the best decisions of the year.
Pros - 
1. Excellent location within walking distance of usual tourist hot spots like Times Square, Broadway etc
2. Very reasonably priced for such a premium location
3. We stayed in a bedroom king-bed suite and was very impressed with the space, the kitchenette and especially the bed
4. The stand-out feature was the courtesy of each member of the staff; very professional and yet polite, dignified and warm - been ages since I experienced this old fashioned courtesy - and believe me, I travel a lot across the world
Cons - 
1. The rooms and the carpets are old; it's for you to decide whether that is part of the charm or a flaw
2. There is an Indian restaurant just opposite the hotel and every time we went out to the small patio, the smell was overwhelming. I do not mean this to be a discriminatory comment - I am from India after all - but the smell was offensive.
3. The bathroom does need an exhaust fan
Overall, loved our stay and intend to make this our default choice for future trips to the Big Apple.

title: Top notch hotel
text:
Incredibly friendly, courteous staff. Allowed us to check in early, which was a Godsend. The rooms are spacious and modern. Bathroom is clean and crisp. Shower is wonderful. Quilts are top notch. Felt very safe.
Located in a very convenient part of town for essential  NYC sightseeing.

title: Love The Kimberly Hotel
text: Everyone there is friendly, the rooms are great, we love staying here.  The location is perfect.  We love the restaurant and bar downstairs and the breakfast in the morning on the rooftop is truly special.

title: A home away from home
text: The staff is always welcoming and accommodating. Prices are reasonable considering the level of service and the location. The lobby is welcoming, the cleanliness is impeccable, and the staff is ALWAYS on their A-game.

title: Holiday stay at The Kimberley Hotel
text: The hotel was great location since we had plans to visit several events during Xmas season. Our suite was large with great amenities, however the bathroom was small.  The bed and pillows were so comfortable!  Look forward to staying here again

title: The Kimberly Hotel
text: This was our third stay at this delightful hotel.  When we come to Manhattan from L.A. we prefer this over any of the other places we've stayed at.  This was not our best experience here, though.  We had previously been on one of the upper floors...18 and up, where we had a terrific suite with a balcony and we were high enough to have a decent view of the surroundings.  This time, we were on the 3rd floor and had the smallest room we've had at the Kimberly.  It 'paled' by comparison to our prior rooms.  But, in fairness, even this room/suite was better than most NYC accommodations.  We had some very minor problems getting the temperature of the room to a comfortable level, but here again the staff of the Kimberly came through.  They immediately sent a person to 'fix' the A/C unit.  Overall, the staff is ALWAYS first-rate!  Attentive, respectful, knowledgeable and professional.

title: another fabulous stay
text:
Each stay here gets better and better.  The hotel is clean and spacious.  The amenities are wonderful for the price point.  A value if you could say that for a nyc hotel. They think of everyting-robes, slippers, umbrellas in the room etc. The kitcheonette is really nice if you have leftovers.The staff is very prfessional and solves any problem or honors any request in less than 5 mins. We asked for ice and it was delivered within 1 min of hanging up the phone.location is great.  You can walk to rockefellar center, st patricks etc but still has a local neighborhood feel.
highly recommend. Dont look anywhere else

title: Amazing, relaxed but with real NY charm
text: A fabulous hotel in Midtown - great staff, food and atmosphere.  Ralf on the door was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable.  Perfect location to explore NY, 5 minute walk from sights and Rockefeller Centre. Breakfast in penthouse restaurant was amazing.  Visited to get see all NY has to offer at Christmas and we not disappointed.  Amazing - thank you.  Would return in a heartbeat.

title: Beyond all Expectations
text: I can not say enough about our stay at The Kimberly Hotel.    Everyone was so welcoming.  From my emails with Ms. Cabassa, to our help from Harry at the door......we were treated so well.  My daughter's birthday was so special.  Room service surprised her with a special birthday treat and note.  The room was an absolute dream come true and exactly what we had hoped for.  Thank you.  I was sad we did not stay longer and am already trying to find time to go back. Thank you.

title: Family Trip
text: The Hotel is very well located, the hotel and restaurant staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very well equipped especially for families traveling with children. You can walk to the main attractions of the city. The concierge can help you by reserving the tickets for the events or restaurants.

title: Made me feel at home
text: Everyone was friendly and made me feel welcome. It’s a boutique hotel, warm and first class. I have stayed here many times before and wouldn’t go anywhere else. Ralph the doorman, Peter the concierge, Linda in reservations and all the front desk staff are terrific.

title: Roomy one bedroom suite
text: Old school decor and great service! We never had to wait for an elevator. The room was very large for New York standards- and it had a balcony.  The workout room was well equipped (2 treadmills, 2 elliptical sheets, bikes and weights).  Convenient location in midtown.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: This is like my home away from home!  Regardless if I am here on business or pleasure with my family. The Kimberly is the perfect hotel!  Staff, amenities, location, food, drinks, the list goes on!  Don’t believe me? Try it! Live it! Love it! I can’t wait to go back!

title: Me encantó!!!!
text:
He ido a NYC más de 10 veces y el Kimberly es sin dudas el establecimiento que más me ha gustado.
La ubicación es perfecta en midtown y la mayoría de las unidades son suites enormes...Algo increíble para Manhattan. La mía tenía vista al edificio Chrysler y un balcón con sillas y mesa... Los que ya han estado en NYC saben de lo que estoy hablando... un milagro 😀.
Las kitchinette tienen todo lo que puedas necesitar: copas de vino, espumante, tostador, platos, lavavajilla y cafetera (la nueva era nespresso con 4 capsulas gratuitas x día). Amenities de L' occitane y sábanas de frette... El estilo es clásico, tal vez no para todos los gustos pero las comodidades inigualables compensan todo!!! Punto aparte es el personal: MARAVILLOSO... Todos se esfuerzan de corazón para que tu estadía sea maravillosa. Marcia nos ayudó en todo momento, reprogramando nuestra estadía x la pandemia cuatro veces... siempre con cordialidad y genuino interés!
No lo dudes es tu mejor opción en Manhattana a un precio más que razonable!

title: Home Away From Home
text: The Kimberley is very well located and offers terrific value for money.   Big and very clean rooms.  From the door man on in, the staff are friendly and welcoming.    The Kimberley is my home away from home.

title: Great Hotel
text: My wife and I are back in New York City. Wonderful to see lots of people about. Staying at the incredible Kimberly Hotel on 50th just behind the Waldorf. It’s so nice to see the attention to detail and execution. Forgot toothbrush and the front desk staff handed it to me in this handsome black gift bag. Brought a smile to my face that our industry was on its way back to providing great experiences to travelers.

title: Sweet 16 celebration with our three Generations of Women
text: The staff at the hotel is wonderful! Location is fantastic. Suites are large and comfortable. Dining options nearby and 2 right on location were fantastic. My family representing three generations of women celebrated my niece’s 16th Birthday together in NYC. It was a wonderful experience for all of us. I would highly recommend this boutique hotel.

title: everything we needed for a wonderful trip
text: We booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. Thank you everyone. The hotel was just what we needed. It is a half-block from the subway station so off we went. We went everywhere we could and would get back to our room ( a suite with a small balcony)"dog tired". We stumbled downstairs to Bistango, the little bistro on the ground floor. We ate outside (they have heaters) and dang if we did not choose Bistango every night we were there. Food is so fresh and there are no stuffy waiters. We just showed up when we wanted. No schedule.  It was good impromptu dining. We walked the 5 mins to an informal concert at St. Patrick's Cathedral. The day before Halloween we walked the 10 mins to Rockefeller Center and enjoyed the Day of the Dead costumes and art work . You can walk to Moma, you can take a quick subway to the Met. You can take the subway to Battery Park to head out to the Statue of Liberty. I never heard another guest at night. Yes, the decor could be fresher but the bathroom was sparkling when we returned everyday.  Beds were comfortable. For 2 who wanted every minute to be on the  outside on the streets, taking it all in, we could not have found a better hotel. We did not get up to the roof top bar at night because we were too dern tired but next time, we will.

title: Ralph at the door
text: Ralph the door is one of the best employees anywhere. He is a great and genuine human being and the best part of my stay hands down. Thank you for your extreme hospitality Ralph. The hotel itself was ok but all the doormen and bellhops were AMAZING

title: Love this place
text: This was my second stay at the Kimberly and it was as great as the first a few weeks ago.  I like everything about this place; price, location, comfort, cleanliness, convenience, minibar but, most of all, the staff is fantastic.  I ran into the person who checked me in several hours later while getting onto the elevator and he greeted me by name.  I also saw the concierge painstakingly help multiple guests with different things throughout my stay and the doormen are fantastic.  You really feel appreciated here.  I also love the fact that Smith and Wollensky is two blocks away, there is a steak and burger place to the right of the hotel and the NY Luncheonette, which serves great breakfast food all day, is just to the left.  The only negative to the stay had nothing to do with the hotel, it had to do with the fact that NYC thinks it is ok to jackhammer the streets at 2AM!!!  I blame that on that idiot DeBlasio...but he will be gone soon.  I highly recommend the Kimberly!

title: Quick weekend in NYC
text: Traveled from San Antonio to NYC for my daughters Harry Styles concert , I went to Tina Turner . The hotel Kimberly was just what I wanted in a hotel, w pandemic still around, I wanted a small hotel with restaurant and bar.. It was perfect!! Rooms were comfortable and staff was very attentive. Definitely rebooking on my next trip to

title: OUR HOME IN NY
text: I do not know any other place in NY where you can get that space, comfort, cleanliness for a reasonable price. Add friendly attention and you will understand my emphatic recommendation. But also the location is a point in favor, notwithstanding the area has momentarily many places closed due to pandemia.  If any to improve I would recommend the lighting of the rooms.

title: Excellent stay
text: Was extremely well located for our needs in midtown east. Excellent room ( 1 br suite) , spacious, good lighting, comfortable bed, good bathroom. Very friendly and efficient staff. Very nice rooftop bar. Overall for us a very good experience

title: Very Enjoyable
text: We stayed 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Very courteous staff all around, particularly the always smiling and happy bellman “Gregory”. Housekeeping was reliable and did a good job. The only negative was the noisy road construction but that wasn’t the hotel’s fault.

title: Great Staff and perfect Location
text: This is the best location in NYC. The staff is very hopeful in everything you need or where you want to go. The rooms are suites and very large. Steakhouse and Italian restaurants on either side of the hotel.

title: I am a repeat guest at The Kimberly for the past 15 years.
text:
The midtown location works for me and I come into Manhattan frequently. It is an easy stroll to the finest restaurants, shopping, etc. Near Lexington, Park and Fifth Ave.

My travels are extensive and we seek out 5 star properties. I will not say The Kimberly is Five star however, it is deluxe. It is, by far, the best value for your dollar in NYC.  Most accommodations are suites, including  two bedroom suites .
An addition perk is it is A Virtuoso property offering amenities including an amazing breakfast. At night, the roof top (enclosed) is a great meeting place for drinks after work, pre theater/dinner or meeting up with friend's.

The friendly staff, unfortunately, has been impacted by Covid and many of the old, familiar faces are now gone. The replacements are eager to assist and the warm, friendly attitude prevails.

title: Weekend with my sons
text: Had a fabulous time. Our suite had two bathrooms! Perfect for us! Wonderful rooftop lounge that served breakfast too. Great location and wonderful service, my second visit there and will return again!❤

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Do yourself a favor and stay at this wonderful hotel.  Friendly, helpful and very accommodating staff who will make sure your stay is exceptional.  Great location, walking distance to Times Square, Broadway and Rockefeller Plaza.  This is the third time I’ve stayed here and the only place I will stay in NYC.

title: Tina Turner on Broadway
text: We enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Kimberly. The room was comfortable, with good in room amenities. King room bed was very “sleepable”! Enjoyed going to the rooftop bar for drinks. We are walkers, so the location was close to everything we enjoy.

title: Gorgeous Suite, Awesome Staff
text: Room was everything we needed and more, well stocked bar and snack area in the room, along with kitchen, sink, dishes.  The staff was extremely courteous with every interaction and a definite highlight. Helpful at the front desk, in the lobby, and always had doormen posted outside able to point us in the right direction. Rooftop bar had a great atmosphere and a good view. Lots of room, 4 closets, nice shower. If we return to NYC we'll stay here again.

title: Very nice
text: The beds are amazing. It was clean. There are some areas that need attention in the hotel but the rooms are very well maintained and comfortable. Very quiet. Didn’t hear any other noises from hall or rooms. (Except traffic noises of course). Convenient location. Front door man was amazing!

title: Best hotel
text: I travel alone for work, and absolutely love staying at the Kimberly. They provide luxury accommodations and help you feel like your ‘home.’ Vista go is a delicious restaurant down stairs and accommodated a gluten free diet, which I have. The staff is so friendly and the location is great!

title: Great location.
text: Enjoyed our 5 nights at the Kimberly Hotel.  The rooms are a nice size and a large bathroom.  Everything you would expect from a boutique hotel.  Very friendly staff.  Roof top area nice for a light dinner or a cocktail.  The other 2 restaurants also served quality dishes.  Highly recommend.

title: Highly Recommended!
text: My husband and I stayed at The Kimberly for our anniversary weekend. The hotel was beautiful and the entire staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel went to great lengths to keep the property clean, sanitary and Covid-safe. We booked a one-bedroom suite for our stay, which has spoiled me for single hotel rooms now. The kitchenette came complete with microwave, toaster, mini-fridge and plenty of dishes and silverware. The bed was very comfortable, and I don't always like hotel beds. The bathroom was a bit small for my tastes, but that's a minor quibble and it didn't affect the quality of our stay. I loved the L'Occitane products in the bathroom, the ample closet space in the suite, and the homey decorations and feel of the suite. We also used their valet parking and that went very smoothly. I would highly recommend The Kimberly and will definitely stay here again!

title: Clean and very professional staff
text:
Room was large, quiet and very smooth transfer of car, luggage, checkin and checkout.  Food choices were of three restaurants and all were very good and reasonable.  I asked for "room makeup" and it was refreshed!!

I will definitely use this hotel next time in Manhatten!

title: Always A Great Stay
text: The Kimberly staff and guest accommodations are outstanding. We are always pleased with the friendly and helpful staff, the comfort and cleanliness of our room, and the quality of the amenities of the hotel.  Our favorite hotel when in NYC.

title: Girls Weekend!
text:
This hotel is fabulous and the rooftop upstairs is unbelievable!!  There were four of us and we had the pleasure of staying in a 2 bedroom suite.  The kitchenette was perfect for us and the views spectacular!  You can't beat the staff at the Kimberly.  Everyone
was so attentive and so very nice.  I will be returning soon and definitely be stay at the Kimberly.  The location is perfect!

title: post pandemic in NYC was incredible becauseof the Kimberley
text:
As many travelers know the stresses of Covid have taken their toll on the hospitality industry. In 2021 I have stayed in many hotels that were understaffed, poorly staffed and under maintained.
The KIMBERLEY was still a bright star of hospitality and service. The hotel is a dream for business travelers.
Bravo for maintaining such excellent quality and service across the board.

title: Delayed
text: We have stayed at The Kimberly before and the experience was wonderful, but this time around, not so much. We tried Room Service a couple of times after very long work days, and had to wait almost an hour each time for our order to be taken. When we contacted Housekeeping, it took over 2 hours for them to respond to our request. We were told by the Concierge that we could order a taxi at any time from the front desk, but when we attempted to, they said it was only for airport travel. We were late to our appointments twice because of this. The room was extremely small and stuffy for the amount charged per night. They also charged for wifi. I would consider this a "hidden fee" because there was no mention of this when we checked in. What hotel charges for wifi in the 21st century? The experience was definitely lacking this time around. We probably won't return next time we are in NY. I will say this though, Harry is Amazing! The epitome of ensuring the customer has the best experience. He handles luggage and cars and is always greeting everyone with a smile. The Kimberly has a great employee in Harry.

title: Exceptional Staff
text: Wonderful hotel for my family and I. Its hard to find large rooms in NYC and the Kimberly suites are large enough to have toddlers play and adults relax! Very clean and exceptional staff. We didn't go to the roof top but our family who are life long New Yorkers say it amazing.

title: Above and beyond
text: Kurt and the concierge  And their management team Went above and beyond Understanding that me and my wife were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary They were able to give us a fabulous upgrade  And surprised us again with a nice bottle of champagne and a cheese and cracker platter We easily give this hotel a 5 star rating They go above and beyond to accommodate you thank you once again.And I must mention the upstairs if you're staying at this hotel it's a must see They serve breakfast lunch and snacks for dinner And the view is fantastic . And the service upstairs is fantastic as well.

title: Vacation
text: Great boutique hotel with great accommodations and service. Wonderful Italian restaurant great rooftop venue with food and drinks and also the Empire for burgers on the street connected to the hotel.the location of midtown east is a great place to be. Close access to busses subways and very good neighborhood to walk around town in

title: Spacious suite, enjoyed the balcony and service
text:
We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite on the 20th floor. Loved having a balcony. 

Very spacious rooms with lots of closet space.  
Very comfortable king bed and most comfortable sofa bed ever tried. 
Excellent housekeeping daily. 
Enjoyed coffee in room each morning Provided coffee and replenished each day! 
Reasonable price. 
Room equipped with basic dishes and even wine glasses and corkscrew. 
Nice little touches-earplugs (not needed for me) umbrellas, robes,in room safe. 

Decor is dated in terms of color scheme and very traditional ornate furniture. Bathroom on the small side. This did not hinder our enjoyment. 

I would stay there again.

title: Best place to stay in NYC
text:
For ten years I have attended the US Open and stayed at the Kimberly.  Wonderful staff and nice rooms.  Great breakfast with a view.  A short walk to the 7 line route to the Open as well as a pleasant walk to Broadway shows.  
There are good restaurants nearby as well as the Grand Central Market to stock your room.

title: Great stay for a family on vacation
text: The Kimberly is brilliantly located for our purposes (visiting family near Sutton Place and easy access to Grand Central) and the large footprint of the executive suite was a godsend. We have a 9 & 14 year old so between the pull out couch and rollaway bed, everyone had plenty of room (plus balcony & breakfast nook). The front desk staff was very nice and the requests I made in advance for a late night arrival were done to a tee!  Its really the furnishings & amenities that harken a different era. You have to pay for Wifi by device, there is an old 16 bit iPod charger station instead of a place to charge a modern phone by the bed and there was even an executive businessman shoeshine machine with the red & blue heads in the room. Kind of fun, but not as important as having more charging / power outlets, free wifi and morning coffee service. All in all a great stay and great value for families.

title: One of my favorites
text: This is an older property, that may have been apartments at one time.  The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, but they do vary one from the other a good bit.  For example, the luxury suites have balconies, but the ones overlooking 50th Street are far preferable to those overlooking the back of the neighboring building and the field of air conditioning units.  There are only two elevators, and that can be a bit of a pain when things are busy.  But, that said, the rooms are clean and comfortable.  I did not visit the rooftop bar/restaurant this trip, so I will not comment on them except to say in past visits that has been a very desirable place.  Staff is friendly and accommodating, bedding extremely comfortable, and the cleanliness high.  This is my favorite place to stay in Manhattan when I can get the right price.

title: Outstanding experience once again!!!!!
text:
Most importantly, their service is outstanding, personalized,  and the staff one of their main assets.  Harry treated us like family and his sense of humor made you feel happy.  
I  have stayed at this hotel many times, each and every time they never cease to amaze me.
The manager has a personal touch with his guests also and sent us a bottle of complimentary wine which was totally unexpected.  You will not regret staying at the Kimberly Hotel.  Thanks again, Lynn Ferro

title: Oh my god, beautiful
text: This hotel was GORGEOUS. The decor was stunning and the room was beautiful! Extremely clean. The beds were very comfortable, the shower was wonderful. The staff were all friendly and the rooftop bar was perfection. We easily walked from the hotel to dinner around the corner. The valet parked the car, easy peasy. I wish I could have stayed longer!!

title: Amazing hotel in Midtown East
text: After a bad experience at our regular hotel in Midtown West, we did a little searching and found The Kimberly. So glad we did - it's amazing in all the ways that the old hotel (so tempted to say which one...) has recently been disappointing. Every last person who helped us was great - the service is a little formal at times, but this is a VERY NICE hotel. Our server in the attached Italian restaurant Bistango was awesome, friendly and accommodating. We sprang for the executive suite, which was truly stunning. Wish we could live there. This was a birthday trip and we couldn't have asked for better.

title: Nice hotel and the great experience overall
text:
The hotel is perfectly situated in Midtown Manhattan on East 50th, used 50th, just blocks from the park, 5th Avenue,  Park Avenue and Rockefeller center.
 The staff are extremely courteous and efficient, the rooms are clean very comfortable and offer some nice extra amenities, Snacks, water, and a wet bar if you choose. ( Room service is also available and very efficient)
The rooftop is outstanding with fabulous views, light snacks and great beverages.
We had a small issue with our room and the staff,  And particularly the general manager, were incredibly professional and resolved it immediately to our satisfaction, going above and beyond what they needed to do to ensure our stay was  uninterrupted and enjoyable.

If we're staying in Midtown each side Manhattan we will definitely be staying at the Kimberly again. Could not recommend it more highly.

Steve W.

title: Excellent  choice
text: Suite was beautifully furnished, 19th floor well above street. Roof time restaurant with glass ceiling and windows was a super plus.  Enjoyed breakfast every morning rain or shine. So convenient. Great service

title: Do not stay here
text: We had a terrible experience for a hotel that touts they are a luxurious hotel. The water stopped working on Friday and was not returned until Sat. There was no hot water. When the water did come back on it was brown and disgusting. I asked to be compensated for the night we couldn’t shower, and was told they would give us 25%off. The manager said the owner wouldn’t allow any more. This is ridiculous! The rooms are dated snd old. Pretty expensive to not have the “luxury” of being  able to shower. We had to check out and go pay for another hotel! They told me I could call the  owner. I felt as though I should be accommodated. It’s not unreasonable to be able to go on vacation to shower. They said it was not their fault, which I get, but at least compensate us back with something more than 25%. I am waiting for a call back from the owner they will never happen. He only gave the front desk person the “ authority” to give 25%. He should be ashamed of himself while he bid to avoid angry customers.

title: Outstanding Service and Suites!
text:
This gem of a Hotel hits the Mark!  Large well appointed suites, delicious food and hip cocktail scene at the rooftop bar, all presented by a professional hospitality team.
Thank you for making our daughter's Wedding Weekend in NY a huge success!

title: First Time in NYC
text:
First time visiting the city and was overwhelmed on how many hotels there are. We decided to pick this one since it was in Manhattan and had a rooftop lounge. 

Pros:

Valet service is super easy if only staying for a weekend. Any longer I would find a place to park since it is ($55 a day for Valet parking)

All the employees were super nice and informative. Very easy to talk to and really want you to enjoy your stay

Balcony was awesome and the suite had a pull out couch whish was nice to have

Subway stations are close by so transportation is very easy. As first time subway users don't be intimated! 

They do have a restaurant and rooftop lounge but did not have the opportunity to go, Next time I defiantly would. 

Cons:

Only con is you can hear the city traffic. The rooms aren't totally soundproof. I would bring a fan or radio if you are a light sleeper. Not taking away a star since I am sure most hotels you can hear the beeps and sirens.

title: top-notch hotel in every way
text: The Kimberly made our family's stay in New York one of the best we ever had. The doormen were helpful and kind. Every time we needed a cab, the doormen were there to help. The room was large and super clean and the kitchen turned out to be an unexpected surprise. Beds were comfortable and the room was cleaned every day. Ice was brought up to the room promptly every night. The rooftop bar was a delight and the bartender there was friendly and didn't make us (an older couple) feel out of place among the mostly younger crowd. The location was perfect for visits to Central Park and the museums. The large hotel room was perfect for our family of four and our thirteen year old said that the pullout bed was one of the most comfortable he had slept in. He said it didn't have that bar in the middle most pullout sofa's have. The bathroom was small but serviceable with a rain shower that was quite good. There was absolutely no noise on our 24th floor. The room even had a balcony. My wife used the exercise room and said it was excellent. This was our sixth stay in New York and this was the best hotel we've stayed in. We've spent twice as much for a hotel in the past with half the space. With each stay there was always something negative to say, but there wasn't anything negative to say about the Kimberly. That, in itself, is amazing.

title: People Truly Make the Difference
text:
The staff were universally responsive, friendly and helpful.  Front desk staff, bellboys and house keeping could not have been better.  I felt at home and comfortable as my needs and questions were addressed with enthusiasm.
The location was ideal for walking to several Manhattan attractions and restaurants, yet just East of the busier Time Square and congested traffic areas.
Definitely will plan to return upon future NYC visits.

title: Wonderful Surprise
text: This was my first time staying at the Kimberly's. I wanted  to surprise my husband for his birthday and the staff made it so easy for me. Ava was so welcoming  and  assisted me with planning the perfect surprise.  Her suggestions of rooms and other services made it easy for me  to select the perfect suite.  From the moment we arrive  the valet parking attendant and the front desk staff were very courteous, mannerly and helpful. Peter from Concierge made our night even more special with a complimentary bottle of sparling wine, treats and a personalized note for the birthday boy. If you are looking for the perfect getaway in NYC . Kimberly's is the place to be. Restaurants are on premises as well as a sky roof lounge. We had dinner at  the Empire Steakhouse and Breakfast in bed the next morning. This will definitely not be my last time at the Kimberly's.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: It's hard to find a room that fits a family of 5, especially in New York City where hotel rooms tend to be on the smaller side.  The Kimberly Hotel; however, is a gem and was perfect for our family.  The room was so spacious and offered a separate bedroom with two double beds, as well as a large living room with a sofa bed and small kitchenette.  The best part - it had a balcony - a very pleasant surprise and added bonus.  The location is very central and less than a block away from a subway stop.  The entire staff was very nice and always greeted us with smiles when we walked in.  I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

title: First trip to the Kimberly
text: This was my first trip to the Kimberly. Usually we stay at the Hilton on 6th ave in midtown but this trip they were sold out. I am so happy that we chose the Kimberly the hotel was beautiful and very old time classy. The room was huge and very clean. The best part about the hotel was the staff, specifically the door men , they were amazing and treated my 6 year old daughter like she was a princess. Anyone choosing the Kimberly will not be sorry as for us we will definitely be staying there again on our next trip.

title: Perfection!
text: From the moment I arrived, the ease of parking, the helpful staff, the commitment to customer service was exceptional!   The room was spacious, and the food from the restaurants on the first level were delicious!  We have already booked again.

title: Exceeded expectations
text: Great place to stay.  We had a one bedroom suite.  Exceeded our expectations.  The rooms were clean and well appointed.  We had a private balcony where we could enjoy coffee in the morning.  The rooftop bar is a great place to have drinks in the evening or coffee in the morning.  This is now our go to hotel in midtown.

title: Wonderful to be back at The Kimberly
text: How happy we were to be greeted by the staff we have grown so fond over the past six years. We so missed the comfort of this beautiful hotel last year ; moreover , we couldn’t wait to visit this past august .   We saw Harry, Sadie, Gregory and the staff that served us a delicious breakfast Upstairs at the Kimberly. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.

title: Great stay
text:
Have not been there since covid and glad I returned 
They always make me feel welcome.
Dinner at their Italian restaurant had great staff. Theee was one women  Erin from upstate New York made my
Night perfect 
Bob

title: Fun weekend to New York
text: Such a beautiful hotel. Great service. The suites were so big and amazing. Great food as well! Very close to all main areas such as central park, Rockefeller Plaza, Time Square. The door man was so helpful anytime we needed anything.. Will be back!

title: Hidden Gem
text: This will definitely be our “go to” hotel when visiting the city from now on.  Wonderful accommodations, helpful and pleasant staff, convenient and safe location and meticulous attention to detail.  Truly a most pleasurable stay.

title: COMPLIMENTARY EVERYTHING
text:
What would make Kimberly stand out from the others is to have breakfast and fast Internet complimentary. 
High September rates due to annual conferences should not apply to regular guests. 
As one who has been staying regularly for several years, special rates should apply. 
I am very disappointed to be quoted 75% increase for the same suite as I paid last week.

title: Great hotel
text:
Awesome hotel…very clean and well maintained. Staff very attentive and helpful. Appeared to take COVID precautions seriously. 
No pool that was the only negative 
Having a kitchenette helped 
Would definitely stay again

title: Amazing hotel!
text: This hotel was referred to us and  by far exceeded our expectations....besides the excellent location which is close to everything, the entire staff is welcoming friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us.. Linda in the back office of reservations took the time to find us the perfect room to meet our wants and needs and to work remotely...Rooms were very clean and well equipped with everything you could possibly need.. lots of closet space and overall the rooms are spacious which is hard to find in the city..had a full refrigerator and freezer kitchen area and suprisingly  you never had to wait for the elevator! .It felt like home. It has a rooftop that opens up to the skyline and serves a great breakfast or brunch as well as lively at night for happy hour or dj later on ...Such an unbelievable time there and we already rebooked! Highly recommend for business or pleasure!

title: Fantastic experience
text: The staff was amazing!  The food options were very good and I found the room to be extremely comfortable. I was very pleased with my stay.  The view from the rooftop bar was a great welcome to my first stay in New York. I had a blast!

title: Fantastic room in a great location
text: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  Room was beautifully furnished and equipped.  Bed was very comfortable.  Location is fantastic for exploring NYC.  Everything was very clean and well maintained.

title: Birthday Relaxation
text: I Kimberly, spent a lovely time in the one bedroom luxury suite. Upon arrival we were greeted promptly and assisted with valet parking and  our luggage.  The room was spacious with all necessary amenities. The bed was fluffy and extremely comfortable. We stopped by for late night drinks at the roof top bar. Wonderful experience and look forward to returning.

title: ZERO PRIVACY (not respected by management) and HUGE city noise
text:
We are a private family, due to some celebrity of one member. This was made clear upon check in, and despite “please do not disturb” provided signs, people entered our room with no notice. 
Should they need to enter the room, all they needed to do was to let us know. 
They do not respect their own rules,
and despite COVID-19 being on the rise in NYC, they not only do not require guests to wear masks, but do not require this simple thing of staff.

title: Excellent in every way
text: This was my first time staying at the Kimberly Hotel and it did not disappoint. The suite was huge and well appointed. The staff went out of their way to be helpful.  This is now my favorite place to stay while visiting NY.  Excellent location also.

title: Reliably good
text: I am a regular visitor staying usually several times a year. Mid-town East side is not by itself a "trendy and hot" area but unless you are looking for that  the hotel is conveniently located and a great welcoming place to stay. It has the benefit of being small by comparison with many others, dedicated staff and a nice rooftop terrace for breakfast and drinks. I was delighted that it survived the Covid crisis. If you are looking for a bit of more space to relax or store your "shopping bounties" go for a suite. It is worth the extra money.

title:
Kimberly Hotel 
145 E 50th St. 
New York, NY 10022
text:
Fantastic spot! Walking distance to everything in Mid town Manhattan. 

Staff is friendly & courteous, pleasure to speak with. 

Rooms are comfortable and relaxing..Rooftop bar is amazing and fun!  

Highly recommend.

title: Elegant Hotel and Very Pleasant Stay
text: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Kimberly.   Upon checking in, the fellow at the front desk upgraded us to a one bedroom suite on the 12th floor which was very comfortable.   We faced the front of the building and found it quiet in the evening for the two nights we were there.  The bed was very comfortable and the various amenities like robes and slippers were nice.  Upstairs on the penthouse level  you get a nice view and can enjoy drinks in the evening and breakfast.  Overall, a very pleasant stay at an elegant hotel.

title: Has lost its charm
text: Room service forgot a portion of my order. Charcuterie is little cubes of cheese.  Handheld showerhead not working. Balcony door barely opened. No priority for rooftop for hotel guests. Musty smell in room.

title: Excellent Hotel and Location
text: The Kimberly Hotel is in a safe and convenient location to Times Square. You are away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Spacious rooms and excellent customer service. We loved having a sit down breakfast on the rooftop.  Our favorites were the doorman and server on the rooftop. This hotel is great for families, food, and an amazing trip to the city!

title: Perfect Midtown Hotel
text: I booked the lowest tier room as I was there for only one night.  Wow.  HUGE by NYC or any other standard.   The kitchen was the same as my first NY apartment.  Two closets! Robes. Immaculate.  Friendly staff from start to finish.  I found the rooftop bar too noisy to enjoy in the evening but it was perfect for breakfast.  Truly felt pampered.  Room 10A was super quiet. And all for $250 all in.  I will definitely be back.

title: NYC The way it should be!
text: We have been to New York many times and have stayed at many nice hotels. This trip was a 2 day 1 night visit so we decided to stay somewhere new in our favorite section of NY. Kimberly did not disappoint. Elegant with top notch service to the point where everyone we encountered in the lobby knew our names. The rooms and large for New York standards and come appointed with gorgeous old world furniture and wonderful touches like robes, slippers, umbrellas and a lovely wet bar. The rooftop bar has spectacular views and has a retractable ceiling for weather. Be sure to make a reservation if you want to sit down. This hotel has everything you would expect from a luxury NY boutique hotel. Location is perfect near ess a bagel and  subway. We will be back!

title: Excellent hotel in NYC
text:
We visit family every few months in NYC.
After reading the many positive reviews of The Kimberly, we decided to stay there during our last trip to the city. It was an excellent choice. When a problem came up, they addressed it immediately, and accommodated us. Everyone was polite, friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Kirt, Sadie and Gregory for taking care of us.
We look forward to our next visit.

title: Incredibly welcoming
text:
We were in New York to meet with my cancer doctors at Sloan Kettering and chose to stay at the Kimberly.  As you can imagine, this is incredibly stressful. But the moment that we pulled up to the Kimberly, the doorman (I think his name was Mark) made us feel like we were the most important people in the world.  That feeling continued throughout the entire staff.  I know we weren't but sometimes I felt like we were their only guests. The room was very comfortable and the location at Lexington and 50th could not be more convenient.  

I can't say enough good things about the Kimberly.  We have to go back in 4 months and we will definitely stay there again.

title: Great convenient clean
text:
The important assets of a hotel are the people who you interact with. The Kimberly staff are courteous, helpful and go above and beyond of what is required. From reservations to check in to dining to getting information. 
It’s ideally located. Easy access to taxis, the subway or Uber. The restaurants in the hotel are great and there are also nice ones within walking distance. 
Would I return. Hands down YES. 
THANKS KIMBERLY. IT WAS GREAT. !!!!!!!

title: Can’t wait to return
text:
Another wonderful stay at The Kimberly! We’ve been coming here once or twice a year since the nineties, and it’s always a pleasure. Excellent Midtown location, very ample well appointed suites, and the nicest staff. I’ve been to some nice hotels where the staff is clearly not very interested in the clientele. Like once you’ve checked in it’s everyone for himself. Not so here!
Everyone from the doormen to the managers is courteous and helpful, and will go out of their way to make your stay pleasant.  
Can’t wait for our next stay!

title: Big Bang for the Buck
text:
Big Bang for your Buck! We stayed in a double bed suite. Rooms and suites with double beds are hard to come by in NYC. Large comfortable suite even had a balcony! Kitchenette and also a sink area next to the bathroom so two sinks which was nice since it was two gal friends traveling. Comfortable beds and thick cozy robes.
Staff very, very polite and professional. They aim to please! Doorman retrieved a cab for us when we needed one. Upstairs rooftop bar is fantastic with a wonderful night view of the iconic Chrysler Building. A great place to unwind for a drink and a small bite to eat after pounding pavement all day and also nice to go up to the rooftop for a late night-cap. 
Great Midtown location. Easy walk to Central Park and the MET. 
As other reviewers have stated it is a bit dated but clean.  I very much doubt you will find anything better then the Kimberly for the money in this location.

title: Kimberly friendliness
text:
The Kimberly is well located in Midtown East Manhattan
We are acquainted with the neighborhood as we had a pied a terre that we gave up during the Pandemic

It is a short walk to 5th avenue

It is a quick crosstown bus or cab ride to the theatre district

Close to 2nd avenue which is loaded with restaurants & bars

The Kimberly itself has 3 excellent  dining rooms

Our room was quite spacious, clean & comfortable

The staff was super friendly & welcoming

title: We love the Kimberly!
text: I have stayed with my family in this hotel 3 times--twice at Christmastime (pre-COVID) and once in the summer (post-COVID). All 3 occasions have been wonderful.  The service and amenities are great and it is located in an area of NY with easy access to Subway, restaurants, pharmacies, local attractions, etc. The only downside is regular NYC street noise that can be variable at night.  Otherwise, I highly recommend!

title: Our new home away from home
text: Our kids live in the city so we visit a couple of times a year. We like a suite, with frig and coffee maker. Thus, we usually end up spending way too much! Not so at the Kimberly. The room was bigger than any of our daughter’s Manhattan apartments! While other midtown hotels haven’t been able to staff up and open, the Kimberly was fully staffed with incredibly sweet and responsive people. But the food was the best part! We enjoyed room service our first night, and everything was delicious! Sunday breakfast in the rooftop restaurant overlooking the Empire State Building capped off a great weekend.

title: We had a lovely time celebrating our first anniversary!
text:
We were married on zoom during the pandemic of 2020 and we celebrated our first anniversary at the Kimberly. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel staff were very friendly. 

Only a few negatives (this is a review, after all). We loved the heart-shaped tub, but the whirlpool jets didn’t work and there should have been some grab-bars to make it a bit easier to get in and out of the tub.

There were no room service menus in the room when we arrived. But we called for some and they arrived right away. The food was delicious. And there was no dessert menu. So we called again, and then immediately a dessert menu was delivered. And the desserts were excellent!

The breakfast area on the top floor of the building has a lovely view of the local area. We discovered that there was no complimentary  breakfast. In a non-pandemic situation, we learned, that there would be a breakfast buffet. But we’re not quite out of this yet, are we? So, not a big deal. 

But it was another thing about the breakfast that annoyed me. The menu said “fresh squeezed juices.“ So I ordered a fresh grapefruit juice. And the juice that arrived was obviously fresh out of a can! So I politely said to the waiter “Excuse me, this isn’t  fresh squeezed. Do you have any fresh squeezed juice?“ And then waiter dutifully returned with some lovely fresh squeezed juice and apologized. What were they thinking, that I wouldn’t notice the difference? No biggie, just FYI. 

To sum up, this is a very lovely elegant hotel with old world charm.

title: Recent visit
text: The hotel has that old charm. Unfortunately, it lead to me sweating for 2 out of 3 nights as the room got up to 77 degrees at times. Once again it’s very old and the air conditioner proved that so be careful staying here in the summer. Talked to front desk 5 times over 2 days and had a repair man come up who said it would be fixed immediately. It was not. For $1,400 over 3 nights I think you would be better of at a place that can provide the basics. Maybe I was unlucky, but they did not offer me anything to compensate for the 2 out of 3 nights being pretty uncomfortable. Great location and the staff is nice. But will probably go elsewhere on my next visit.

title: Long over due visit to NYC
text:
Has been many years since our last visit to NYC and the Kimberly but like good quality wine......Gets better with the years.

All associates are amazing as always and glad to see many of the faces that have been there for years

Mr Perezic, please forward a big shout to all your staff.

Regards,

Domingo C.

title: Another Wonderful Experience
text: From the moment Gregory greets you at the curb you will feel right at home at the Kimberly. Check in is actually easy and fun due to the wonderful staff. My wife and I love the one bedroom suite with a private balcony. As usual, the room was immaculate and comfortable, service was five star and the price was right. This room is 3x the size of your average NYC hotel accomodation and in many cases, less expensive. It doesn't get any better than that. Our go to place in NYC! And...the rooftop restaurant and bar was awesome!

title: Fun in NYC
text: Wonderful time spent at Kimberly. Super staff. All working there were extremely welcoming and polite as professional. Nice comfortable, clean room. Great rooftop bar!I would highly recommend it a d look forward to a return.

title: Rude, unprofessional, and racist doorman ever!!!!
text:
June 10,2021, @8.55pm : we usually can walk in to “upstairs to the bar,”  So far this is the worst!!! Door man that I ever seen! We just want to have a great time! But this doorman ruin our time! He is so rude to my sister and the way he treats us likes we are not the guests, we are just some random Asians and not know anything !! He is really unprofessional, rude ! , and racist guy I have met! I really disappointed to your hospitality. All he has to said “please come back at 9.30 because we have a private event! So we would completely understand. I would recommend before you put someone as your representative and represent your venue, you should train them how to talk and treat the guests!!! 
Looking forward to hear it from you venues, 
Nowadays, We already have issue enough about “Asian hate” I dnt think your venue would be one of them…

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Outstanding hotel!!! The service , the room, the location and the staff . Everything was walking distance . Times Square is a 15 min walk away.  Nothing I asked for was left unanswered. We checked in past midnight and they made sure we had water and bathrobes, slippers and everything ready . In the Morning they made sure we had great coffee in our rooms ready to make. Wolfgangs Coffee is delicious  - I know coffee :) and no hotel coffee has ever met my standard of coffee taste except this one. The room was so spacious. The hotel has a 1930’s vibe and it is breathtaking. I have stayed in many hotels but the Kimberly is by far the best I’ve ever stayed in. You get what you pay for and much much more! It’s in Manhattan but away from all the noise so you get a great nights sleep in their comfortable beds. The door man was always smiling and making small talk , making sure we are taken care of . Sadie at the front desk was our go to person , she’s one lady I will never forget :) so nice and welcoming !! She made sure that when We left the hotel at night,  housekeeping would have cleaned our room by the time we came back. No matter the time! The terrace upstairs is breathtaking with its views and they even give complimentary snacks even if you don’t buy an alcohol beverage! Their bistro downstairs has authentic dishes and so does the breakfast diner next door. To top it off, our small balcony looked over 50th avenue. Perfect if you want to just sit down outside in privacy. The Kimberly hotel is my go to place when I come back!!!

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
Location is perfect, staff were all friendly, polite and helpful.  Only had two issues with our stay.  Tub stopper didn't work, was advised to pull the stopper out and stuff a washcloth in there.  I did but the amount of hair I pulled out was pretty gross.  Also, when I asked for a room service menu, was advised it would be sent up but I never got it.   Other than this it was great.  

There was street construction going on and it was LOUD and constant from 8am-12pm when we checked out.  That's of no fault to The Kimberly, just a note.

title: Didn't want to leave
text: We booked a one night get away at the Kimberly last minute and loved every minute of it.  I didn't want to leave.  We booked a King one bedroom suite.  Very roomy with a little kitchen and living room.  The bed was very comfortable.  We went to the rooftop for drinks and had a lovely time.  Unfortunately it was pouring rain so the roof was closed but you can tell that on a nice clear night it would be perfect.

title: Wonderful Stay.
text:
The hotel and staff were amazing, and we can not wait to come back.  The rooms were always clean, and the staff was very accommodating.  They could not do enough for us, and they always had a smile on their faces.
Larry Goldfarb

title: Fabulous hotel in great location
text:
Every time we stay at the Kimberly Suites Hotel we feel like family. The staff is so welcoming. The rooms are fabulous with great beds and the most wonderful linens. The decor makes me think I am in a fine Parisian home. It is great to have a kitchen with coffeemaker and dishes and refrigerator in the heart of Manhattan. 
The Upstairs Lounge on the 30th floor has incredible views and great cocktails and food.
Our room was sanitized and sealed.
Cannot wait to return.

title: Our home away from home
text: It was wonderful to come back to the Kimberly Hotel. As usual we had an amazing stay from the moment we were greeted by Harry to Ymer who took such good care of us at Breakfast. Rooms are immaculate and every member of the team were so kind and professional. This will always be the only hotel we will stay in NYC. Thank you!

title: Weekend getaway
text:
immaculate everything. Staff was the greatest , friendliest ever! Food was exquisite ! The view from my room balcony of Night time Nyc was exactly what i was looking for!
Looking forward to visiting again and I will tell all my friends about the great experience I had

title: Great to be back at  The Kimberly
text: Went to the Kimberly for the first time in over a year.  My favorite hotel in NYC.  It was great to see faces I recognized (the door man and the person that checked us in.)  Had dinner at the hotel restaurant.  It was delicious.  I will be back soon!

title: Poor service
text:
The alarm clock in the room went off in the middle of the night (5.15). When I told this to the staff they said 'you have already payed so nothing we can do there, but we'll talk to the manager'. I never heard back so decided to call them myself. They said they tried to call (a lie, as I had no missed calls) and will give me a discount next time I'm in NYC without mentioning any number.  

The hotel itself was fine, but this is just rude and bad service, i never plan to visit again. Specially for this price you'd expect so much more.

title: Best bed EVER
text: I only stay here when I’m in town. I love it here. Spacious suite and the jacuzzi tub waiting after walking around all day. The bed and sheets are the best part. I haven’t woken up stiff and achy like I usually do. I want this bed! I want these sheets! It’s clean, friendly and the perfect location. The doormen are super nice too.

title: Another Wonderful Stay at The Kimberly
text: In the middle of everything, with the type of amenities I need, this hotel never fails to please. The staff is extremely professional and are always at the ready should you need anything. It has the feel of a much smaller hotel and it is always a great feeling to return.

title: Great hotel
text: Wonderful and friendly staff and very clean and big rooms. You can get a drink or brunch Upstairs at the Kimberly. Highly recommend both the hotel and going to the Upstairs! The staff made sure we had a great trip!

title: Highly recommend
text:
Highly recommend, we stay in the hotel every time we visit New York and always enjoy the stay. 
Great location
Great service
Nice rooms 
Friendly hotel staff 
Feels like home
The roof top is wonderful, great place to meet friends

title: Wonderful staff
text: We needed to visit for medical reasons and chose this hotel for size and convenience. The rooms were clean and ample with an old NYC decor. The entrance unloading area is quite small but the lobby is a good size. The staff was friendly and helpful from the beginning of our stay until the end. Two restaurants right in the building were handy. One was very expensive and the other moderate. The only problem was the 50th street noise level was terrible and prevented a restful sleep. Construction went on all night. Next time I’d ask for a room in another part of the building. While valet parking is offered you really have to take the car and pick it up around the block. Price is moderate for NY standards.

title: Best hotel experience we have ever had.
text:
We have been searching for a boutique hotel to call home when we visit our NYC daughter.  Having stayed at other hotels over the last couple of years, we always had a rushed hotel experience, nothing special and mostly disappointing.  Then we found The Kimberly Hotel.  I almost hesitate to share our experience because we want to keep it our secret.  However we feel that they deserve to be recognized as the superior establishment that they are.   Hands down, it was a superb encounter from start to finish.   From the moment we checked in, every single staff member was warm, kind, helpful, and knowledgeable.  Special recognition should be given to Gregory,  Kirt, and Sedia.  We enjoyed lunch twice at the Bistango and our food was not only beautifully presented but excellent as was our server, Erin. 
 She was smart, charming and knowledgeable and she made our dining experience even more enjoyable.   We enjoyed drinks at the Upstairs which has beautiful city views and highly recommend a visit there after dark.  One of our best experiences was finishing an evening at the Empire Steakhouse with after-dinner drinks.  The steakhouse is in a beautiful venue, an old opera house, adjacent to The Kimberly.  It was another beyond compare experience which includes wonderful conversations with the owner, Jack and manager, Deca.   Their generosity and kindness capped off a birthday evening for our daughter.  Though they were no longer serving dinner they surprised our daughter with a complimentary birthday tiramisu along with candle and sang happy birthday to our daughter.  Our only regret with the Empire Steakhouse is that we didn't have dinner there, a mistake we will remedy next time in NYC as the reviews for the food are outstanding.   Onto the accommodations at The Kimberly.  We stayed in an Executive One Bedroom Suite and once again thrilled beyond words.   From the decor and bookcase filled with an interesting variety of books, to the comfy couch and bed, everything about it was lush and a level of its own, not to mention clean clean clean, setting another high standard against COVID.  We felt that we could easily live in the room.  Another premium level of service worth mentioning that is that each time we made an extra request for something, towels, conditioner, etc. we had it in minutes.  I don't remember a  time that any hotel was that efficient when we have made extra requests.  Another fun aspect, not necessarily the highest priority but important, was the efficiency of elevators at the hotel.  There are two and they always arrived so quickly!  We cannot count the number of times we have had to wait for elevators at hotels.  Too many.  I believe I have run out of beautiful words to describe this hotel experience.

title: Mr & Mrs Duncan
text: My wife and I loved the service and our room. We visited the Kimberly for her birthday weekend. It was a surprise so she was totally floored. Her only disappointment was that there were no smart TVs and very limited cable tv channel options and I was hoping to have a better view from the balcony.  Nonetheless, it was a beautiful and memorable weekend.  We loved the jetted tubes which was ultra-relaxing after running around the city all day.  We are already planning our next stay-cation visit.

title: Getaway
text: Had a wonderful stay at The Kimberly! Great location, fun rooftop terrace bar and two great restaurants on site. We love Gregory and Harry and the wonderful man that checked us in. We were always welcomed with smiles. Clean and good price easy walk to everything! Will definitely go back!

title: Best of the best service and staff !
text: I have never written a review on trip advisor before, but because of my experience with the Kimberly hotel and the staff I felt I had to tell my story. My wife and I stay in Manhattan twice per month for mini getaways, we always stay at the best 5 star hotels in the city, one we love in particular is currently closed, so in my search for another place to stay we came across the Kimberly. I made the reservation online and was pleasantly surprised by the price, very competitive. A few days before the trip I had called the hotel to ask a question about the fitness center, I was greeted by the general manager, Mujo Perezic, I had asked him if the fitness center had a rowing machine ( crazy question, but I row every day ) he explained it did not have a rowing machine, then he went on to say he would try to get one before our arrival...I said of course, please it’s ok, I was just curious. We hung up and I was surprised at how thoughtful he was, upon my arrival, I meet Mujo at the desk and he recognizes my name and greets me by my name ! Then he explains the rowing machine is in the fitness center, set up and waiting for me ! What ? This is the extra. Over and above service you can expect from this amazing hotel and staff. The rooms were spotless, clean, elegant and spacious, the young lady at the desk Sadie could not do enough for us, the doorman we attentive and polite, the manager in the rooftop restaurant was amazing getting us a table, the entire experience was top notch and unbelievably great, they treat you like family. We had dates booked for June at our regular place but we canceled them, we will stay with our new Kimberly family ! Thank you...the Fulco’s

title: Sisters trip to NYC
text: From the moment we arrived at the Kimberly we felt comfortable and at home.  Gregory warmly greeted us at the door.  He and Harry were so nice to us.  We love all of the staff.  They take very good care of you.  The location is perfect.  We loved being able to walk everywhere.  We will definitely be back:)

title: WONDERFUL STAFF!!!
text:
The Hotel is very well located, very clean and comfortable, but the best thing in this hotel is the wonderful staff. 
All the staff were really welcoming, professional and willing to help in any way they could. 
Thanks for making my stay very pleasant.
C. ESTRADA

title: Great location, great service, great rooftop bar
text: NYC is really quiet and really different during Covid but the Kimberly didn’t disappoint. We had a lovely trip and because the hotel wasn’t crowded we received amazing service. The rooftop bar is a perfect spot for pre-and post dinner drinks. Right in Midtown Manhattan you can’t go wrong here

title: Didn’t love Kimberly
text:
While the room itself was...ok, the check-in experience was not at all welcoming.  Lobby area decor seemed out of place in NYC...very gaudy and cheap looking.  In my  interactions with Hotel staff  they did not demonstrate hospitality I would have expected and appreciated.  One afternoon I went up to the restaurant for the happy hour and to read my book and 5-6 of the hotel staff were grouped around the appetizers, eating, talking and laughing, with no acknowledgment from any of them when I walked in, although I know several of them saw me walk in.  After a few minutes of sitting by the window trying to read my book, I ended up leaving because it was just too noisy.

Typically we stay in more upscale hotels, but on this particular trip we had traveled a lot during the year and I was trying to be a little more frugal.  For me, the hotel is a very important part of the travel experience.  I have decided that the next time we go to NYC we will stay somewhere else.

title: Business Owner
text: I had One Bedroom Suite, I really enjoyed the suite, clean, and stylish. The staff were so friendly, and the location was nearby everything that I needed. I woUld refer this hotel to all of my friends.Thank you.

title: Wonderful time at the Kimberly - they’ve done a great job welcoming visitors
text: With minor hesitation, we traveled to Manhattan from California. We were pleasantly surprised how well the city has dealt with the COVID challenges. At all times we felt safe and were reassured of the hotel’s safe practices. Although many places are closed, many are open as well. Central Park was fabulous as always, we ate in restaurants that may have been impossible to get into during regular tourist season. The rooftop lounge at the hotel is open and lovely as ever. We had cappuccinos on the rooftop each morning while contemplating our next move. If you go, say hi to Arian and Ymir, the best hosts ever!!

title: Imagine!!!!!
text:
Amazing stay
Megan was super helpful & assisted us extremely well! She handled everything fast and with ease. The hotel itself is great, very clean, up-kept and away from the noise versus being directly in manhattan.
Read less

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: Our hotel suite was just as descripted on the hotel's website and it did not disappoint at all!  The extra room of having a suite on an extended stay is highly recommended albeit it would have been nice to have a larger bathroom but there were "side storage" places that helped and the bathroom size was normal for most extended stay properties.  The balcony was great to get a breath of fresh air too with table and chairs and nice view from the 26th floor!  The pent house "Upstairs" rooftop was aesthetically very pleasing as was the outside "garden nook" just adjacent.  The modern small gym had everything for basic machine exercise plus refrigerated gym towels!  And last, but certainly not least, the hotel staff was quite outstanding!  Everyone was very professional (the ever so helpful Reservations Supervisor, Doorman, Bell Hop, Front Desk & all Restaurants) yet so cordial and attentive.  Honestly, I cannot list one thing that was amiss other than wishing the mini frig had an ice maker, but then the Front Desk delivered an ice bucket when requested so really, not one thing to complain about! :)

title: Highly recommend
text:
Very nice hotel, clean and comfortable rooms ,best location, feels like home.
Hotels stuff very efficient and welcoming. 
Upstairs bar very chic, hotel restaurants serve  very good steak and Italian food.

title: Beautiful hotel & great location
text:
We stayed at The Kimberly over Thanksgiving in November/December 2019. I heavily research all accommodation and this delivered. Great size suite for a small family, with kitchen, living area, bedroom and good size bathroom. We had a lovely suite facing the front of the hotel/street (definitely request this if available as the other side is not as nice). Noise was not bad and the bed was divine and a beautiful sleep was had. Gregory the doorman is fantastic and my son still talks about how much he liked Gregory to this day. 

The major downside we had was my daughter left behind a teddy bear which is very sentimental to us. They didn't contact me to advise it had been left behind but when I contacted them they said they had it. I asked for it to be sent back to us due to the sentimental value. They said I would need to send through my credit card details which I have never been asked to do at other hotels but then they came back with a quote of $200 AUD for a small stuffed teddy bear to be posted!! I said I would arrange a courier to pick it up instead (which I did) and I never heard back from them. 

I called, emailed and contacted via Instagram and still to this day have never been contacted back. I spent thousands of dollars staying at this hotel for several nights and I feel so upset that they didn't bother to get back to us even though they have been updating Instagram regularly. I understand there has been a lockdown but we still haven't been contacted back since March. Great hotel but I still don't know where our teddy is at! If someone at the hotel reads this please make contact!

title: Beautiful hotel with impeccable service
text: My brother got married in NYC, and family from near and far stayed at The Kimberly Hotel for the long weekend. It could not have been a more wonderful experience. The rooms were clean as can be and beautifully appointed. The staff was kind, friendly, attentive, informative, and always went the extra mile to help us with our bags, bring requested amenities to our rooms, and assist us in hailing cabs or getting safely into an Uber. The hotel was the perfect proximity to delicious restaurants and our favorite bagel spot in the city–– Essa! Brunch on the rooftop of the hotel was delicious with such a comfortable, enjoyable ambience. We can't thank The Kimberly Hotel staff enough for making it such a magical weekend for all of us. We can't wait to come back again!

title: Great Neighborhood Gem in a Prime Location
text: We've stayed there several times. My favorite area of NYC is Central Park South, located just blocks away. So are St. Patrick's, The UN, Rock Center and, of course, 5th Avenue. We've always stayed in one of their suites, which are spacious, and come with well equipped kitchens. The have a very nice rooftop bar with [side] views of the East River and Chrysler Bldg., among other things. The front desk people and doorman have always been gracious and attentive.

title: Comfortable hotel well positioned to see the sights
text:
Pros:
Comfortable well furnished bedroom in traditional style
Very comfortable bed
Easy to control heating in the room
Modern refurbished bathroom 
Friendly helpful staff
Good central position

Cons:
We were on the 7th floor at the front of the hotel and room wasn’t very sound proof - lots of noise from outside all night made it hard to sleep well 
As my daughter was 18 years old we were not allowed to sit in the hotel bar after 5pm in the evening. That is the law apparently which I hadn’t been aware of, so just wanted to make other visitors from outside of the US aware 
Small thing but very easy for the hotel to fix - it wasn’t possible to make tea in the room - no kettle and no milk. Perhaps only Brits would be bothered by that ;-)

Overall a good hotel which I could recommend

title: Girls Getaway To City...
