text: Ralph the doorman greeted us upon arrival and was beyond delightful! Sadie at the front desk could not have been delightful and upgraded us to a suite! Amazing staff, large rooms and quiet! Highly recommend The Kimberly Hotel!! We will be back!

title: A few days in NYC
text: Second stay at this East Midtown hotel. It’s conveniently located for a tourist or shopping visit although the interior is a little dated and not really to European taste. Great rooftop bar with views (a little pricey but that goes with the territory I guess) and amazing staff. Cannot fault the service or positive attitude of the smiling staff one bit and especial thanks to Bijou on the front desk! I’d have rated 4 stars on the basis of the staff alone but tired decor brings it down unfortunately. Amazing staff, good value for money with great location - just needs a refresh.

title: Another amazing stay!
text:
The Kimberly is my favorite hotel in NYC. It is conveniently located, the staff is attentive, the rooms are well appointed, and the food is delicious. I feel pampered in every way.
Can’t wait to return!

title: A wonderful New York Hotel!
text: This was our first stay in any New York hotel. What a great place to stay! They have everything covered from you car, meals and a very comfortable room. We came to the city for our nephew's wedding and The Kimberly was only two miles from our destination at the Water Club. Breakfast in the Penthouse was a treat with great food and views. We would easily stay here again and we certainly do recommend it!

title: Great Hotel - Only problem they won't guarantee the room you book and pay for!
text: This has been my go to hotel in NY.  However, I think I'm going to start staying elsewhere.  While making reservations, you choose a room and pay the price for the a specific room (all rooms are different prices) and when you check in they tell you your room you booked my not be available.  Well, when I book an one bedroom suite with a reservation, then I expect an one bedroom suite, if I book a standard room then I should get a standard room. That's what a reservation is for- to reserve the room I booked.  Maybe they need to do a better job of keeping up with what is booked to ensure they have the room available when you get there.  I hate this because it is my hotel of choice but it's not worth the hassle anymore. Besides that - it is a great hotel, great location and staff.

title: Fab hotel in mid-East side
text: Classic hotel with giant suites and perfect service.  Close to excellent restaurants.  Taxis were very easy to get.  Staff were most gracious and accommodating.  Bar on top floor was outstanding.  Buffet breakfast was good if not up to Singapore standards (few are).

title: Weekend in New York
text: This is just a fabulous boutique hotel located in midtown Manhatten!!  The staff is top notch from the minute you arrive..  We only spent one night and I was so sorry that I did not book 2 nights!!  We had a gorgeous one bedroom suite with a terrace and an amazing view!!  The bed was so comfortable and the amenities included a Nepresso machine with a kitchen/bar!!  There is a rooftop terrace that is a must try experience.  They serve breakfast there as well as drinks/appetizers in the evening.  There is also steakhouse that I did not try so I have a good reason to return!!  Highly recommend.  You will not be disappointed!!

title: Girls night to celebrate 50th bday
text:
Great location, room exceeded our expectations!  Comfy beds and spacious living room area. Had brunch upstairs - food and drinks were great! Staff couldn’t have been nicer and customer oriented.  The Kimberly really seems to have your enjoyment as their goal and they reach it!
Will definitely stay again!

title: Sister’s trip
text:
Amazing stay. Upgraded to a suite upon arrival by Sadie who was very friendly and made us feel immediately welcomed. The accommodations were top notch! The staff were wonderful!! Ralph is outstanding, He is a wealth of knowledge and very helpful. Ralph truly made our stay memorable!!! Very satisfied and will definitely stay here anytime we come back to NYC!!!!! 

As a side note, Upon our departure the power lift gate on our 2018 vehicle decided it was a good time to stop working. Ralph without us asking went and got the hotel engineer to assist us, they had us on the road quickly. The staff here went above and beyond for us, we are very appreciative of their efforts in helping us! Highly recommend staying here!!!

title: A Terrific Find in NYC!
text: I selected the Kimberly after hours of online research and hoped that it would live up to the description and good reviews. In fact, it exceeded them in every way-- service, space, amenities, location and comfort. For the price of a small room at most mid-range hotels, my husband and I enjoyed a one-bedroom suite with plenty of closets, a wet bar, and a sizable marble bathroom with two sinks, thick terry robes and a Jacuzzi tub. How nice to have enough room to unpack, fast elevators, twice-daily maid service, friendly staff and a comfy king-size bed with high-quality linens. The Kimberly will be our first choice for future visits to NYC!

title: Excellent séjour en famille à NYC
text:
Nous avons passé une semaine dans cet hôtel pendant les fêtes de noël. L'emplacement est très bien dans le Midtown. Nous étions dans une chambre familiale et nous avons été surclassés dans une magnifique suite au 22 eme étage en raison d'un problème d'ascenseur dans le bâtiment annexe de l'hôtel ou nous logions. Ce qui révèle le bon sens commercial de cet hôtel.  
Le service et l'accueil sont très professionnels et à l'écoute. L'hôtel est très propre et les chambres disposent de frigidaires et d'éviers très pratiques pour les petits déjeuners et les déjeuners sur le pouce.

title: Highly recommended
text: The Kimberly offered top notch accommodation in a very convenient location and for a reasonable price.  Staff were also very helpful and attentive.  I highly recommend The Kimberly for anyone looking for accommodation in midtown Manhattan.

title: Lovely hotel
text: We stayed here for five nights on a birthday treat to NYC. The location was great for central park, MOMA, shopping and everything in between. All the staff were smiling and helpful, unlike some places where you feel invisible.  We walked for miles every day, so it was lovely to come back to a warm, comfortable room, piping hot bath with lovely toiletries, and an amazingly comfortable bed. Thank you. (And the icing on the cake for me was my wish for snow in central park was granted)

title: NYC in the winter
text: The Kimberly Hotel Bell Staff met our Uber as we pulled to the curb and the next three days we enjoyed all of the amenities. The onsite fitness center was spacious so thus never overcrowded. We never had to wait for a machine. The food was great and the staff were always going overboard to answer our every question and direct us to activities we were unaware were there. Made the trip really great.

title: Would not stay anywhere else!
text: I stayed for two nights in a one bedroom, two bath suite on the second floor that felt more like a suburban apartment than a hotel in a great part of Manhattan. But what is even more impressive than the spacious, beautiful accommodations is the service. From check in to the turn-down service and everything in between, I could tell that the employees took pride in their work and put their guests first. You can't ask for more.

title: Awesome location, Friendly Service
text: My husband and I have stayed at the Kimberly multiple times now as it has become our favorite hotel in the city. We are always greeted by friendly and helpful staff members. The rooms have an old world charm and are spacious and beautiful. I always sleep very well in the comfortable beds and look forward to our next stay each time we depart. The location is excellent and only a short walk from Grand Central Station if you arrive by train. It is also very easy to walk to Rockefeller Center and Central Park just to name a couple of sites. Make sure to check out the hotel's restaurant, Bistango, during your stay. It is fantastic!

title: Large Suite Rooms
text: Large Suite rooms with a refrigerator and real coffee pot!  Plenty of room to spread out and get comfortable.  Everyone is friendly and helpful.  Bistango has wonderful organic food options available.  Great Hotel for a NYC stay.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
Just left today after a 4 day (3 night) stay.  Immaculate hotel and very friendly and helpful service.  We had room service which was prompt and courteous and delicious!  The doormen were always beyond helpful in getting us cabs.  The room was terrific with great views and very comfortable beds (2 room suite).

Highly recommend this hotel!  Great location as well.

title: Best Place To Stay in Midtown
text: I've had the pleasure of staying at The Kimberly quite a few times in the past several years. I return over & over again because the staff is the best; friendly and accommodating. The rooms  are beautifully decorated, with THE most comfortable beds. The location is within walking distance of a bunch of restaurants and shopping. In fact, I'm spending my birthday in the city, in the spring, and of course will be staying at the Kimberly!

title: A visit to NYC
text: We stayed at The Kimberly before and after our trip to Greece in July. We have at least one stay at the Kimberly for the last 5 years or so.  The hotel staff is always courteous, helpful, and friendly. The rooms are very comfortable and the restaurants are top notch. We highly recommend The Kimberly when visiting NYC.

title: Amazing experience
text: I had the most amazing experience at the Kimberly. The concierge, Peter, went above and beyond to make this stay a wonderful memory. His service is stellar. I would recommend the Kimberly to any of my friends and family looking for a memorable experience in New York City.

title: Elegant with Exceptional Service
text: First time to stay at The Kimberly, but no the last.  Every attention to detail. Excellent staff from top to bottom in multiple situations.  The rooms are elegantly appointed (appear completely renovated) and I can highly recommend the one bedroom suite which include a balcony outside the living area.  The staff went beyond expectations for ice, linens and coffee--making sure we were pleased.  The location is far enough away from Times Square that crowds are avoided, yet close enough to shopping that you can walk.  I will plan to stay here again.

title: Classy yet warm
text: This hotel was highly recommended by a friend and we stayed here for 3 nights. His recommendation was spot on with super soft bed linens and because we were given a high floor, we had a great view of our surroundings. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, especially the doormen who never failed to greet us whenever we left and return for the day. Highly recommended.

title: Do we really have to leave?!
text:
This hotel is deserving of my first ever trip advisor review (and we travel often)!  The service here is top notch!  Right next to the Waldorf Astoria and I don’t know why anyone would choose that over this.  My husband emailed ahead of time to let them know we are celebrating our anniversary and they went above and beyond to make us feel special during our stay.  
The suite we have is very very roomy!  Bathroom is huge, with marble floors and a big, sparkling clean tub!  Bedroom is bigger than most Manhattan hotel rooms, bed is comfy and they have four pillows on bed - two fluffy and two firmer (I’m a high maintenance pillow chooser so I appreciated this).  
It’s in a safe area, and only a four block walk to allll the action.  I will stay here again and again and nowhere else in NYC. 
Thank you, Sadie, and other staff for your kindness, for a clean hotel, for the chocolates, and helping to make our trip excellent!  Stay here, stay here, stay here!

title: Great stay!
text: Stayed in a Luxury Executive Suite for 2 nights. It was definitely luxurious!  Bed was extremely comfortable and the Frette linens are the best!  My husband and I loved going out for a long walk on the Upper East Side and strolling back through Central Park and down 5th Avenue.  Returning to a beautiful room with a cocktail from the rooftop bar is the ultimate indulgence.  Get to The Kimberly!

title: New Year Eve 2020
text: I am another great time bringing in 2020 at the Kimberly Hotel.  I have been bringing  in the New Year at Upstairs at the Kimberly since 2012 and I always have a fantastic  time. I have been staying at the hotel for the past 4 years and the staff always treat me such kindness.  I would definitely  be coming back to the  Kimberly whenever I am visiting  New York City. Actually I have celebrating NYE there NYE 2009 when Nikki Midtown was there. Now it is the Empire Steakhouse.  Thank you for all you great hospitality at the Kimberly.  Many great memories!!!!

title: Nice Hotel in Mid-town
text: This is a nice hotel in mid-town Manhattan, with a lovely roof-top lounge. The hotel is clean and customer service was very good. I really like the location in NYC. It is a good location for business and pleasure. There are many awesome attractions and restaurants close to this hotel. We had a great time at the lounge. The food and drinks are good, and it has a nice view of the  city.

title: Perfect place for families
text: I have stayed at The Kimberly Hotel numerous times...knowing the suite configuration I knew it would be perfect for my family trip to NYC....my husband and myself had one room and my daughter, son-in-law and 2 Granddaughters had another suite....that is the beauty of this hotel...the sitting area, with a pull out sofa, has doors to close it off from the bedroom...there is a small but nice kitchen space...with a refrigerator, tiny sink and microwave....many bathrooms have heated floors...many rooms have balconies...my husband and I prefer the "F" rooms...the restaurant, on the top floor serves a terrific breakfast....everyone at this hotel is just very helpful and friendly....I will say the lobby could use freshening up in terms of their decor....I dont care for faux French bu I can overlook that since the staff and rooms are so nice.

title: Spacious and Convenient Midtown Manhattan Hotel
text: One of my favorite hotels. All suites with great, comfortable space. All the amenities you would want in your room and bathroom in an atmosphere that is a nice oasis from the hustle and bustle outside. Perfect location near everything in midtown but on the east side so less hectiv than Rockefeller Plaza, Times Square or Herald Square areas. Staff is outstanding -- friendly and efficient. Highly recommend, Great rooftop bar as well is a gem and defintely worth checking out.

title: Wonderful stay
text:
Our family of four stayed at the Kimberly for four nights during the Christmas season. Our stay was lovely with a well appointed, comfortable room and courteous, attentive staff. 

We stayed in 15F - a king suite. Our room was quite large by NYC standards for two adults and two preteen children. While the view wasn’t amazing (and quite honestly, we weren’t in NYC to enjoy the views from our hotel room), the king bed and queen sleeper sofa were comfortable. The bathroom was quite large and we enjoyed the L’Occitaine toiletries. Our room was always well cleaned and restocked with towels, coffee and toiletries each day. 

The Kimberly’s location could not be any better. We walked from the hotel to just about everywhere in the city, enjoying the sights and shops along the way. When we did take the subway, the nearest stop was less than a block away. 

Overall, when looking for a conveniently located, large and affordable (by NYC standards) hotel suite for a family, The Kimberley Hotel is truly a solid option.

title: 古き良きニューヨーク
text: 古いホテルですが、それが逆に良い雰囲気を醸し出していました。ワンベッドルームにアップグレードしてくださいました。とても広い部屋に、簡易キッチンもあり文句なし！ドアマンの黒人男性がフレンドリーで、いつもニコニコと声をかけてくれて、古いハリウッド映画のようでした。

title: Great Quality/Value Ratio
text: My husband and I and our 20 yo son just returned from NYC today and I needed to write a review for The Kimberly. We didn't want to get two rooms for the three of us, but our son isn't a "little boy" anymore. :) I found The Kimberly and thought it would be good because it's an all suite hotel, but you never really know until you get there. It exceeded our expectations. The bedroom and the sitting room (with the sofa bed) both had doors so we could all have our privacy, and the bathroom was off the small entryway, so we didn't have to traverse each other's rooms to use it. Aside from the perfect suite, the service was perfect. From checkin staff to the maid staff to the bellman to the concierge, everyone had a smile on their face and was ready to help. We will be back.

title: Good and bad
text:
Our family of four stayed at the Kimberly over Christmas. I really have mixed feelings on this hotel.  There was definitely good and bad at this hotel.  
Good: 
Room size: We had a 1 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms.  The price for this size room is great and the size is good for a family.  The bed and sofa bed were both comfortable. 
Location: The proximity of the hotel to major attractions is great. Within walking distance is Rockefeller center, Times Square, Grand central station, and Central Park. 
Bad:
Cleanliness: In our first room, one of our the toilets was dirty and a dirty glass was left in the bathroom.  Upon finding this we promptly requested the room to be cleaned and were offered a new upgraded room and a complimentary breakfast the next morning.  
The next room also had a dirty bathroom.  Because it was after midnight, we decided to address it in the morning.  We then requested the room to be cleaned two additional times. Finally we had to point out the excrement stains on the toilet to the housekeeping staff before the toilet was thoroughly cleaned.  Further, we had to move a chair to accommodate the pull out sofa and found a leftover candy wrapper. Then found an eye glass case under the bed while we were doing our “final” sweep of our room before leaving. I understand a room will never be cleaned to my at home standards BUT there should be some standards.  
The elevator broke once while we were on it.  Luckily our family and another group did not get stuck on the elevator.  
The presence of a hotel manager was non existent.  It appeared that the front desk staff managed the hotel during the shift. Upon checkout another customer was upset and was voicing his concerns.  The concerns didn’t even seem to be acknowledged.  

This hotel has A LOT of potential, but right now is failing.  If you are considering this hotel based on price I would consider looking at another comparable option.

title: Christmas in NYC
text: Keep returning to the Kimberly over and over. Staff know your name, suites are roomy, clean, well appointed and private. Have stay at least 10 times. Great value for NYC and perfect location. Doormen are very helpful.

title: Great Service and Location
text:
I recently stayed here for Christmas with my brother. We originally had reservations at Archer Hotel; the room there was subpar and service anemic. A quick cancellation and new booking at Kimberly and all good. 

This was our second stay, the first being Labor Day weekend. Service is great, personal and thoughtful. I got a late check out and it was just easy. A smaller, boutique hotel, so each floor only has a few rooms. So, no noise pollution.

The location is fantastic, easy to walk everywhere. All in all a great experience after a not great experience at the Archer. In the future, I’ll keep Kimberly at the top of my list.

title: Christmas with my daughter
text: I have visited this hotel many times and each time they beat my expectations. The staff doesn’t change much so you are recognized upon arrival and most of the time greeted by name. The spaciousness and amenities  of the suites is exactly what you need after a long day of exploring the city with your kids. Plenty of space for everyone to spread out. Already planning my summer trip and won’t look to stay anywhere else but The Kimberly!

title: Love Bistango  - Gluten Free!!!
text: Passed Bistango and saw their menu said everything could be made gluten free. They weren’t kidding. Everything we tried (ate there two nights in a row) was excellent - butternut ravioli, eggplant parmigiana, meatballs and the cream of mushroom soup was the best!!!  Highly recommend for everyone but especially for gluten free eaters. Also, the staff was wonderful and very accommodating.

title: My families favorite in the city
text: We love the Kimberly.  We have stayed in the past and always come back.  Rooms are spacious, staff is very friendly.  Everything is clean and well appointed.  It is their personal attention that always makes the difference.  Leaving the hotel for the train and it was raining, a doorman quickly ran and got us an umbrella and told us to take it home.  He was most concerned with our comfort.  It definitely left a good impression.  The penthouse bar is very nice as is the restaurant.  We love having a suite and room to spread out and decompress from our time in the city.

title: Great hotel
text: My husband and I stayed The Kimberly last week. We had a Christmas party in NYC and decided to spend some time in the city. This hotel was recommended. The Kimberly was fabulous!   I cannot stay enough about the staff.  Everyone was very friendly.  The doorman was exceptional! Valet parking was so easy.  The room was spotless.  Room service was very reasonable. We had late night drinks and then breakfast at the Upstairs bar.  Table seating was easy. We will be going back.

title: Estadia Maratón NYC
text:
Vinimos con mi familia, quienes me acompañaron a correr mi primer maratón de Nueva York. El hotel muy bueno, la atención de primera, todos muy amables; perfectamente ubicado, a pasos del metro y 3 cuadras de Rockefeller Center. 
Arrendamos una habitación que en rigor era un departamento, con 2 habitaciones, living y cocina. La pieza era muy linda y cómoda, lamento no haber tomado fotos.

title: Great hotel
text:
The room was nice, however the radiator continued to make noise all night therefore I was unable to sleep well. I spoke with the manager who took care of us, which was greatly appreciated.
Will definitely stay here again

title: excellent hotel
text: the service was very friendly, they upgraded us to a suit and the location is very good. not much to add to it. Previosly we stayed at the Benjamin which is a few doors down it was also nice but significantly more expensive. I do recommend the Kimberly

title: Amazing hotel!
text:
The room was gorgeous and the staff were so wonderful. The roof top bar was amazing. The buffet breakfast was delicious. The bathroom was spacious and new as was the rest of the room. The bed was so comfortable. 
We are definitely coming back.

title: Fabulous Discovery
text: The Kimberly is my new go to hotel in NYC. It’s quiet, refined and elegant. Perfect mid town location but off the beaten path, which makes for a quiet respite. Love the boutique European feel of the hotel. The staff are the perfect balance of friendly but not obtrusive. Can’t wait to return the next time I’m in NY!

title: Upscale comfort
text: spacious room with luxury linens, comfy bed, and more.  Not our first visit. We've stayed in 2 BR suite, 1 BR suite, and King room - and have enjoyed them all.  Rooftop breakfast is fantastic. Only downside would be that we did have a non-suite rooms on lower floor with more road noise.

title: UPSTAIRS
text: He had our company Christmas party at the rooftop area called "Upstairs" and had a blast.  Attentive staff, great food, great drinks, great views....Would definitely come again.  Its a great place to hold an event.

title: Disappointing
text:
Disappointing stay. I wanted to like the hotel but was made difficult with an inattentive unfriendly front desk, roof top booked throughout - I’m understanding Xmas is busy season but not being able to access the rooftop which is considered a highlight was strange on a four night stay. The elevator was broken for hours and having alerted the hotel about this and then four hours later returning and having to navigate a five flight stair which was broken on a landing meant we had to carry our five year old child both ways which was frustrating. Room service on two occasions we were told was a ‘long wait’ without any apology, made for a added low. We felt that our room wasn’t considered priority as a double upgrade rather than a suite - given the low priority and reception received throughout. 

I know NY well and it rates as one of the lowest experiences I’ve had in the town at the price.

title: Very spacious and comfortable
text: We had a room as opposed to a suite but there was plenty of room, comfortable beds, snacks, wines, etc.  a refrigerator was a plus.  They provided a shoe shine machine and the umbrellas cane in very handy as we were there on a rainy day.  The upstairs bar was perfect with good views.

title: Great decent hotel
text: This hotel is nice! The location is a few blocks straight from Rockefeller, Time Square and Radio City, and minutes from grand central station. The location is great as you’re not by the crazy congested areas of tourist. The staff are not as friendly as you would expect but over all it is ok. The pool is 5 blocks away, massage is $150 plus $30 taxi fare.

title: Nice hotel, good location
text:
The hotel is nice, clean and in a good location for tourists. It is very traditional in design and could do with a little update. The bellboys and door staff are lovely and welcoming. 
When we checked in we were told about complimentary “afternoon tea” being served in the penthouse. Once you get up there, there is no one to tell you where to go. You have to find the little “VIP room” with your own wit. The staff milling around up there are unfriendly and uninterested. However, it was lovely up there, beautiful views. Once it becomes a bar, after 5:30, kids are no longer welcome. 
This is also where they serve a very enjoyable buffet breakfast. Our room was spacious, clean and they provided a crib for our youngest. 
Overall we liked the place and had a nice time. The kids loved the aquarium in the lobby! We would return.

title: Fantastic
text: Great location, with a wonderful staff that makes sure your needs are taken care off.  The top roof bar was exceptional! From the breathtaking view to the different cocktails it offers this a fun place to hang out with friends.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: Great staff, great location, and the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in !! Location is just about perfect with lots of amenities close by. Concierge very helpful with lots of tips and guidance.

title: Ideal para largas estadías!!!
text: La ubicación es excelente, en el Midtown de Manhattan, casi estratégico ya sea por negocios o placer. Las habitaciones son amplias, cómodas y las suites poseen un amplio balcón que no abundan en NY lo cual las hace ideales para largas estadías o si los negocios hacen que uno deba estar mucho tiempo en la habitación. El servicios en general es muy bueno y el room service rápido y de excelente calidad. Si te toca un piso superior al 20, la vita mejorar notablemente a pesar de que no sea vista abierta es muy agradable. La atención general del personal es excelente y muy considerada. He estado en dos tramos de 4 días con un viaje fuera de USA en el medio de un viaje de 20 días por negocios y con tiempo libre y realmente he recibido un trato sumamente satisfactorio que hasta incluyo considerar un pedido de piso mas alto en mi retorno en el segundo tramo de 4 días o sea no tengo ni una sola queja del Hotel. Incluyo en esto a los camareros del PH por su cordialidad y disposición. Altamente recomendable  considerando que he estado en varias oportunidades en NY en diferentes Hoteles 5 estrellas por negocios y no conocía el Kimberly. Ha sido un grato placer estar hospedado aquí y sin dudas repetiré le elección.

title: A remarkably comfortable NYC find!
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Kimberly during Thanksgiving week, 2019. We had a suite (I believe most of the rooms are suites), which for NYC was very reasonably priced. It was quite spacious, with a full living room, dining area, a functional half kitchen, as well as a large bedroom. The only room that was not large was the bathroom, which was, we felt sub-par, in terms of space. It was nicely appointed though with great water pressure in the shower.  Clearly the hotel was an apartment at one point, as there were also three(!) closets for storage and clothes. 

The other bonus was a lovely deck off of the living room which provided some fun views of mid-town and the East River in the distance. 

There is a great doorman to greet you at all hours and a 24 hour front desk as well as pretty decent room service. 

I found the staff to be courteous, responsive and on top of every detail and request that we made. 

The decor of the room was a bit dated, but absolutely clean and not worn out at all. 

Lastly, the location is amazing....right in the heart of midtown and only a block away for the 6 train. Grand Central is a quick 5 to 7 minute walk away if you don’t want to hassle transferring trains from the 6.  

We will definitely come back to the Kimberly. It felt like renting an apartment for a few days in Midtown rather than staying at a hotel. Loved it!

title: Beautiful Kimberly Hotel
text: The quiet elegance of the Kimberly Hotel is reminiscent of years gone by.  It is well appointed, and provides all the comforts required.  What makes it even more special is the staff.  Absolutely everyone we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful.  It was a delight to speak to them!  The location of the hotel is perfect - within walking distance to almost everything, yet just far enough to escape the noise of Times Square.  We will definitely return!

title: OK but dated and need to be an engineer to figure out the shower/bath combination
text: Good location, good people and great breakfast. Hotel was clean but it took both of us to open the balcony door (needed some real strength) and the shower had me beat first time. Wife and I finallly figured out the combination of the taps to get the shower working but took at least 15 minutes. Bathroom tiny and only a bath/shower so pity anyone with leg issues. Furniture dated and the hotel needs a good upgrade but after a couple of whiskies it didn't matter.

title: ANNUAL FAMILY TRIP
text: Every year i meet my sister in NYC and every year we stay at The Kimberly. It's our home away from home. We LOVE this hotel. The location is perfect for walking to all the touristy things. But what makes our stay extra special is the staff. The Doormen are always smiling and helpful with directions and grabbing a cab plus the front desk staff are lovely. I normally work with Val B from sales to get our room booked and she always goes ABOVE and beyond during our stay with an upgraded room if available and will help us with booking a table at the restaurants and the amazing roof top bar. This bar has one of the best views in NY. I would highly recommend this hotel for vacation or work trips.

title: Lovely Elegant Small Hotel in Great Location.
text: Stayed in a 1 Bedroom Suite. It exceeded our expectations! Very well appointed , Plush bedding and large sitting room with a Bar. The Staff could not have been nicer , everyone we came in contact with was warm and helpful. The rooftop bar was lovely, Can not beat the location, close to everything but still on a quite clean street,not in the crazy chaos closer to times Square. We Love this place,will never stay any place else when we are in NYC.

title: Our stay at the Kimberly hotel
text: I lived in New York for a number of years and go back several times a year. My sister and I have stayed at a number of hotels and I had wanted to try the Kimberly, given all that I had read about it. I was not disappointed. The room was large, the location was great - if only the E train had been running from Penn Station it would have a quick trip over. The fish tank in the lobby is fabulous! Planned to try one of the in-house restaurants, but we were tired and orders room service which was perfect. Would definitely stay again!

title: A Mid-Town Gem
text: We have stayed at the Kimberly before but not recently.  On this visit, we were exceptionally pleased with the hotel, our room and the service.  We had a large bedroom with many drawers, a living room, two closets and a bathroom with plenty of space for our things.  There were multiple outlets in both rooms for easy charging and WiFi that was fast.  Although there is a construction project across the street, our room was very quiet.  We would certainly stay there again.

title: Large rooms & great rooftop bar
text: This would not have been my choice but my company booked me in the Kimberly for my stay in mid-town for business.  I was incredibly surprised at the helpful staff, huge rooms and great rooftop bar.  The room was not just NYC big but big.  Great bed, unique amenities such as a shoe polisher and wet bar with microwave, and very quiet also.  On the downside, the bathroom was on the small side but nicely appointed with high-end toiletries.  The rooftop bar, with great views, is open all year as its covered in winter.  Lastly, the staff I encountered were incredible friendly and very helpful.

title: The Kimberly is our new NYC home!
text: We feel like we have found our forever NYC home. The personnel, the rooms, the location are the best in being able to enjoy the city! We will be back soon.Our daughter had rent an apt. for the week, she won’t be doing that anymore. The Kimberley will be her choice now. Thanks for your outstanding hospitality!

title: Amazing hotel in a superb location
text:
The Kimberly Hotel is located in a very centric spot, close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and around 15 minutes walking to Central Park.
The hotel is amazing, it has a nice European chic style, big rooms and a outstanding king size bed. I went with a friend and definitely both we recommend this hotel.

title: A Very Nice, Nostalgic Stay
text: This hotel looks like it was decorated in the 1970s with a strong influence from Elvis’ Graceland - down to the shoe buffer machine in our room. I was surprised there was no coin slot for magic fingers on the beds.  We found it nostalgic, and kind of hilarious.  You could see it being a location in Scarface or American Hustle.  That said, our suite was huge by NYC standards - a full sitting area, kitchenette, balcony and 4 large closets.  The three of us had plenty of room to spread out.  It was very clean.  Our double bedroom was like a tomb - no light creeping in & no street noise whatsoever.  We all slept like logs.  All staff was extremely friendly.  The location is very convenient - especially for theater goers.  I would absolutely stay here again.  I’d rather stay in a retro-style hotel than many of the new modern hotels that are cheap-looking and get worn out so fast.

title: Great stay at a great hotel
text: I’ve stayed at the Kimberly a few times now and it never disappoints. The attention to detail, care of the staff, and overall feeling you get in this hotel keep me coming back. The rooms are very spacious, something you just don’t get in many hotels in NYC. To top it off they also have a wonderful rooftop bar, with a great NYC crowd, not just tourists.

title: The best place to stay in Mid-Town
text:
I love everything about this hotel! The suites are spacious and well-appointed. The bed and pillows are comfortable. The sheets and towels are luxurious. And the staff is incredible. 

Also: the water pressure is excellent. The heating is great. The offer both daily maid service and turn-down service. And the location is fabulous! 

The hotel seems to attract and older and genteel clientele (which describes me), and I've greatly enjoyed visiting with the other guests.

If you are coming for the theaters, they are easily walkable from here. And the various old-school (that is, mom-and-pop) restaurants on 2nd Ave. are always a treat. Check my reviews on Yelp or send me a message if you want to know where to eat. 

Book this hotel for your next stay in New York. You will not be disappointed.

title: Great home base to explore the city
text:
My husband and I were here to celebrate my 50th birthday. This information was conveyed when the reservation was made directly through the hotel website. Not for nothing but a card, a glass of champagne, any sort of acknowledgement would have been greatly appreciated. The room itself was perfect for us.  Living room, bedroom, kitchenette... only downside was we faced another close building... We didnt spend a whole lot of time in the room so a view was not important to us.

The location of this hotel is great for exploring. We walked to shopping, times square, shows, central park, etc... we also utilized the subway around the block frequently.

For breakfast there is a diner a few doors down from the Kimberly. Breakfast for 2 will cost you roughly $35. Affordable.

We ate at the steak house attached in my birthday. No mention that we were celebrating any occasion and yet they brought out a wonderful complimentary dessert after our meal. That was a nice surprise. Food was fantastic and the service was great.  

We had a wonderful stay at the Kimberly and I would definetly return. The staff were kind and helpful.

title: Not a good fit for me
text:
This was a 4-night stay for business and unlike the majority of the reviewers, I’m clearly an outlier – not a place I enjoyed, and nor would I return. I’m not really a fan of boutique hotels and while there may be things to like, this hotel would not have been my first choice.

Check-in: Often, Front Desk people make or break a hotel for me. I had the pleasure (and I use that term loosely) of interacting with Christine. No hello, no smile. “May I help you?” was her initial statement. She was so practiced with her delivery that she ran through the information as though it was another weary been-there-done-that performance. I asked her to repeat her soliloquy. When I requested a room on a higher floor, we reached an impasse because she said nothing else was available except a room on a lower floor. (Note to travelers: There’s ALWAYS another/better room with a better location.)

Room: The initial room was unacceptable for a number of reasons. I am aware of the space issues in NYC and buildings do abut one another and you may not have any type of view. I’m fine not having a view, but I’m not OK looking across to an apartment building where I could almost touch and see everyone and what they’re doing. Likewise, they could peer directly into my room. I would have to keep the drapes closed at all times and as it was, there wasn’t much natural light. I returned to the Front Desk and after an extended discussion with my friend, Christine, I opted to wait for Kurt (the manager on duty) to return from his lunch break to discuss a different room option. Eventually, I landed on a lower floor with a view to 50th St. and the buildings across the street were at an appropriate distance. As an aside, some people think you want a bigger room. No, I always want the room I reserved. (Or in some cases, the prepaid room.) A bigger room doesn’t always mean better so I always stress that I want the room I reserved. Nothing more, nothing less.

Note to travelers: If you make a hotel reservation using Hotels.com or Expedia or one of the other after-market online services, you’ve made a choice based solely on price; and it doesn’t matter if you are Preferred/Gold/Premium user of those after-market sites. As such, the hotels see that you made a choice based on price and you’ll likely get the worse room (location, size, and, e.g., view to a wall) in the hotel. Sometimes you might get lucky and get a better room, but that’s rare. My reservation was made by someone using Hotels.com, and that was beyond my control.
 
The room itself was, I think, European in style. If I remember correctly, all the rooms are suites and only about 4 or 5 (maybe 6?) suites per floor. Not sure when the last update occurred, but I think it’s time to renovate the rooms. They feel a bit worn/used and rough around the edges. The room was quiet (except those early morning NYC garbage trucks, but not much anyone can do about that, but I really didn’t care). The living space had a desk (a good thing!), a couch, table, and a chair. The living space also had a sink, dishwasher, microwave, and a coffee maker (though, it hadn’t been thoroughly cleaned in a long time). On the small table was a mini bar of sorts with food items and on the first day, I had the nuts and M&Ms (which were never replaced while I was there). Off the living space was a balcony with plenty of room. However, the door to the balcony was old, frayed, and almost impossible to open and close. Where is maintenance?? The bedroom had a comfortable king bed and a loud A/C. The bathroom was of sufficient size and the better news was that the bedroom had two closets – plenty of storage space. Housekeeping was a bit annoying. I dislike stepping into the hall and if someone from housekeeping was also in the hall, they pounced: “Are you leaving your room?” Well, the “Do Not Disturb” sign was on the door so that should have been a clue. This happened on more than one occasion. 

Service: Likely the worst Front Desk hotel service I’ve had in a long time. (The doormen and the Concierge I encountered, however, were really friendly and helpful – kudos to them.) Watching the Front Desk, as I sat in the lobby one afternoon, was amusing. Christine and Andreanna (sp?) seem like (tongue in cheek) the most helpful desk attendants I’ve experienced in quite a long time. Never smiled (except when it was a smirk) and not particularly helpful when asked questions. One day (I don’t know who answered the phone and maybe it wasn’t one of them), I mentioned that the bottled water had not been refreshed in my room. “No problem,” the person said on the phone, “we’ll send some up.” Thirty (30) minutes later, I went to the front Desk to get it. Christine hands me one bottle. I asked for a second one and she hesitated. Really? Water?? After that, I picked up bottled water at Duane-Reade. I have little patience for that type of behavior. After that interaction, it was best to avoid the Front Desk whenever possible.

Service at breakfast was the worst. Breakfast takes place on the top floor penthouse. I step off the elevator and enter the space. No one is there so I can’t figure out if I’m supposed to seat myself or wait for a maître d. Finally, I just started looking for a clean place and then, poof, out of nowhere I hear “May I help you?” I ordered from the menu, which seemed to throw the waitperson off track. He reminded me that everything on the menu was at the buffet. Thank you, but not everyone wants to do a buffet. Then, the order of scrambled eggs was really a bad; unscrambled and more like a badly folded omelet. Same thing the following 2 mornings. On my last morning, I went next door to the diner breakfast. In retrospect, I should have done that all mornings and saved myself the grief.

We (members of my team) also had a late afternoon social hour at the penthouse. When we entered, I saw one other group so the place was not crowded. When we told, whoever was near, that we expected about 3 more people, she gave us this disgruntled look, pulled a “Reserved” sign of a table and motioned us to sit down. Sorry. (Not.)

Upon check-out, I was expecting the nuts to be on the final hotel bill. They weren’t so I mentioned it to the desk attendant. He created a separate bill only for the nuts. Maddening.

Just a not-so-good experience. As I mentioned to a co-worker as we headed to the airport, some hotels work for you; others do not. Let’s just say they’re probably glad I won’t be back. :-) And, please, Kimberly Hotel, no need to follow up with any canned responses. I acknowledge it was a bad match. Let’s move on.

title: Charming older hotel in Midtown East
text: Very nice older hotel. Lots of facilities available or nearby. Fast elevators. Good hotel staff and service. Nice rooftop bar. Close to Bloomingdales and other midtown hot spots. We enjoyed our stay there a lot.

title: Try This Place!
text:
Smaller hotel, friendly and accommodating staff. Two excellent restaurants and very good rooftop bar. Loved the place because it was so roomy and staff so helpful.
We had a 2 bedroom suite and absolutely loved it.
The Osso Buco in the Empire restaurant was superb.
Doormen and bell staff tops.

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
text:
We celebrated our 31st anniversary with a weekend stay at the Kimberly and had an amazing time! Such a lovely boutique hotel with the look and feel of a European residence/townhome.  We stayed in suite 17 A - it was so spacious (bedroom with separate living room and kitchenette), well appointed ...and quiet - which was exactly what we wanted. The rooms have everything you'd expect - quality linens, comfy beds, good pillow selection, flat screen TVs,  - plus some really nice extra touches such as a throw blanket, umbrellas, lots of closet space, a large safe, an electric shoe shiner and buffer and even a shoe horn!  Loved the old fashioned door knockers complimentary wifi!  

Relative to the rest of the suite, the bathroom was on the small side (one sink, shower/tub combination) but it was updated, beautifully tiled and immaculate. 

The location is fabulous - so close to everything.  Shopping, a stroll through Central Park, theatre, museums (MoMA etc.   , We enjoyed a pre-dinner cocktail at the hotel's rooftop bar, ‘Upstairs’ - and we even snagged an outside table near the fireplace!.  

The service and staff were outstanding.  Everyone was incredibly friendly and attentive, and went out of their way to make us feel at home.  Over the course of the weekend, it was clear to us that the Kimberly has a lot of repeat guests, (which in and of itself speaks volumes) and we were really impressed with how the staff interacted with everyone on a personal and genuine level. And even though this was my first visit, I felt like an old friend.

A few special shout outs: to Arian, who had a cappuccino heading to my breakfast table the moment he saw us getting off the elevator!  He along with the bellmen, doorman and the Bistango staff were were all top notch. Oh, and thanks to the concierge for the VIP treatment at Blue Fin. The lemon meringue fruit tort was incredible and so appreciated!

title: Good value for NYC
text: This is our second visit to The Kimberly and while our room didn't have a nice view as the previous time, we enjoyed it. The rooms are large and well equipped. The bed was comfy and the shower had good water pressure. Our one-bedroom suite package included breakfast upstairs which was a real bonus (nice atmosphere and views to start your day) and we found the staff efficient and helpful. The location is great. Very handy to everything and just away from mid-town enough to feel relatively relaxed. Out of 6 hotels over 5 weeks in the US the Kimberly was the best value for money.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We had a fantastic time at this hotel, beds very comfortable, clean spacious room, friendly and helpful staff, we couldn't fault anything it was totally exceptional.  The facilities in the room were great, coffee maker, kettle, microwave if you wanted, bathroom was clean and good shower and free toiletries too.
Reception staff were very helpful and friendly as were all staff members we met.

title: Très bon séjour
text: La suite était très spacieuse et donc très pratique lorsque l on séjourne une semaine. La literie est très agréable surtout'avec un lit King. L établissement est bien situé vis à vis du métro. Un rafraîchissement serait à prévoir car un peu vieillissant mais c est un très bon établissement.

title: Vacation
text: I gave this review an average rating because based on the star rating of the hotel as well as the rave reviews I expected much more. The general areas of the hotel were beautiful. We stayed in a one bedroom room executive suite on the 16th floor. Our room was very spacious. There were three closets! Only the bathroom was very small in comparison to the rest of the room. For such a nice hotel the room needed obvious renovations (pictured). There was what appeared to be water damage on some furniture, holes in the bed sheets, the handheld shower was leaking and there was a weird stain on the bathroom door to name a few things. Also the rain shower head was also leaking, which meant if you were using the handheld shower freezing cold water would periodically drip directly on to you. The sliding door to the balcony was extremely hard to open. We didn't bother asking for a new room when we noticed these things as I had already requested a room on a higher floor when we arrived and was told this was the only room available. We arrived on Wednesday night and went out early Thursday morning. I put the housekeeping request on the door and we were gone for a few hours. When we returned our room hadn't been cleaned but it wasn't a big deal because we had just checked in the night before. I wasn't well so we stayed in until Friday evening. When we left on Friday evening we put the housekeeping request on the door again and told the Front Desk staff we would be out for the evening and were requesting our room be cleaned. When we returned several hours later the room once again had not been cleaned. I called down to the FD and was advised that housekeeping went but the DND was on the door. We had left it on accidentally but I would think the request PLUS the fact that we directly requested service at the FD would over ride this. The FD rep said they could send someone up then. When I queried what we were supposed to do while the room was being cleaned she said "I guess maybe go Upstairs and have a drink?". So in a way we had to pay for our room to be cleaned. When we returned to the room we noticed the housekeeper had not removed our room service dishes but had wrapped them in a white sheet and left them on the dining room table. The dishes were not removed until the next time we ordered room service. Aside from that we had a pleasant stay. The beds were comfy, the bellmen and door staff were always helpful and pleasant, the room service was tasty and the area felt safe.

title: Great spot in NYC!
text: We loved our stay at the Kimberley. We had a large group, so we booked a King suite and the two bedroom suite. Both were well appointed and lovely. The staff was very helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect for heading up to the park and down to the theater. Great shopping close by. Overall, we loved our stay!!

title: One of the best hotels in the Big Apple
text: I have stayed here many times. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, but the best part is the staff who are always eager to help. Many, many of the staff at the hotel have been employed there for years and years. Gregory the door man has been there 37 years and one of the front desk staff for more than 25 years. That says a great deal about the hotel.

title: Better than going home!
text: A true gem with coveted European hospitality, conveniently located between Lex and Third. Close to subway, shopping, and restaurants. From our arrival to departure, our stay could not have been better. The ENTIRE STAFF is so welcoming and accommodating from Charles at hospitality/check-in to Abdul for luggage and guest assistance, Gregory (best doorman ever), and Robert for fantastic room service. They all are outstanding and go out of their way to deliver top notch service. Loved loved loved our two bedroom suite which was spacious, well-appointed and so comfy and seemed much fresher/newer than the most recent 2011 renovation.  The balcony was an added plus ….with great views of the Hudson and the Chrysler Building. Food is superb, whether in the garden atmosphere of the Penthouse dining room or in-room dining; Ariane is simply the best with outstanding service and great with children!  I am very discriminating with bed and bath amenities, and the hotel does not disappoint: fabulous Frette linens and towels and L'Occitane products. A special shut out to Valerie, Director of Corporate Sales, for her charming welcome and special attention to my 10-year-old niece. She helped make our stay even more special!  Staying at The Kimberly is like going home…but much better….so welcoming and inviting.

title: Another Great Stay at the Kimberly Hotel
text: The Kimberly: Doormen are fabulous! Walk right out the revolving doors and you’re smack in the middle of wonderfulness, we enjoyed cappuccino every morning at Irving Farm. We walked to Grand Central, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center and Central Park several times during our stay at The Kimberly. Rooms are amazingly quiet. Bedding is superb. Don’t forget to go to the Rooftop.bar.

title: This hotel is everything
text:
I stayed at The Kimberly while my husband and I were in town for his surgery at  HSS. Not able to say enough kind words for this fine establishment. Being from out of town, and a female on her own, while husband was in hospital, I needed some guidance for taxi, and even which way is CVS. Sounds simple to many, but all staff were incredibly accommodating. After husbands surgery at the best orthopedic  hospital in USA, I was tired and weary upon return from 12 hours of worry. I was greeted with kindness and true concern for my husband’s well being. Not only that evening, but each evening after. Truly treated like a lady and I always felt safe. The staff in the restaurants were also caring and were able to accommodate my request of a corner while I reflected on my day, and the healing of my husband.
In summary, The Kimberly Hotel was everything to me, and forgot to mention my wonderful room that gave me solace. This is a well located hotel, with fine accommodations, restaurants and staff. Great place if someone you love is lucky enough to have surgery at New York’s finest hospitals. 
Thank you!!!

title: Fantastic Hotel in the best location
text: Wonderful location, big rooms, very comfortable beds, great L'Occitane amenities. Impeccable service. I would like to especially compliment and send my best regards to Ava Williams at Guest Services. She was so kind and helpful tracking a package that I had ordered and didn't arrive in time. She went into all the trouble of shipping the package to Brazil. I travel frequently and seldom felt so well taken care of as at The Kimberly New York. Definitely my new hotel in the City.

title: Splendid boutique hotel
text:
The Kimberly Hotel helped make our vacation in New York City a wonderful one! We spent four nights in this wonderful hotel. The amenities, attention to detail, and small touches were above and beyond our expectations. 

Although the view from our room wasn't the best... the beds were very comfortable and the room was very spacious. The staff, the service, and location were excellent. From the front desk, concierge, and doormen...everyone was very pleasant, patient, and helpful with our many questions and direction requests. Kim, the General Manager, is a lovely lady that cares about you (the guest) and wants your stay to be a wonderful experience.

Hubby and I highly recommend The Kimberly Hotel...you won't be disappointed!

title: Amazing hotel in the heart of everything
text: From the doormen, to Sadie at check in, to Arian in the Penthouse restaurant, the service was impeccable.   The suites are well appointed.   The beds are dreamy comfortable.  The location is convenient to everything.  Walking distance to Central Park, all the high end shopping, the E train to get us to Penn Station.  I tried to move in but they wouldn’t let me.  Ha!

title: Excellent hotel
text: This hotel is beautiful. The staff are very friendly and the check in process is seamless. The rooms are huge and very nicely decorated. The beds and pillows are very comfy and provide an amazing nights sleep. The hotel is in a great location as well. It has two nice restaurants and a cool rooftop bar/restaurant.

title: Magnificent!
text: What an amazing experience from check in to check out. Regal furnishings, a kitchen and dining area, a lovely desk and in-room library, rainfall shower, and nightly turndown service made the room the best in which I've stayed in Manhattan. It was clean, roomy, and the balcony was a really nice perk. The rooftop bar/resto is superb. Erin was incredible and arranged exactly what we needed in our room upon arrival to kick off our weekend. And Janet's prompt responses to our inquiries were very much appreciated. All in all, a perfect stay.

title: A FABULOUS HOTEL
text: This hotel truly is a hidden gem.  It's very central so we were able to walk to most places we wanted to see.  The service was excellent, from check-in, to the greeters, concierge, servers in the restaurant (which is EXCELLENT as well), the maids... Everyone was friendly, helpful and gracious.  Milan and Gregory were our favourite people to see almost every day.  It is clean - very clean.  Warm and cosy inside.  I would highly recommend this hotel for all that it offers.

title: Loved Everything About This Hotel
text: Nothing disappoints in this hotel! Apart from being close to Times Square, Broadway, Central Park, etc, and in a really nice area,  the rooms are well equipped with hairdryer, magnifying mirror, thick towels, very comfortable beds and linens, microwave, and mini-fridge. The cleaning staff do an exceptional job -  everything is immaculate, including shower grills, drawers, window sills. The doormen, the cleaning staff, and the front desk personnel are friendly and helpful, We ate late dinners at the hotel restaurant Bistango three times in a week - nothing like the generous basket of bread and hummous to enjoy after a busy day exploring the City while deciding on a meal -  the food was delicious, really reasonable prices, and the Bistango staff felt like friends; attentive but not hovering.This hotel has a  certificate posted showing its high travel rating for 2019  - and from our very pleasant experience  absolutely deserves it.

title: Elegant, peaceful, high-end amenities, 3 blocks from times square yet feels like stepping back in time...
text: I picked the Kimberly because we share a name and it's got that special and rare find in midtown, large 2 room suites with balconies! Our room was updated with all the ritzy modcons yet still had the glitz and glamorous of days gone by with arched doorways and elegant furnishings. The reviews I read before coming here expressed exactly why we'll be coming back here as often as we can... Charles and the staff made us feel special and personalized their services to our every need. Thank you for hosting the weekend of our dreams!

title: Best Hotel in Midtown
text:
The Kimberley is a hidden gem in NYC. A warm and charming hotel with great staff, comfortable rooms, amazingly comfortable bed and a rooftop terrace too!

Highly recommend for service, location and value.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Enjoyed staying here last week. Hotel has a great location with a subway station 1 street away. The room was a decent size and was kept spotless during our visit. Found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Hotel has a great breakfast location on the top floor which is also used as a cocktail bar in the evenings. Good selection of food available at breakfast. Would gladly stay again if in the city.

title: Great hotel!
text: My wife and I stayed here for six days and loved every minute we were here.  Our room was large and had large window and lots of light.  The staff was always accommodating and friendly.  The hotel is within walking distance of most everything.  A true gem!  Jack Pryde

title: Great Staff
text:
We really liked the Kimberly, the well-appointed kitchen in the Luxury One Bedroom Suite, the location which made it easy to walk or catch a train to so many places, the two restaurants (one with a menu that promised all items could be made gluten-free), the views and mid-day snacks/coffee at the rooftop bar, but it is the staff that earned it super stars. 
Housekeeping, front desk, concierge, bellmen, absolutely everyone we came in contact with seemed to have a desire to make our stay great.  This is an extraordinary team, and I have to assume this indicates great management and people committed to the making sure that "hospitality" is the defining mandate.
Since no place is perfect, I'll add that the bathroom in our suite was small, with no counter space, no drawers and limited shelving. If lots of counter space is crucial, I'd suggest asking for a room with a different configuration. For us, it wasn't a problem.
Thanks to the whole team.

title: Great value in NYC!
text: Wonderful hotel!  Lobby is small, but lovely.  Love the fish tank, only wish there was a cozy place to sit with cocktails served while enjoying the fish!  Room (1 BR suite) was great size with everything you need – good pillow variety, two zone A/C, nice bed linens (towels a little rough), balcony, kitchenette.  Housekeeping was outstanding.  Bathroom small and jetted tub was a tub/shower combo (always a negative), but totally serviceable, well maintained, and clean.  Rooftop served excellent breakfast (ask for menu option if not interested in buffet) and great cocktails at night.  Will DEFINITELY stay here again and will try downstairs restaurant next time (just ran out of time this trip).   GREAT staff all the way around.   Really great value in NYC - HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

title: Phenomenal Boutique Hotel
text: We stayed three times at the Kimberly Hotel these past three months.  I was hesitant about writing this review because everything about the hotel is wonderful and I wanted to keep it to myself. We had a suite (living room, kitchenette etc) on a high floor.  The room even had a balcony where we enjoyed coffee in the morning and drinks at night. Every staff member is cordial, friendly, and knowledgeable. Housekeeping even put our dirty dishes in the dishwasher! If there were a problem it was fixed immediately. And you get free water...The rooftop lounge with a view of the Chrysler building served breakfast.  During the day there's pastries and coffee, tea, water (free to guests.) In the evening there's a lively atmosphere for drinks and bar bites. It's a great neighborhood near shopping, great restaurants and entertainment.  But it's not a very crowded crazy NYC area. Kudos to staff for making our stays so wonderful.  We will return.

title: Lovely stay
text: My husband and I had a wonderful stay here. Rooms have been updated as well as bathrooms. We had a king sized bedroom with living room, small balcony and efficiency style kitchen. Staff were welcoming and helpful. The rooftop bar is a fun splurge for a view of the Chrysler building lit up. Great location for many attractions, we were able to walk to time square and back for a show.

title: Incredible!
text: My husband and I stayed at The Kimberly for 3 nights for our 20th Anniversary. We loved everything about this beautiful hotel. The location is great and very close to everything. Close enough to Time Square but not too close. Convenient subway stops close by, and incredibly friendly and helpful doormen. Especially Gregory who has a great happy, friendly personality.  Our room was pretty big and roomy especially for NYC. The rooftop bar was very nice with a busy happy hour and nice views. The staff was incredible and our room was kept clean. We appreciated the nightly turn down service.  It's a boutique hotel and we loved the personal attention. I somehow forgot my favorite pair of pants and they had them ready for me to pick them up on our last day in NYC. (3 days after we checked out) The bellman arranged for a town car to JFK for a better price than UBER and a Cab. Unfortunately, after we checked out we stayed at the Marriot Marquis for a few days, thinking it would be nice to be in the center of Times Square. Although that hotel was beautiful, it wasn't has nice and comfortable as our stay at the Kimberly.  The service at the Kimberly is top notch and we look forward to staying there again when we return to NYC.

title: Great location.. great hotel.
text:
Great location. 2mins walk from the subway and within 10mins walk from central park and the the Rockefeller plaza.. 
Rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The staff are extremely friendly and courteous. The food in the bistango restaurant was very nice and great value..

title: Luxurious
text:
I adore this property! My boyfriend and I initially discovered The Kimberly during Christmas of 2017. We had a very poor experience at a high end location near Central Park. Our reservations at that location were for over a week and after stumbling across The Kimberly, we decided to change hotels. The staff was highly accommodating, which was why we always recommend The Kimberly!

My boyfriend surprised me for my birthday this year and we stayed in the Empire Suite. This suite was particularly spacious, especially for a hotel in the city. The Empire Suite was the size of some penthouses in this area for way less than the price of one. 

The kitchenette was well stocked, the space was clean, and there were comfort items like robes and L’occitane products available! The only complaint I have is that I cannot permanently live here.

If you’re looking for a hotel in a great location that understands luxury, I highly recommend The Kimberly!

title: One of the best
text:
This is maybe the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in.  Good value for a 2 room suite.  Good in room coffee, but you can also go to the PentHouse to get to go coffee.  Breakfast in PH restaurant is relaxing and scenic- either a buffet or from the menu and a rooftop patio.  
It’s an old building , so well insulated and therefore quiet.  Well located to Subway and many good restaurants within walking distance.

title: Great spot
text: This is an all suite hotel (I think). It’s in a great location right by the Waldorf and the Benjamin. 50th and Lex. Staff is extremely courteous and prompt. Reasonable price for NY. The rooftop bar is exceptional. (Photos) Will absolutely stay there again.

title: Wonderful weekend at the Kimberly
text: We are locals and came into Manhattan to meet our visiting family and friends. We usually go into Manhattan for the theater, shopping, sightseeing and dining and have not yet stayed at The Kimberly. Early check-in was quick and accommodating. We were appointed in 10C, a spacious King bed suite. The room was immaculately clean and well maintained. All staff from front desk, doormen, concierge, bellboys to the rooftop waitstaff were friendly and professional. Would return and recommend others.

title: New York central
text:
Spent 4 nights here in a one bedroom suite. Rooms are traditional rather than modern. Great to have the kitchen facilities and a separate area to relax and eat. Location is great, walking distance of nearly all the sights and close to the subway for those you can’t walk to. 

Downsides are, no free Wi-fi in the rooms (only in reception or ‘upstairs’) and the noise, it could benefit from upgraded double glazing.

title: Kimberly
text: Had a wonderful stay at the Kimberly on our way to Rome. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I want to especially thank Valerie for her assistance in making our room choice special. On future visits to NY we will make sure we stay at the Kimberly.

title: New York weekend
text: I’ve stayed at the Kimberly multiple times and it never disappoints. Great staff, wonderful location and well appointed rooms. I highly recommend staying at this fine hotel. The rooftop bar and restaurant is awesome, too.

title: What an amazing Hotel
text:
Spent 18 of the most amazing days in NYC at the Kimberly and our stay can’t be matched by any other in the city, it starts with the superb and amazing energy and positive genuine attitude of the door men, especially Harry who was always wonderfully pleasant and helpful.
The rooms are extremely clean with an amazing vintage NYC rooms feel that brings you back to a much much happier days. 
The reception staff very friendly and checking was quite fast.
I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the City.

title: Weekend at the US Open and Yankee Stadium
text: A beautiful two-room suite in midtown. Attentive professional staff. Upstairs at the Kimberly for pre-tennis drinks and a lite meal was great. Room service breakfast was perfect with a small dining table, flowers, linens, and delicious food. Will be returning soon.

title: NYC at its best
text: Midtown, great service, beautiful room, great views, outstanding restaurant (Bistango), exciting rooftop lounge..what is not to like?  We also booked a room for our son and two grandchildren.  They were put on the same floor and had a great time as well.  The aquarium outside of Bistango was captivating to the kids and immaculately kept.  The location of the hotel is perfect for navigating the city.

title: Great family hitel
text:
I spent absolutely ages looking for hotels for a family of four that weren’t show boxes! I came across The Kimberley on a number of family friend sites... so I booked it. 

The hotel is older in its design, but it is not tatty. It is decorated in this style by design. A great welcome when we arrived, the lobby is relatively small but a wonderful fish tanks the kids liked to look at each day.  Doormen super friendly.

We booked a 1 bed suite ( 2 x double bed and 1 pull out sofa) so we had extra space and not all forced to go to bed super early each night. The suite was really well sized, well appointed and bathroom exceptionally clean (albeit a little small in comparison with the rest of the suite. Lots of attention to our stay e.g turn down set ice, chocolates on pillows (kids had them all!) and a note with what the weather would be like the next day. Umbrellas in the wardrobe and complimentary water upon arrival and in our room. Only disappointment was the balcony. Shocking view. Hey ho.

It was our 20th wedding anniversary and I had informed the hotel when we checked in. They left us a lovely letter, complimentary bottle of wine and some petit fours which was a lovely touch. 

As a family I would definitely stay here again. For the money I don’t think it can be beaten.

title: Amazing experience this stay and always!
text: I have stayed at the Kimberly multiple times for work purposes, and I couldn't think of a better hotel to book my parents for their first NYC trip! First of all, my parents stated that they are now lifelong customers of the Kimberly Hotel! They absolutely LOVED it! They were there celebrating their 35th wedding anniversary, and the staff did everything they could to add special celebratory touches to their stay. A special thank you to Val for suggesting the sunset cruise-- it was their favorite part of the entire trip! I cannot thank the staff at the Kimberly enough for making their anniversary trip just perfect. The entire team, as always, was wonderful and took such good care of them. They can’t wait to come back and stay with y’all! Thank you, Kimberly staff!

title: Relaxing Hotel. last minute Decision. Great Hotel.
text:
Great Staff, always ready to help. 
Managed to get us on a boat trip for the 4th July Cerebrations. 
We decided to go in July for a great Holiday. 
Booked the hotel 21st June. somewhere Central.The weather was very humid / hot. But the air conditioning in the hotel and on public transport was fantastic.

title: Very friendly
text: Great hospitality made us feel very welcome at all times no matter who we were dealing with. Ideal location for Rockefeller plaza Central Park park and madison avenues. Room was perfect really large king size bed with our own suite and kitchen

title: First trip to NYC and the Kimberly Hotel
text: We booked our very first trip to New York, first the flight, then the hotel, my wife chose the Kimberly Hotel in midtown Manhattan.   Absolutely loved the location, very central, the service was top notch, the room elegant, and, the rooftop patio an absolute blast!!!    We are definitely going to come back and, look forward to staying at the Kimberly.

title: Amazing location
text: The rooms/suites are boutique style with a great mix of traditional and contemporary. It has everything you need and the beds are super comfortable. I love staying here. There is a new feature of the aquarium in the lobby that added to the appeal of the hotel. Like anywhere in NY, you can get from super cheap to super expensive food. There is a pharmacy, McDonald's, Starbucks, a diner, Chinese, Thai restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel. Transits are also pretty close. Why stay anywhere else?

title: Just perfect!
text: Wonderful rooms and wonderful staff!  And don't forget the great breakfast in the penthouse restaurant each day.  Sit inside or outside.  Wonderful location to Madison Ave shopping, Grand Central Station, and easy walk or ride to Times Square or Central Park.  We stayed in a suite, after having called the Kimberly directly for the best price and room.  So nice to have a kitchenette, spacious sitting area, balcony, and bedroom.  Such a comfortable bed! Will stay here again and again!

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text:
Nous y avons séjourné 5 nuits à l'occasion de mes 60 ans. Dès notre arrivée Adriana a eu la gentillesse de nous surclasser et de nous offrir deux verres au roof top de l'hôtel. Le personnel est attentif et prévenant. L'hôtel est également très bien situé.
Nous sommes enchantés de notre séjour.

title: A Magnificent Hotel
text:
We have been coming to the Kimberly for the past 20 years. We were there during

 the 2003 Blackout. There could not have been a better place to stay.

 They provided us with everything possible in that situation. The staff is

 helpful, kind and like family. We always see smiling faces. The service is superb.

The location is great.  It's a wonderful place to stay and relax in the busy City.

title: Séjour NY
text: Nous avons séjourné 10 jours en novembre 2018.  L’Hôtel est très bien placé, les chambres sont spacieuses, le petit déjeuner est excellent, et le personnel est très agréable ! Bon rapport qualité/prix, Je recommande.

title: home away from home
text: Loved the location. This is our go-to hotel when in NYC - love the balconies, the rooftop bar to enjoy morning coffee, water, solid wood doors to keep the noise down, the most comfortable beds. Next to Rockefeller Plaza and everything else - walk everywhere.

title: Amazing place to stay!
text: We stayed at the Kimberly in a 2 bedroom suite and it was a fabulous experience!  The staff was so friendly and eager to help, beautifully appointed rooms, lightning-fast room service, and an honest to God balcony!  I probably won't ever stay anywhere else in NYC.

title: My Favorite Hotel in NYC!
text: I've stayed here for years and just love it!  Best beds, sheets and covers.  The associates/staff are awesome and so friendly and professional with great smiles!  The bar at night and the restaurant for breakfast are fantastic.  The only thing I miss is the great view of the Chrysler from the new apt project across the street.

title: Always Enchanting
text: This has become our “New York address”.  Our third or fourth stay and everything is simply great.  The staff is wonderful and very, very accommodating.  The dining choices are very good and eclectic.  Rooms are spacious and comfortable.  Would not stay elsewhere.

title: Beyond Expectations
text: We spent 5 nights at the 5 star Kimberly Hotel. Their rooftop bar was magical with good food, generous drinks, and an amazing view. Our room was upgraded for our anniversary. The palatial furniture and large rooms with a balcony made our time at the hotel relaxing and enjoyable. From the front desk assistants to the bellmen, everyone was friendly and helpful. We will definitely plan to stay on our next NYC trip at the Kimberly Hotel.

title: Perfect vacation
text: The Kimberly Hotel made our long stay in New York (3 weeks) very enjoyable. To its many advantages you could add its location, spacious and modern rooms with amazing furniture, availability of a balcony, delicious breakfast and much more. But the biggest benefit of the hotel is, in my opinion, is its employees. Especially I want to highlight Andriana: always polite and in a good mood, ready to help with any issue. During our long stay a couple of small problems occurred and Andriana solved them within the matter of hours with a warm smile on her face. This attentive attitude and respect to the guests of the hotel makes me want to come back to the Kimberly Hotel. Thank you once again Andriana.

title: Delightful boutique hotel in NYC
text: The Kimberly is a delightful boutique hotel in a very good location in New York City.  Not so big to feel impersonal, and not.so small that the visitor is without certain services, Recommended for business or pleasure.

title: Perfect stay
text:
We visited with a group of 7 and booked 2 suites for our weekend getaway in the city. The hotel is located conveniently nearby subway stops, not too far from Times Square and Essabagel, our top stop bagel joint in the city. The suites were spacious, come with fridges, glassware and a huge balcony which was such a pleasant surprise. The beds were so comfortable, bathrooms looked recently redone, shower pressure was perfect. They go above and beyons for special touches such as treat trays in the room (at a cost), mini bar and complimentary water bottles. I noticed the touches in branded napkins, glass covers, plush robes, and even an in room cell phone like device to help navigate the city and hotel.

We checked ou6r the rooftop bar one night with views of the Chrysler building and did the sunset cruise through the hotel. This was a 3 hour cruise to the furthest bridge at the mouth of the Atlantic and probably the coolest amenity I've ever seen a hotel offer. After a day or two of running round the city, being on a boat taking the sites in a different way was perfect.

We worked with Sara in the sales department to book, she was wonderful and responsive but its obvious all of the staff take the same amount of attention and care as we were greeted throughout the weekend and always felt like the hotel was alive, which their staff made possible.

Would 10/10 recommend and will never hesitate to stay here.

Would never hesitate to stay here, our entire group loved it!

title: Perfect location in NYC
text:
Stayed on the 30th floor in a suite.
Views were amazing from balcony.
Very clean and great daily servicing.
Close to some main attractions and subways.
Free wifi.
Complimentary morning tea and snacks.
Breakfast options. Bar on top with great views.
Restaurant available.

title: A wonderful gem
text: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of a family trip to the US - 2 adults and 2 children. This hotel was just fantastic! It was a little old fashioned but that added to the charm of the place. Comfortable, clean and welcoming it was a wonderful oasis in the city that doesn’t sleep! Great roof top bar (which gets busy in the evening) which also serves breakfast. Plenty of room for the kids on a rollaway and sofa bed (comfortable too). Every amenity provided - from umbreallas to kettles. Really good value for money too and a convenient location.
