Didn’t particularly rate the hotel Italian restaurant but maybe we were just unlucky. We would certainly stay there again.

title: Fantastic, one to book!
text: We stayed for 6 nights, 2 adults and an 13 and a 11 year old. Fantastic room, executive one bedroom suite. We asked for a floor high up with a balcony and we were on the 21st floor which was great. Don't think I would want to be much higher. We requested balcony furniture and  a kettle which we got very quickly. Our daughter slept on the sofa bed and we got an extra z bed for our son. The living room is so big we kept this up the whole time. Room was cleaned daily and was immaculate. Staff could not have been any better.  Location was great, 10/15 mins walk to time square, 2 min walk to subway, 5 min walk to small supermarket. 2 min walk to restuarants/fast food, lots of choice. We could see the Chrysler building from our balcony.  we went to the roof top bar one afternoon for pastries and coffee which is free in the afternoon. Kitchen area was a good size for having breakfast in our room. We brought cereal with us.  This is a dishwasher in the room. There is a mobile phone provided for free in the room which we brought out with us to use google maps.  I would recommend this hotel to all, great experience.

title: Weekend get away
text: Will go back!!  In the heart of mid town Manhattan.  Easy access, lots to do.  Took advantage of the hotel’s connection with NYHRC Yacht to cruise Manhattan.  Easy walk to theaters and restaurants.  Roof top garden is nice for a drink and smoke.

title: Not as good as last time!
text:
We recently stayed for 8 nights for our 2nd visit unfortunately not as good as last time.  Check in was quick and efficient - queried about the cost to upgrade to a suite but decided to stick with our original room - double double.  In a little annex off reception.  We were on the 7th floor at the back of the building - we asked for a quiet room and we got it.  No view but we knew that as we were at the rear last time.  

Room was large with 2 double beds, storage and a bathroom with a bath! Cleaned daily and toiletries refreshed.

The 2nd night we came back to find our fridge had frozen with bottles of water and they has smashed, maintenance called and he was there quickly turned off the fridge and called housekeeping who kindly cleaned up the glass, we were advised we would not be charged for the damaged bottles.  The saga of the fridge was ongoing daily and never fixed during our stay.  Day 5 they offered to move rooms but we didn't want the hassle of packing/unpacking.  they did kindly offer us free breakfast one morning.  

Other peoples rubbish left in our room by housekeeping. A couple of other small niggles.  

Our flight was cancelled and we queried staying an extra 3 nights but the cost was $400 plus tax per night - so we looked elsewhere.  On checkout we mentioned we were moving hotels and the receptionist could not believe the quote we had been given - so maybe we could have stayed.

Also we were charged for the broken water bottles which has since been refunded.

It is a nice hotel and we did enjoy our stay but with the little niggles I'm not sure I would return a 3rd time.

title: Wonderful Stay in NYC
text: The Kimberly was recommended to us by a friend and although it was the height of the tourist season, we were very fortunate to get a room. Upon check in, we were greeted warmly and unexpectedly upgraded to a suite. This was absolutely palatial! We were delighted - the suite was spacious, very well appointed, beautifully decorated and incredibly quiet. The king size bed was most comfortable and the bathroom was amazingly large for a city hotel. We wanted for nothing! Service at the roof-top bar/restaurant was outstanding and the views are breath-taking.

title: Tolles Hotel, mittendrin statt nur dabei
text: Unsere Suite in der 27.Etage war sehr geräumig und sauber. Sicher ist es nicht hypermodern, hat aber den gewissen New Yorker Charme. Die Lage ist top. Zum Times Square und anderen Touri-Punkten nur ein paar Minuten zu Fuss. Entferntere Sehenswürdigkeiten sind mit der nahegelegenen Subway-Station zu erreichen. Service ist gut und der Checkin+out waren unkompliziert. Wifi ist mittlerweile kostenfrei, entgegen den Hotelbeschreibungen einiger Hotelportale. Sicher die Geräuschkulisse ist nicht jedermanns Sache, aber damit muss man in Manhattan sowieso überall rechnen. Bei geschlossenen Fenstern ist es nicht wirklich störend. Direkt nebenan befindet sich ein Cafe-Bistro, wenn man zum Frühstück nicht das Restaurant im Hotel nutzen möchte. Gegenüber ein indisch-asiatisches Restaurant.

title: Just love the location and the hotel
text: The hotel provides very spacious rooms for NYC.  There is a rooftop bar which is very lively and has great views.  The staff is very attentive.  Overall we just love staying here and will stay each time we are in the City.

title: We felt like the Royal Family
text: The 5-night stay at this boutique suite hotel exceeded our expectations. We were treated with respect and kindness from the moment we entered the venue till the check-out.  The room was luxurious, spacious, furnished in antique-style with feather bed and a lovely balcony.  We received exceptional, personalized service. The yacht cruise, organized by the concierge lasted for 3 hours and was phenomenal. We enjoyed the light buffet supper and took wonderful pictures onboard. Don’t miss it!

title: Kimberly Hotel
text: The Kimberly Hotel is the best hotel in New York City that I have ever stayed. The staff was exceptional!! They were very friendly and helpful!! The rooftop breakfast buffet with an omelet station was delicious!!  I can’t wait to go back to this hotel!!!!

title: Bar ruined a lovely stay
text:
I stayed here with my family, 4 other adults, for a short break in May. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was on the top floor. The room itself was great, the sofa pulled out and was comfortable for my 6ft 5" brother, the master bedroom was huge and had a lovely en-suite. There was also another bathroom which was just as nice as the en-suite. Both bathrooms included L'Occitane toiletries too which was a lovely treat.We also had a little balcony which was nice to spend the mornings and early evenings on.

Directly above us was the bar, when we first arrived we went straight upstairs for a drink. The 3 men in our group were told that they weren't allowed in as they were wearing shorts, we was also told it was a private event but we can sit in the corner if we wanted to.... Not really! We then found on the Friday night that there is a DJ from about 11pm-2am! We weren't given any advance warning of this, we found out about it when we returned to the room as asked reception what was going on. We paid a lot for what I believed was one of their best rooms and this completely ruined our stay. I'm not a party pooper, we do like a drink but when we've been up early and exploring NYC, we did just want bed! As it was we gave the bar a go on the Saturday night, we was going to be kept up anyway so may as well join the party, this time we were dressed appropriately and smartly. The dress code is smart however there were a lot of groups in there that had obviously spent the day exploring NYC, hit the bar early and not left as they were very casually dressed. I wouldn't normally complain about this but as our group had been turned away for wearing shorts why were these allowed in? Also, the DJ was rubbish! He was playing all sorts of music genres that just didn't flow or make sense so we had 1 drink and moved on.

The staff on the front doors were wonderful, very friendly, chatty, helpful, they really brightened the place up. I found the reception staff a little bit short and abrupt, like they couldn't be bothered and they'd rather you left them alone.

I'm not sure I would return to this hotel purely due to the rubbish late night party! However, if I could get that same room a few floors down then I'd certainly consider it.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: This is a boutique hotel along the lines of a European hotel.  The rooms are lovely and most have a small balcony.  Unlike many hotels in NYC the rooms are fairly spacious and the service is excellent. The connected steakhouse is also very good.  For breakfast take a walk to Essa Bagel.

title: Great location. Spacious rooms
text:
Love this hotel! It was not cheap but was good value for money as we received spacious suites. 

The staff was kind and welcoming. I requested to change the room I initially got and they accommodated my request instantly.

title: Excellent service
text: Had a great experience at Kingsbury. friendly staff, excellent quality of service. Specially Kings bar staff. Happy with the beverage deals at the bar. Staff were friendly and helpful.  Definitely we are coming back.!

title: Disappointing for the price
text:
Having booked with Hotels.com, and being a gold member - there is a "promise" of an upgrade and early/late check out and wifi.

I had emailed the hotel as we stayed on my wife's birthday.  The result - a happy birthday as we booked in -- really.

The reception manager polite and professional and the news sorry no room upgrade we are fully booked. Late check out became a barter on time - we left early.

The room 15d, a corner room with balcony.  Gloomy and a hideous marble bar in front of the small kitchen, fridge, dishwasher (really?) microwave and coffee maker (with coffee provided each day).

Furniture is good, but huge aircon and one further in the bedroom.

The balcony is great for checking the weather, but nothing else.  For safety they can not put chairs and therefore it a standing place.

Bed good - but no way to fully turn the fans off on the air con.  Bathroom good and clean.  Shower and bath !  good towels.

Ice on request (or try taking the service lift to the basement and the ice machine in the far corner (or not)).

The hotel is in a good area and lots to do not far away and good restaurants.

Friendly doormen and staff, but not worth the price.  $30 each for breakfast - but thankfully the diner is 100 foot away.

The roof Terrance for tea coffee. help yourself and closed of an evening when it has been booked for parties.  great view 

Wished we had stayed at the IHG Barclay.

title: Wonderful City Break
text: The Kimberley Hotel was amazing.  You got what you paid for.  Very central to the sights and within walking distance of everything.  The room was an excellent size and very spacious.  We had trouble with room service but the situation was rectified very efficiently.  The views from the restaurant were stunning. Would recommend.

title: Exceptional Service
text: Stayed with my wife as part of our honeymoon. Updgraded, some free cocktails in the roof top restaurant. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly through out and the room was great. High recommended.

title: Great for Business Events
text: I recently participated in a roundtable event with about 20 people in the conference room at the Kimberly.  The food was excellent and the service was friendly and professional.  There were monitors around the room so all participants could view the presentation.  Also, the Kimberly is centrally located in midtown and was easy to travel to for all participants.  Special thanks to Valerie Blasi, Jordana Maurer and Ymir.  I highly recommend the Kimberly for seminars, workshops and keynotes..

title: A 5 day trip to new York
text:
the Kimberly Hotel was fantastic we would  have given a 5 Star. the Rooms are excellent ,the service and Staff no complaints they were polite and friendly 
we had a great stay  very near to state empire building and others so close to all 
the avenues this hotel cannot falt food great  and easy to get around New York 
recommend to everyone go and have fun like me Steve and Peter my Half  Brother
we did.

title: Nice hotel, but very noisy outside
text: We stayed at the hotel for one week and overall the stay was pleasant.  The good things about the hotel are: its polite, friendly and helpful staff; comfortable rooms, even the sofa bed; massive breakfast with a lot of choice; good views from the breakfast room and very central.  The not so good things are: bathroom was very small for 3 people (and the room could hold six people!); no kettle provided; very noisy outside the hotel - even with the windows shut; very noisy air-conditioning and fridge.

title: NYC trip from Ky.
text:
I had a very nice stay.  The staff was very nice and inviting.  I would give this 5 stars.  Rooms are excellent, very clean. 
Plus, you are within walking distance to all the shopping you could ever want.

title: Exceptional Service from all for a business function
text: Our company held a roundtable discussion at the Kimberly Hotel in early June in NYC. We were delighted at the attention and service we received. The facilities team at the Kimberly led by Amir were equally invested in the success of our event as we were. Valero Blasi treated like the a professional planner and oversaw every detail allowing us to focus on an excellent event.  The room we chose was intimate provide an environment for comfortable conversation! And the food was excellent and plentiful! A huge thank you to the team at the Kimberly hotel in NYC. We will return!

title: Jacks Pack 2019
text: I stayed at this hotel as part of a large group for a week. The hotel staff were so welcoming and nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were spotless and spacious. The roof top terrace is a must for views and relaxing and the breakfast for $15 was all you could eat from cooked bacon,eggs, omelette however you wanted to fresh waffles with maple syrup to fruit, the list is endless and so worth every dollar. The location is so central to tube stations and shops and lots of sight seeing attractions are within walking distance eg Times Square, 5th ave, Central Park , Hudson River, and Empire State . You will not be disappointed with this hotel it's definitely on my return to list.

title: Average at best - not quite the boutique hotel expected and windows need a clean
text:
Stayed May 2019.

I had read in reviews about a separate block… this is called The Kimberley Tower.
This is accessed via a single lift on the right hand of reception by the door to Empire Steak House. I was told all deluxe guestrooms are in this block and goes up to 7 floors.

So for the experience of a boutique hotel, you do feel second class.

As not booked direct with the hotel and even though staying for five nights, the view was terrible. See photos. Where the photo looks grainy, is due to the dirt on the outside of the window. 

Building work is on-going outside at other hotels and at times noisy. Also, the air con unit was very loud! Needs a good service – room 7L.

As not booked direct, Wi-Fi is charged at $41 for 5 days use. Majority of hotels are complimentary and was not exactly the cheap end of hotels either.

On the weekend, the open top bar has brunch and lunch. The complimentary tea/coffee and patisseries is in the VIP Room 11:00-16:00.  We popped in for a coffee before going to airport, the room was dirty with breakfast left over/crumbs, Spanish music blaring out from the kitchen, bags and clothes on chairs. 

The roof top bar had quite a few corporate feeling events and was not open to guests. To be fair, notices did say available for use after 22:00.

On the upside, the room was good and roomy for New York. Maid service was very good and room had tea, coffee (Wolfgang Puck), fridge, microwave, 2 complimentary bottles of water (first day only), L’Occitane shampoo, conditioner, shower wash, soaps, body lotion, wet wipes, hair dryer, tv, smart phone and ample good quality towels.

The Wet Bar and snacks were expensive, though as in New York get used to high prices.

Door staff very polite and helpful in pointing you in the right direction, they will also store luggage in a secure room if your room was not ready (like ours) or for a few hours after check out (12pm).

Location good for midtown - about 15 minutes walk to Times Square, 10 minutes to Grand Central. 

Overall a good enough hotel, would we go back – no.

title: Great location close to Grand Central
text: Stayed here for a week with a large group. Hotel staff all very welcoming  and helpful. Clean & comfortable rooms. The roof terrace bar has some great views. It’s 5-10 min walk from Grand Central so convenient location. Hotel also gives you access to local health club which is a real plus 🇺🇸💙🇺🇸

title: Jacks pack group
text: Went here in May 2019. The rooms are really spacious and everything you need is on your doorstep. Also had a complimentary gym pass to a number of gyms. Really helpful staff, will definitely be going back again. Good value for money.

title: Spacious Rooms and Expansive Views
text: This was not my first, nor will it be my last, time staying at the Kimberly Hotel. Located in the heart of Manhattan, the sweeping views of the city can be seen from every part of the spacious room and even more spacious balcony. Simply gorgeous rooms welcome you in while the city view from day to night will leave you wanting to stay. Add to that, the service here is always great, the staff is warm and welcoming and happy to accommodate.

title: The Kimberly is the best!
text: The staff is warm, helpful and friendly. The suites are affordable and luxurious. It is a true refuge in the hustle and bustle of the city. It is conveniently located. It makes any trip to New York much more special. I recommend it to all my friends.

title: Nice clean hotel in a central location
text: I visited the Kimberly as part of a large group. Service was friendly and efficient and I would recommend to anyone looking for a base to explore NYC. The highlight was the roof terrace, which serves a great buffet breakfast for $15, and has a nice relaxed vibe for evening drinks.

title: BEST Hotel Pick in New York City! - Great Staff, Fabulous Rooms, Phenomenal City Views
text: There aren't words that can begin to capture sufficiently the truly magical experience our family and friends had while staying at the Kimberly Hotel as we celebrated my Mom's 90th Birthday earlier this month!!  The level of staff attentiveness is unmatched; the room decor is exquisite, and the sweeping views of the East River and the Chrysler Building from our suite were magnificent!!  The rooftop lounge offers extraordinary ambiance with its panoramic and stunning views of the Big Apple.  In particular, Bijou at the Front Desk was so concerned about my Mom's comfort during the check-in process as were Bellmen Jose and Gregory.  Because of them, my Mom immediately felt like a queen the moment she was greeted at the hotel's valet-parking area.  Our breakfast servers Arian and Javiar (rooftop lounge) were truly delightful and also treated my Mom like royalty!! Peter and Dusty (concierge) were beyond helpful both during the trip-planning process and during our stay, as was Ava at the front desk (who kindly and cheerily responded to a number of my questions).  Bellman Ralph was exceptionally helpful as we closed out our stay!!  Last and certainly not least, Marcia in reservations was most accommodating in booking our 2020 reservations, as my family and friends have decided to make this our annual destination for my Mom's subsequent birthday celebrations!!  While we look forward to our stay in May 2020, I know we will be back at the Kimberly before then to celebrate other important milestones.  The special birthday dinner was enjoyed next door at the Empire Steakhouse (fabulous food, ambiance and attentive staff there as well)  Do not pass up the opportunity to stay at this exceptional hotel and make lifetime memories for you and your family and friends!!

title: Fantastic stay at The Kimberly
text:
Wow wow wow. Have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Kimberly and it was even better then I expected. We had an executive suite and room 12B which was out of this world. So much space and with 3 warbrobes in all which for 2 girls on a mega shopping trip was more then enough space! Honestly couldn't fault the hotel at all. It has that old world charm which I absolutely love and was so nice to wake up and have a coffee on the balcony while planning the day ahead.
Staff were so friendly and welcoming and nothing was too much for them.
A very easy walk into times square, literally come out the hotel and turn right then walk all the way down, passing fifth avenue and St Patrick's cathedral, radio city etc. Really pleasent walk and we even did it coming back from Times Square at about 11pm and felt safe.

Didn't manage to make it to the roof top bar or the sunset cruise (it's on Saturday and Wednesday evenings I believe starting in May and is $30 for a sunset cruise on the river which is amazing) but next time we can back we will be sure to do it.

This is most definitely our go to hotel now and I already cant wait to come back next year.

Thank you for a fab stay.

title: Beyond Expectation! Great stay, thank you.
text:
We stayed at the Kimberly Hotel over Memorial Weekend and had a fantastic stay. Having done a lot of homework about location, facilities, restaurants etc, we were confident in our choice of hotel for our stay in Manhatten. 

However once arrived at the hotel it is fair to say that our expectations were easily exceeded. We stayed in a one bed exec suite.  The balcony was a great benefit (nice for coffee alfresco in spring).  The space was much bigger than the photos give a sense of and the little touches were perfect.  In the room was a smart phone that can be taken out of the room to assist with navigating the island, 2 umbrellas, a shoe shine machine, slippers and robes, l'occitane toiletries, 2 televisions, well stocked in room wet bar, excellent furnishings.  Just lovely. 

We visited the "upstairs" bar 2 times throughout our stay and had great food on both occasions with a great view over the Chrysler building. 

We regretted not knowing about this having already made our plans for our stay but the Kimberly offers a very good rate for a sunset cruise on a yacht for guests.   Worth asking about! 

We hope to be back :)

title: Beautiful Property in a Great Location
text: We stayed here for 4 nights over Memorial Day weekend. We loved our stay - the room was large (especially for NYC), the staff was wonderful. The L'occitane toiletries was also a nice surprise and treat. We will return on our next visit!

title: A Favorite In NYC
text: This was probably the 5th or 6th time we have stayed here.  We like the hotel very much, but really appreciate that most rooms come with a small balcony - easily big enough for three or four folks or bistro table and a couple of chairs.  We enjoy sitting with coffee in the morning or a glass of wine in the afternoon.  We booked this trip, directly with the hotel, a few months ago.  We were pleasantly surprised to get upgraded from the Junior Suite we had booked to an Executive Suite.  Needless to say, the room was wonderful.  We had the time to visit the rooftop lounge “Upstairs “ on a beautiful evening.  Spectacular views and very welcoming spot (NO sneakers!).  Staff were always extremely pleasant, yet professional.  Hotel was spotless and well maintained.  Not the cheapest hotel in Manhattan (with taxes, Junior Suite was $600/night), but, hey, it’s you and you’re worth every penny!  We highly recommend this hotel. Picture is from the rooftop.

title: Great hotel in desirable location
text: We stayed four nights at the Kimberly. The location is fantastic, between Lexington and 3rd Avenues, very close to the 6 and E subway lines. We had booked a standard guestroom, but the staff was nice enough to upgrade us to suite 8A. The room was spacious and included a kitchenette that we didn't use. Suite 8A is very well-appointed. If a view is of interest, this suite may not be for you. It has no view - it overlooks brick walls from other buildings. The staff is great - everyone we encountered during our stay at the Kimberly was friendly and courteous.

title: You wanna stay in New York? This is your hotel
text:
85 Brits flew out and every one of us enjoyed an amazing stay at the Kimberly.

The rooms are homely, spacious and thanks to the housekeeping, always pristine.

Staff were kind, courteous and friendly throughout. 

The footmen will happily get you a taxi or if you're looking for the subway it's only a short walk away.

It was a genuine pleasure to enjoy the exceptional hospitality the Kimberly offers. Highly recommended and would certainly stay again.

title: Amazing
text:
85 of us stayed at the hotel and there was simply ample space, ample food at breakfast and a fantastic group of staff members. 
Coming and going was so easy, the footman was always able to find a taxi for large groups and always did it with such pleasure. 

Staff joined us at a function and were simply lovely, approachable and friendly. 

I would recommend the Kimberly to anyone wanting to stay in a great location in NY.

title: Remember to bring your earplugs!
text:
Stayed here for a couple of days this week, and in honesty was slightly underwhelmed.

Check In was efficient but no sign of the warm and friendly service highlighted by the hotel in their biog. 

Room was lovely; spacious, clean and matched the description of what we had booked and the hotel had put is in a quiet part of the hotel as we’d requested.

The biggest issue, however, was the hotels location on a busy road with major renovations going on straight opposite. Couple this with the overnight refuse collections and it was practically impossible to get a good nights sleep. I suggest the hotel signposts this upfront to guests as it definitely would have been taken into account had we known. 

If you’re a heavy sleeper then it’s a good hotel, however if not don’t forget the earplugs

title: my favorite place in NYC
text:
it's definitely the best place to stay in NYC, for several reasons, location between 3rd and lexington 
amazing breakfast served at the rooftop, quality of the bed , just whaoooo, 
staff always smiling, happy to welcome you , 
large room, confortable 
can't wait to come back

title: Truly Amazing with exceptional customer service!!
text: From the moment we walked in the hotel we were met with a team that went above and beyond to make sure our needs were met and our expectations were exceeded.  Honestly everyone we came in contact with was extremely friendly and helpful. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite to celebrate a Graduation and used the room as a gathering place.  A gorgeous & spacious room that was clean, comfortable and had great mid-town views.  The balcony was an unexpected pleasure to take in the views and assess the weather.  Roof-top restaurant with open air seating is a must see.

title: Great staff, rooms could be better
text:
We had stayed at The Kimberly before many years ago, about 15 years ago, and I'm not sure much has changed since then.  While in some regards this was charming, other aspects of the hotel are in need of some TLC.
We stayed in a suite for a long weekend.  Other members of our group were also staying at the hotel and we were all checked in shortly after arrival, including one guest who arrived early in the morning.  It's always nice to get checked in right away after any flight.  The front desk staff was friendly as were the bell men at this time and for the remainder of our stay.
Our suite was decorated with bespoke furniture.  Some was amazing such as the chest of drawers in the bedroom but other pieces like the sofa were probably in need of being replaced or reupholstered.  We didn't care for the old looking carpeting but loved that our room had a balcony and kitchenette closet.  We felt like we had plenty of room to spread out which is a rarity in New York City hotel rooms.  The bathroom, however, was still quite small.  Although the furnishings appeared to be relatively updated the bathroom is still little and there is just not enough room to put your things.  In addition, if one were inclined to take a bath they would be quite cramped.  The width of the tub bottom was certainly smaller than an average household bathtub.
My biggest complaint was probably the cleanliness.  There were some areas of the bathroom which I could tell had not been properly cleaned before our arrival and there were no spare rolls of toilet paper.  The hair dryer handle was sticky I suppose from a prior guests hair product.  Worst of all, when we were looking around for a lost sock, my husband pulled a sock from underneath one of the chairs, and this sock did not belong to us.
I also did not like that there was no changing table in the restroom off of the lobby.  In addition, my infant son was not welcome in the upstairs bar area in the evenings; not that we were hanging out in a bar with a baby but we like to meet for a drink before going to dinner.  It was disappointing that this was not an option for us.  It is a lovely space.  They do allow children in the area in the afternoon where self service tea and pastries are available.
The Kimberly is charming but the rooms are in need of a little extra care.  It is a more traditional hotel rather than the boutique-modern style most hotels seem to be going for now.  You will be respected as a guest and won't feel cramped as you might at another NYC hotel.

title: Jeff and Barb Rubin
text:
We are actually “locals,” and came to Manhattan to meet our visiting family. We come to Manhattan often for the theatre, shopping and dining and have not yet stayed at The Kimberly.
What an absolutely fabulous experience! Our kids got a suite on a high floor with an outstanding view and my husband and I got a beautiful suite as well; cozy, scrupulously clean and beautifully appointed. I, as well prefer older hotels and The Kimberly did not disappoint!
The staff is very caring and friendly and every request gets handled immediately, no matter how small!
Amenities are terrific; Poland Spring water bottles, Wolfgang Puck coffee in a pot you actually know how to work, L’Occitane toiletries, just to name a few.
Whether you are close by or far away, The Kimberly is the place to stay!

title: Mrs
text: I went to roof top with friends and we have that pleasure  that Johely serves  us , she is such a pleasant  lady and amazing bartend  more then happy  to recomend  her and the place , music fabulous  and view even better

title: Great location - we will return!
text:
The Kimberly Hotel staff were incredibly consistent - all very attentive and happy to be of service to their guests.  Our room was spacious and very comfortable.  Linens were lovely and bed was comfortable.  The Kimberly is located just a 20 min walk to Times Sq, but feels further away - a quiet area.  Lots of restaurants in the the area to walk to.  We loved finishing the day up in the roof top bar, with its fantastic view of The Chrysler Building at night.  
We will be back!

title: Awesome
text: We just spent a week at the Kimberley and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in New York City.The hotel is very clean centrally located and the staff are very well versed in customer service.We  had a couple of issues with our room upon arrival and they were take care of immediately. When you see Gregory at the front door he will instantly brighten your day with his smile.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights to celebrate our anniversary.  The room was spacious and very clean.  I personally prefer a more traditionally styled hotel and do not like ultra modern hotels so this hotel was perfect.  All the employees were very kind and helpful.   Another plus is the location, we were within walking distance to St. Patricks Cathedral, great shopping and Central Park.  We hope to return in the future.

title: Grande chambre - bien équipée - hôtel bien placé - Parfait !
text: Nous étions 4 pour un séjour de quelques jours... Nous avions une suite avec 2 lits doubles. Le séjour était parfait ! La suite spacieuse (env 50 m²) est composée d'une chambre avec 2 lits doubles super confortables et d'un salon avec canapé, table basse, bureau, coin cuisine. Nous avions aussi un balcon (mais au 20eme étage, mon vertige m'a un peu bloqué pour en profiter :-)). La vue n'était pas fantastique, nous donnions sur le dos d'autres bâtiments mais la chambre était spacieuse, très bien équipée et l'hotel est super bien placé (près du Rockfeller center, à proximité de nombreux petits restos). Nous avons vraiment profité. Un petit conseil, allez prendre au moins une fois le petit déjeuner sur le rooftop... la vue est superbe et le cadre très agréable. Le petit déjeuner (buffet) est copieux et très bon.

title: Vintage con tanti pregi
text: Albergo vintage lussuoso in una posizione perfetta per visitare tutto ciò che offre NY. Personale estremamente gentile e premuroso nei confronti degli ospiti, suite ampie composte da 2 stanze + cucina attrezzata per spuntini e colazione ideale per famiglie soprattutto se si vuole risparmiare qualcosa per i pasti, zona notte con 2 letti king size, salotto con divano e tavolo, bagno piccolo non del tutto conforme ad un 4* senza nessuna caratteristica distintiva. Ottimo rapporto qualita/prezzo se si riesce a prenotare in anticipo (270€ a notte x 4 adulti). Location perfetta con locali per mangiare a qualsiasi prezzo, supermercato e diverse subway a pochi metri, a circa 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square e dal MoMA.

title: The Kimberly Hotel is my new NYC favorite!
text: The Kimberly hotel was beyond my expectations! The amedities in the room were endless & the room was clean & spacious! The rooftop deck was perfect for dining, and the staff throughout the property were awesome! I will for sure be back as soon as possible!

title: Great choice for a Midtown stay
text:
I’ve stayed at several other properties in Midtown, and this is now my favorite. I chose a king suite (9F), which was quite spacious. Having a small refrigerator and microwave available was very convenient for my 6-day stay. There were a few little extras touches, too —  two large umbrellas in the coat closet, a heated tile floor in the bathroom, and an electronically adjustable bed.

I requested a quiet room due to construction out front and was bothered by any noise. My room faced the back and didn’t have much of a view, so I didn’t use the balcony much. Instead, I went to the penthouse in the afternoon occasionally for some free coffee, fruit, and pastries. It had a wonderful view.

title: NY Hidden Gem
text: This hotel is the best. I have been staying here for over 10 years now and it is NYC's best kept secret. It's location is so central to moost things or a short cab ride. Their hotel employee retention rate is 20+ years. Thats says a lot in this business. Each member of their team went above and beyond to make my stay extrodinary. Someone was always willing to ask if I needed help or entertaining my kids with the aquarium while I handled getting directions. The rooms are some of teh most spacious I have ever seen in all of NYC and Im here alot. The price point is fantastic for families looking for extra space as well. I can't say enough great things about this hotel.

title: The best hotel in NYC
text:
The Kimberly Hotel is by far one of my favorite hotels and is the only hotel I will book for visits to NYC. 

The hotel is centrally located, so it is easy to get around the city inexpensively via cab or Uber, and close enough to walk to popular locations (e.g., Broadway, Times Square and other sites).  The restaurant in the hotel, Bistango, serves delicious Italian food, and the rooftop bar has tasty light bites, superb cocktails, great music and a beautiful crowd – it’s definitely the place to be and photo-op worthy. Either would be great for a night out or special occasion.

The staff treats you like royalty (who wouldn’t love that) and the room is spacious, well-decorated and cozy.  I feel like I’m coming home after being out all day from wondering the city or attending meetings.  Also, the concierge can offer great restaurant or Broadway show recommendations if you need suggestions.  

I’ve stayed at other hotels in NYC; however, since I stayed at the Kimberly hotel a few years ago, I haven’t considered booking anywhere else.

title: Best kept secret in NYC! Our #2 in all of NYC (email for our #1).
text:
The Excellent:  We could live here. Around 500+ square feet, the one bedroom suite has a bathroom, separate washroom, large king size bedroom (with TV) , and a living room area (with TV), bar and kitchenette. Could easily host host a cocktail party with seating for 10 (with it's huge balcony). 

Linens were crisp and clean, great bath amenities! Two beautiful terry cloth robes and slippers (a bit small for us, but a nice touch)!

Complimentary bottled water.

Nice small workout room on-site with cold towels to refresh you, plus privileges at a GREAT NYC health club. 

Rooftop bar has SUPER $22 buffet breakfast, along with a-la-cart items like the avocado toast I ordered twice ($14). Kudos to Aidan(?) upstairs for SUPER service. 

Bellmen:are exceptional. Kudos to Gregory for making every entrance and exit a joy!

Snacks include free coffee, tea, pastries, and fruit 11-4 weekdays on the rooftop. 

Newspapers include free NY Times and Wall Street Journal.

Two TVs with lots of choices and a clear picture.

Very attentive housekeeping staff.

Amenities are super, including amazing L'Occitane bath products, and almost everything you would need in an overnight kit, cotton, q-tips, facial wipes, even ear plugs! Super attention to detail. 

OK, but not great: 
Checking out, the desk staff person was not too enthusiastic. Efficient, but not so friendly. 

Concierge: Seemed bored and uninterested; helpful when asked but with limited knowledge of even the few blocks surrounding the hotel.

Only Complaint: Our only CONTINUED problem (second stay): UPSTAIRS rooftop bar at night!At night (the same rooftop with great service for breakfast), the bar is much more stand-and model (as I posted in my last review). I went to the bar to simply get a glass of ice for the room and was given the ice, tipped the bartender, but was quickly shown the elevator as I was not appropriately dressed (I had black sneakers), jeans, and was otherwise dressed  appropriately, but was not YOUNG or PRETTY. The rooftop bar, at night is my one complaint about an othersie AMAZING property. One person told me on the phone the v=bat=r and hotel are separate businesses. It may have been rented out for an event, though it did not look like it was. If so, they could have met me at the elevator and indicated it was a private event, not shunned me back down to my level. But, no worries, the View (rooftop at the Marriott Marquis is happy to take our money for a much better view of the city). So Upstairs, is GREAT in the morning, but families, old, people, and ugly people must stay in their lanes, so to speak, at night, on the rooftop. Sad.

Kudos: My #2 in all of NYC! Would be happy to live here. Love the L'Occitane bath products!

Suggestions: Rooftop bar at night should be for guests, first. Water, coffee, tea in lobby might be a nice extra.

title: Amazing rooms but noisy at front
text: Hotel is beautiful from the minute you walk inside and rooms are equally beautiful, decor is very classy. We were lucky to be upgraded to a suite which was amazing but unfortunately our first nights sleep was not good, windows are old and have no soundproofing, being on a low floor at the front of hotel was awful for sleeping, we requested to move after first night and got moved to much higher floor at other side of hotel, what a difference. I would say all the amazing reviews are from people who didn't stay on the noisy side and once we moved rooms it was perfect. I think they are aware of the noise and try their best to alleviate the issue by providing earplugs. If they upgraded the windows at front it would make such a difference to the hotel as it really is top class in every other way.

title: Great for our family
text:
Awesome stay. Very clean, comfortable, very spacious, great location.
2 adults, a teen and a tween, was hard to work out where to stay that would have suitable bedding arrangements. An online advert suggested the Kimberly (after attempts to book somewhere else fell through) and it was awesome.
Two double beds in one room and a sofa bed in the other was the perfect arrangement for us, and the kitchenette made our stay so much easier. A TV in each room helped to give the kids some time away form each other. 
Higher end than our family usually stays in - the kid's couldn't believe their luck.
The hotel's location was perfect for exploring New York. 
Friendly welcoming staff.

title: Découverte
text: Hôtel que nous recommandons pour la qualité du service, l amabilité du personnel, la superficie des chambres et la localisation qui nous a permis de sillonner à pied la ville. Le restaurant de l hôtel offre un choix large de mets méditerranéen .

title: Great Hotel
text:
We booked the Kimberley for our New York stay based on other reviews here and it certainly didn’t disappoint.
From the moment you walk in and see the boutique styling you know it’s a little gem!
All the staff were very friendly and the rooms are spacious with one of the comfiest beds I’ve ever slept in!
The roof bar is very lively and certainly worth popping up for a few drinks.
The location is also perfect and close to lots of attractions also.

The only down side is that the food in the hotel is on the expensive side but there are plenty of cafes/bagel shops nearby to get some breakfast etc...

There is some road/traffic noise but you’re in the middle of New York so it’s to be expected!

Thanks again for a great stay.

title: Very good stay at The Kimberly
text: The hotel is perfectly positioned at walking distance from midtown highlights as Rockefeller Center, Grand Station or Times Square and theaters. The suite we had was large with two seperate rooms and a very useful kitchenette equipped with microwave, fridge, toaster and coffee machine. Beds are comfortable. The bathroom could have been larger but shower was great. We had once breakfast and they displayed a large variety of food of good quality. The only issue but not hotel's fault is the noise reaching the rooms from the street, particularly of the building works of the huge building just in front. In any case, definitely recommended!

title: Noisy
text: Great location in Midtown, great roof top bar yet the rooms are so noisy that the Property supplies it’s own ear plugs! Old style European 60’s style. It’s like sleeping every night on a plane. Give it a miss!

title: Huge Suite For a Very Reasonable Price
text: First time staying at The Kimberly, but won't be the last.  Hotel feels a little worn, but far exceeded our expectations in terms of size and amenities  - very comfortable king bed and TV in one room, but also had a foyer, the very large bathroom, and a large, separate living room that had a fold-out sleeper couch, desk, and another large TV.  Lots of nice little touches that you would expect to pay more for.  Staff was very welcoming and responsive.  Location is great  - half a block from the subway, walking distance to St Patrick's Cathedral, NBC, TImes Square, etc.

title: My Favorite Hotel
text: Everything about the Kimberly is close to perfect, from the courteous, friendly, and efficient staff to the accommodations, location, and price, which is very reasonable for such luxury. I arrived almost five hours early and was willing to wait, but was checked in immediately with no problem. The woman at the front desk greeted me as though I was an old friend, and said, "Welcome back," even though my last stay was nine years ago. I can't praise this place enough, but I hope it doesn't become so popular that there's no room for me next time I go to New York. (And, the bar on the roof makes the best Manhattans I've ever had!) I wish I could give it ten stars.

title: Fantastic hotel for a family with teenagers
text:
We chose The Kimberley because of the size of the rooms and it was absolutely the right decision. It's not a cool hotel or a cool location, but it does make staying in the city with two teenagers for 5 nights a pleasure. We had two (small) double beds and a sofa bed in the lounge so our kids had their own beds - our suite was bigger than most Manhattan apartments. 
Super friendly reception staff and doormen, very clean and quiet. The midtown location means that you can walk to many of the touristy destinations - it was perfect for us. The only advice I would give is not to eat at the hotel. We had breakfast upstairs one day as a treat, our most expensive breakfast of our visit by a long way. Standard buffet, only eggs (over) cooked to order, dirty tables, nothing special at all. Go to John's Coffee Shop on 44th and 2nd instead.

title: Parfait!
text:
Emplacement parfait, calme, bel établissement, personnel très sympathique.
Literie confortable, repos assuré
Tout était parfait
Un petit problème avec le ménage de la salle de bain qui laissait à désirer mais je l'ai signalé et le problème a été réglé

title: Great Stay
text: This was our first stay at this wonderful hotel and I hope it will not be our last. The staff as others have indicated are welcoming and accommodating and go out of the way to ensure your needs are met. We had a king suite and what a great place for both space and comfort, it feels like a nice one bedroom apartment in a great location in the city. It is well located just a few blocks from 5th Ave and grand Central Station for subway connections. The best part of the room was without a doubt the comfort of the bed and the great shower..the bed was amazing!! And the great shower in the morning was a great way to start the day. It will be a go to for trips to the city.

title: Exceptional Experiences on Every Stay
text: The Team at The Kimberly treat you like family from the minute you pull to the front entrance until you leave.  Many of the staff remember you from previous visits. They all  thank you for returning and are always offering to do anything they can to make your stay pleasurable.  The suite rooms are spacious, comfortable, immaculate, and tastefully decorated.  The beds are the most comfortable ones I have ever slept on away from home. The location is excellent- easy walk to shows, shopping, and great restaurants.  Plus The Kimberly's own dining opportunities are delicious. Every Team member that we have encountered is friendly, professional, accommodating every need, and happy to be there for their guests!!  The Kimberly has truly become our Home away from home!!!

title: Best Hotel in New York City
text:
Without a doubt, the Kimberly Hotel is one of my favorite hotels, worldwide.  Upon arrival, we are always greeted warmly by the staff, who are very friendly.  

The rooms are warm and inviting and they have the best beds, hands down of any hotel in which I have stayed.  There is a great balcony, on which you can sit and listen to the sounds of the city.  The bathrooms have a wonderful rain shower and I love the amenities.  

The location is a prime one, in Midtown, near Rockefeller Center, Times Square as well as the theater district.  There are many times when I have walked to see my Broadway show when taxis and ubers were difficult to find.  There are a number of great restaurants around the hotel, but the ones in the hotel are excellent.  The Italian food at Bistango is to die for and the Rooftop has been a wonderful addition.  There is a wonderful ambiance of twinkling lights with a view of the Chrysler building, made even better with the retractable all glass ceiling, great music and delicious food at night and also at breakfast daily.  

Clearly, there are many choices when you are in New York to visit.  However, the atmosphere at the Kimberly Hotel is so special that it feels like coming home each time I visit.

title: A gem on the East Side
text: The Kimberly Hotel is like a home away from home.  The staff is welcoming and always eager to help and make us feel comfortable.  The rooms are warm and comfortable.  Great place to stay in NYC.  The beds were quite comfortable.  Great rain shower in the bathroom. We always come back to the Kimberly.

title: Birthday/Anniversary getaway
text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary and my birthday, and ran some errands in the city. This hotel was highly recommended to me from friends at work who said they would never stay anywhere else in the city since staying at The Kimberly and now I see why. I felt like we had our own little luxury apartment. The staff was wonderful, especially Gregory at the door, he's delightful and the young Asian woman who checked us in, so eager to answer all our questions. I wish we had time to stay longer. Breakfast on the roof top was lovely and the bar at night was a great place to hang out with friends. Thank you for helping us celebrate!

title: My new go to NYC
text: A friend recommended the Kimberly to me. I had been a staunch Waldorf Astoria guest and with the grand establishment closed, we decided to give the Kimberly a try. I was blown away. The staff, from doorman, valet, bell hop, front desk and housekeeping were all incredibly friendly, warm and welcoming. The rooms are beautiful, the balconies breathtaking. They offer any amenity you can imagine. I had mentioned it was my husbands birthday when we made the reservation and we were welcomed with a bottle of Prosecco in our suite upon arrival. I will most definitely be staying at the Kimberly from now on.

title: The Kimberly Hotel
text:
On our trip to New York to get married we stayed at The Kimberly Hotel and it was the right choice. This is a great hotel with great staff who are genuinely happy at their work . 
The room we originally stayed in was ideal however once the hotel were aware that we were getting married whist in NY they upgraded us to a suite which just enhanced our already high opinion of this hotel. 
When the time comes for us to return to New York we will certainly return to The KImberly

title: Great stay awesome accommodation
text:
We are a family of five, 45, 44, 15, 13 and 7. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment on the 27th floor. I’ve never had such generous accommodation in NYC.  It even had a little kitchen and a dining area big enough for 5 to breakfast comfortably.  

The view of the Chrysler building and also across town to the east river was excellent, we had breakfast served there everyday with that awesome view.  

We had a great balcony, that gave a real sense of the city, I’ve been coming to NYC for 25 years with work and have stayed all over the city (all top end) and this was by far the best place I’ve stayed.  The hotel has 2 restaurants and a bar on the roof where breakfast is also served. 

From the moment we pulled up at the curb, we were greeted by Harry, who instantly gave us a sense that this was going to be a more personal and service driven experience, all our interactions with the staff where first class, I’m not sure where they are finding these folk but they all care about what they do, which is priceless.  

The 51st street metro stop is 100yds from the hotel, there is a casual diner immediately next door and also Urban eats, which has everything you could want to eat about 150yds away.  The Drug store is also 150yds.  Rockefeller center With tons of shops and restaurants is like 3 blocks away. 

For larger families this hotel is an absolute no brainer.

title: Wonderful hotel for a milestone birthday weekend.
text: We loved our stay over the weekend at the Kimberly. The room was large and well furnished and the bathroom and toiletries were excellent. We especially liked the doormen and the valet car service. The rooftop bAr was beautiful and not to be missed. The hotel is on an excellent location and you can walk to many things. The subways are also close. It was a great and very special place to stay!

title: Wonderful Hotel in a Great Location
text: I surprised my husband with a trip to NYC to see a concert at the Jazz Lincoln Center for his birthday and chose to stay at The Kimberly and what a perfect choice! We spent 3 nights in the executive king bedroom suite with a balcony and great views since it was a corner room.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating, we will definitely be back!

title: Affordable luxury and lots of space
text:
Stayed here for a week in October. Loved it. Going back this May:-)

I chose this hotel because we traveled with a teen and needed more space than the average N.Y.C hotel room. We stayed in The Luxury One Bedroom Two Queen Bed and it was perfect for our needs. Due to the seperate livingroom we didn't have to go to bed , or get out of bed, at the same time. I can really recommand this hotel for families with older children/teens. 

-Safe and nice neighbourhood. Lots of dining options and within walking distance to Rockefeller plaza, fifth avenue, Times Square, Grand Central etc
-Close to subway
-Huge rooms
-Comfy beds
-Free slippers and bathrobes
-Sitting area
-Coffee maker
-Fridge
-Microwave
-Bath amenities from L'Occitane
-Nice and friendly staff
-Luxurious, but a bit dated. Though not very modern, this hotel certainly has it uniqe stule, LOVE It. 
-Be sure to check out the view from the roof top bar.
-Excellent maintenance service. They came within minutes to fix an urgent problem, even though it was very early in the morning. 
-Old school doormen, super friendly 

All in all this was a super stay, great value for our money. The only thing I could wish for for our next stay is a room with a slightly better  view :-) 
See you soon, Kimberly!

title: Always sad to leave the Kimberly
text: The most amazing staff. Always a nice smile from Gregory when you step out of the cab at the Kimberly. Great rooms, bedding, bathrooms and overall amazing hotel! I’m always sad to leave the Kimberly. Looking forward to my next visit.

title: Amazing hotel in a great location
text: The staff at The Kimberly were super responsive and accommodating. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, and the room was gorgeous with a plethora of amenities. Can't beat the view as well! It's super convenient to get there off the subway, and the staff helped us get a cab if we needed as well. The rooftop bar was amazing at night, and not overcrowded but also great views! It's an older hotel (not exactly modern) but had perfectly modern amenities. I loved the charm and would definitely come back to The Kimberly!

title: Yet another amazing visit
text: I was in the Duplex - 8H . Two bed suite with spiral staircase and an outdoor veranda area.  Separate lounge and 2 bathrooms . One huge bed in the upstairs bedroom and one huge bed in downstairs bedroom . Beds are BEST I've ever slept in.  Can accommodate rollaway beds if needs be. Recently decorated , stunning room. 8th floor. This is my 14th year staying here at this hotel , twice a year. Hotel is like returning home and staff are like family. Virtually NO STAFF TURNOVER !! Awesome rooftop bar where breakfast is served . Breakfast staff are just the best as is everyone else including Door Staff and Reception . Nothing too much trouble. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for business and family alike.

title: Fantastic staff
text: The staff at the Kimberly, especially Harry, Paul, Ralph and all the other people in the lobby and outside to great us, treat us like family. We always feel warmly welcomed and well taken care of. The hotel goes out of its way to welcome us back each time we stay, and the suites are beautiful, spacious, and extremely comfortable. The stunning fish tank in the room next to the lobby is also a wonderful addition.

title: Not quite Valentine’s day in New York
text:
Thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend in NYC.

A great hotel with spacious rooms, friendly staff, great service and good food.

A convenient spot but sufficiently set back from the mad hustle and bustle, so you can enjoy NY and then step back and recharge before heading out again! A bit too close to Bloomingdales - if you’re with someone who loves to shop 😉.

The enclosed roof terrace was a lovely breakfast spot, and turns into a popular bar in the evening, with some great views. There’s also some outdoor sitting space on the roof, which was great.

Thank you Kimberly for making our stay so enjoyable.

title: The Kimberly - always delivers!
text: Have been staying at The Kimberly for 15 years.  We love this hotel.  Rooms are very spacious, they have many suites complete with kitchens and balconies.  Bell men always remember our faces and make us feel like we are coming to our home in the city!  Great value for what you get.  The restaurant is really quite good and we love the rooftop bar!  Great for couples, business and families.  Set in mid-town - perfect location!

title: A Wonderful Weekend Getaway!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Kimberly. The staff - especially the night manager was extraordinarily nice and accommodating. In fact, upon arrival (which was very late due to travel problems) he kindly offered us an upgrade to a suite as he wanted to make sure our first stay was memorable. And indeed it was. Also, the roof top bar/restaurant was wonderful. Excellent cocktails and really friendly service. People just seemed happy to work there. Easy walk to theater district and so many fun places to eat and grab a cup of coffee near by. We will definitely be coming back!

title: Great visit, great location
text:
We were welcomed by a very friendly doorman (the follwing days his colleague was equally friendly, tip the guys) and bagageguy (tip him too). At the desk they were a bit grumpy when we were checking in. We stayed in room 8J. Very pleasantly surprised when we opened the door. The room was very spacious, we had a balcony, and a big bathroom. The room was very clean overall except for the bathroom, a bit dirty around the shower but nothing too much. The radiator ( this and the grumpy checkinstaff make it 4/5 and not 5/5) makes a lot of noise. Impossible to sleep through i you would want it on while sleeping. If this is also the airco, I imagine it getting pretty hot in there in the summer. So that might be a problem. They should fix it, because this is an insanely nice hotel and the radiator just doesn't fit in for some odd reason :)
But overall: would definetly recommend!!

title: Luxe spacious accomodation
text:
Great to have space to move! Booked a luxury 1 bedroom suite. We had a lounge/dining area with a kitchenette (sink, microwave, toaster, kettle) in cupboards behind the large bar. Plenty of cupboard space for clothes and luggage. Separate bedroom. Small but sufficient bathroom with a 2nd vanity outside the bedroom in a small hall (very handy). Good gym. Excellent staff who were very helpful. Lovely aquarium in lobby. 
We had a balcony which was too noisey to sit on as there was an airconditioner on a neighbouring roof top. But we could see the top of the Chrysler Building from our balcony. Traffic noise also meant sitting out wasn't the thing to do (level 20 from memory). I didn't hear traffic at night, but my husband could hear sirens sometimes. Think that is unavoidable in NY!
Slightly less busy area of Manhattan but still walking distance to Times Square and theatre district. We generally took the subway (2 blocks away) or an Uber to a show, but enjoyed the walk back to the hotel afterwards. Easy walk to 5th Ave for shopping and even to Central Park. 
Not a huge range of shops in the streets close to the hotel, but a few multi purpose stores where we could pick up food for our apartment (Walgreens, Duane Reade etc) & some restaurants of varying price ranges (even cheap options like Starbucks, Panda Express & McDonalds all within a block or so)
Trendy rooftop bar that also provided free snacks/coffee during the day if we were around. Bottled water provided daily in room.
High end accommodation at a reasonable price compared to many hotels in NY.  You will find cheaper places to stay, but not necessarily anywhere of this standard of luxury in the price range and with this amount of space. Book well in advanced and the rates are much friendly. Will stay again if visiting (depending upon the rate available at the time)

title: Boutique lodging and the unforgettable Harry and Rafe!
text: Great midtown location, lush furnishings, warm and helpful staff at all levels. In particular, the doormen are beyond compare and they make the difference in my returning year after year. Special thanks to Harry for being so consistent and hard-working!

title: Lovely Stay
text: This is a charming boutique hotel in midtown where the staff is friendly, and rooms are comfortable with plenty of closet and storage space. The front desk staff were very pleasant and accommodating of requests and the doormen ever smiling and helpful. In addition to two generous sized beds in the bedroom, the living room had a queen sized pullout couch that was very comfortable to sleep on. We noted it was pre-dressed with sheets, so no need to make it up before sleeping, and extra blankets and pillows were found stored in a nearby closet so no need to call staff for them. Coffee and a coffeemaker, tea, glassware, silverware and plates, a bar sink plus microwave and fridge made things extra pleasant. We really enjoyed waking up, putting on the comfy hotel robes, and lounging about in our comfortable room while enjoying a pre breakfast (or late evening) cup of tea or coffee. A very reasonably priced and quick service diner is located steps away, or breakfast can be had on the hotel’s PH level where a bonus city view is provided. This hotel is great for families, friends, couples and business travelers.

title: Noisy but great location
text: The service at this hotel is attentive and professional. We did have two glitches: I asked for a quiet room and got 3rd floor on the street side. We were awakened numerous times with sirens and street noise.  The AC was not working and I had to ask for maintenance to come late at night. Other than that, the rooms were nicely appointed, the bathroom was small but elegant and the location can't be beat.

title: Classy Hotel...
text:
We stayed at The Kimberly for one week during UK half term break in February. Having arrived at Newark airport we had pre-booked a Dial7 taxi which got us to the hotel in forty minutes...brilliant! Check-in was fast and we were given complimentary wi-fi. Just a note here regarding wi-fi...we found it pretty poor; it frequently dips in and out which was annoying. 
We stayed in room 7J. The room was so spacious. It had two double beds with beautiful soft bed linen and cosy down quilts. There was a table with two chairs to relax on with a glass of wine. A coffee machine (no kettle), lots of tea and coffee supplies, complimentary still water, a fridge and a microwave. The bathroom was lovely...metro tiles from floor to ceiling, a rain shower over the bath, lots of towels and L’occtaine toiletries which were a treat to use. 
Our only negatives were...insufficient cupboard and hanging space for the four of us. The wardrobe was quite small with little space to put our things in. The windows are single glassed and the noise outside was evident. Construction work across the road occurred late at night which was noisy! I used the ear plugs which were supplied. 

Take the lift to ‘Upstairs’ the rooftop bar. They provide complimentary coffee, tea, juice, pastries and fruit from 11am to 4pm weekdays. This was a lovely touch and the views are wonderful.

We ate at two places near the hotel which were just ok:
Spice Symphony which is across the road from the hotel. Nice ambience and attentive staff but average food. This place gets rave reviews. 
The NYC Luncheonette which is up the road (right out of hotel). We were underwhelmed with the breakfast we had especially as it has good reviews. 

Places we ate at and enjoyed:

West way Diner in Hells Kitchen - busy but efficient with lovely breakfast options. Our children loved the Chocolate Nut Blast French toast :)
Five Napkins also in Hells Kitchen. Great burgers. Make a booking as it gets busy.
Pure Thai Cookhouse in Hells Kitchen - wonderful food, tiny restaurant which gets very busy.  If you have to wait for a table pop across the road to Jaspers Taphouse. Great selection of beers. We had a meal in here on one of the nights...good food, particularly the loaded nachos. Karaoke on Wednesdays is a laugh!
Rubirosa in Little Italy - book if you can as it is always busy. Beautiful pasta dishes and pizzas.
Levain Bakery which is not far from Central Park - to die for cookies which are huge and like nothing you will have tasted before.
San Marzano in East Village is a busy, noisy restaurant with tasty inexpensive pasta dishes. You can choose any shaped pasta and sauce for $10! Cheap for NYC. We ate here twice and loved it. Brussel sprouts, Fuji apple and pecorino cheese starter is a must. The garlic bread is yummy too. 
Donught Plant in Grand Central - if you like donughts you will love this place. We got our donughts and coffees and stood at a table and watched all the comings and goings in this fabulous station. 
Other options for breakfast are Bubbys near The Highline and Clinton Street Baking Company. Both are really nice places. Clinton Street Baking Company open at 8am and quickly fills up. 
Finally! We bought a one week Metro pass for the four of us which cost $32 each. You can buy these at any subway kiosk or ticket machine. So worth it and it makes getting round the city so easy despite the metro being a tricky one to get your head round!

Enjoy your trip - this was our second holiday in New York and it won’t be our last.

title: My home away from home
text: Since we moved from NYC, the Kimberly Hotel is our place to stay when we go back.  It is in our old neighborhood, our restaurants, our stomping ground.  The rooms are like a one bedroom apartment, love the space, the service and the location. The Kimberly has a roof top restaurant, bar and is sexy, intimate and fun.  It's our home away from home.

title: Wonderful Birthday Weekend!
text: I brought my daughter and some friends for a sweet 16 weekend in NYC. We absolutely loved The Kimberly Hotel!  I stayed in a 2 double bed suite which was lovely and very large. Pull out sofa, dining table and kitchenette were wonderful!  The breakfast at The Upstairs was delicious (we had the buffet) and the outdoor patio was nice even in the winter. Hotel is centrally located, we walked to Broadway, Times Square, St Patrick’s and Central Park. Room and parking was reasonably priced. I would absolutely recommend The Kimberly Hotel!

title: Wonderful Hotel and Great Location
text:
I stayed at The Kimberly Hotel for one night and the hospitality was more than excellent. The Hotel is really beautiful the design gives you the 'Luxury New York' vibes. The location is also excellent as the hotel is at Midtown between the 3rd and Lexington Avenues.

The suite was really spacious and luxurious with a balcony to enjoy the amazing Manhattan views. Everything was spotless in the room.
The Staff is very friendly and helpful and went the extra mile with any of my requests.

I especially loved the Rooftop which is really nice with excellent breakfast and the view is unbeatable. 

In general, my experience was more than excellent and beyond my expectations and I would definitely return back when visiting New York in the future.

title: Client Focus
text:
My wife and me were in this hotel during 7 days in September 2018 and our stay was good.

First thing the traveller should know it is that the Hotel has 2 buildings. Main one which looks nice inside and has good views to the city. And the adjacent one, which looks older and the views are dissapointing (interior views) as some travelers have shown in their pictures. Location is perfect for visiting New York, and the area is very safe and quiet in the night, though there are some restaurants around. 

In the first moment we were given a room in the adjacent building which I would rate with 4 points (nice and big room, good bathroom, good clean service, but dissapointing views).

During the fourth day the elevator got of order in the evening and we complained about the situation (our room was on the 4th floor). The reaction of the assistant to General Manager Mr. Jorge Garciadealba was simply perfect. He apologized for the situation and invite us to dinner. Next day the elevator continued broken so we were changed to a suite in the main building, and I can only say it was incredible (very big, nice views...).

To be honest, should I have stayed the whole week in the first room, I would rate the hotel with 4 points. But rooms in the main building deserve clearly 5 points.

Let me again remark the treatment of Mr. Garciadealba which was what a traveller always expects when there is a problem: apologies and solutions. That is Client Focus! 5 Points.

Rest of the Hotel employees were very nice as well but do not remember their names only nationalities (Venezuelan in the Italian restaurant, Mexican in the breakfast roof restaurant).

title: FRBD-2
text: Rooms are nice. The location in midtown Manhattan can’t be beat. What makes this hotel really special is the staff. The Staff is very friendly and helpful.  This is easily my preferred hotel when I’m in NYC.

title: Charming, and perfect location
text: We were in town for a family event. A friend recommended the Kimberly, and I'm so glad she did! Staff is welcoming and attentive, and the hotel oozes the kind of old word charm you don't see much in New York any more. The atmosphere is elegant and unhurried. Just what you need for a luxury weekend break, or an oasis after a day of sightseeing. We'll be back!

title: Good stay and unbeatable location
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights in January. The situation of the hotel was perfect for all the sites in Midtown Manhattan, including Rockefeller, Time Square and Bloomingdales. 

We used the hop on hop off bus to go further with no problem. 

The hotel is traditional against the more modern ones but was great for us and the staff were welcoming. 

It has two restaurants and we ate in both, an Italian and a steakhouse. Both were good. 

We had a room looking over the from without a balcony, but in view of the weather (-15) we wouldn’t have used it. The room was spacious and comfortable albeit the bathroom a little small but still ok. 

If you are looking for a hotel in a good location with good rooms and eating this is the one.

title: Old school comfort and service, right where you need to be.
text: You get a really genuine and lovely reception when you arrive here.  The ambiance and style of the hotel is old school charm and first class service.  Every member of staff we encountered made the effort to greet us, chat or ask if we needed anything.  My daughter and I stayed for the weekend and the location was perfect for our sightseeing agenda.  The rooms are beautifully appointed and the beds are super comfortable, with robes and slippers and L'Occitane amenities, the mini bar had half bottles not miniatures, a boot cleaner, and the absolute best part was our 'Handy'!  The 'Handy' is an iphone preprogrammed with everything you need to find your way around the city, restaurants, sights to see and how to get there and you can bring it with you outside of the hotel saving your own data - this is a fantastic piece of customer service.  We had tapas in the rooftop bar and cocktails on our first night which were delicious but the tapas were huge - we had four and two would have been more than enough, trust me on this the calamari was about four times the normal tapas size you'de get anywhere.  The rooftop bar is quite noisy with a fun, trendy vibe in an old world beautiful setting and the staff were efficient and friendly.  I have nothing at all to critique about this hotel, it was just fantastic and I'd recommend it for anyone.  We're so used to massive hotel chains you forget how nice it is to have individually designed hotels, rooms, staff who are proud of their hotel because it's unique and committed to great customer service.  Stay here, you will love it.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Girls trip for the weekend to see a new play.  The hotel was amazing the staff was friendly and attentive. The concierge Dusty was excellent with knowledge of the city.  The hotel was clean and spacious and the beds were heaven to sleep in.  The Kimberly is an exceptional hotel, I highly recommend it.

title: Celeste
text: Girlfriends trip for weekend to see a play Staff was awesome Dusty and Sara and door attendants were great. Rooms were amazing. Received complimentary cheese and wine and beds very comfortable I highly recommend staying again

title: An amazing stay at a fantastic hotel!
text: I only live 60 miles from NYC, so for the last 25 years+ that I go and visit NYC, its always for a day trip and we just drive back home or take the train.  So this year for christmas I decided to take my wife into the city and we would stay the night.  Her name is Kimberly, so only right that I book the Kimberly Hotel.  I was a little concerned as I did not know much about this "boutique" type hotel.  Let me tell you, we have stayed at 5 star resorts all over the country and world and I was extremely impressed with everything about the Kimberly!

title: The CLEANEST Hotel rooms ever!!!!
text: After the friendly reception on arrival at the Kimberly, I entered my room.  NO!  It was a suite!!  With balcony.  These rooms were furnished with, as advertised, faux antiques.  The decorators have done a wonderful job of not over doing this and one felt at home and at ease immediately.  Elegant, clean rooms with a wonderful view too. ( In my case - this will not always be possible).  I can not stop sining the praises of the staff and management of this hotel for the great work they are doing together to create such a wonderful destination for guests.  Always remember, The people who clean a room at any establishment is more often the biggest contributor to your enjoyment and stay at that establishment.  I love and appreciate the cleaning staff at the Kimberly for the quality work and care they share with the guests.

title: The brunch food was cold and the drinks was to expensive
text: The place was beautiful.   But I would never go back. I went to a bunch for my friends 50th birthday. About 50 people attended.  They didn't put many plates out we had to ask for more.  The food was okay but I left starving cause the selection wasn't that good.

title: The Kimberly made our first trip to NY a memorable and luxurious experience.
text: We spent three nights at the Kimberly and were blown away by the quality, especially for the price. It was our first time in NYC and we couldn’t have chosen a better hotel to decompress in. The staff were all amazing and accommodating, our suite was one of the lowest priced and was gigantic for NY standards. Even featuring marble flooring in our foyer and bathroom (which also had a massive bathtub and comfy robes!) Our bedroom and living room were very spacious and classically decorated. Room service was delicious the two times we ordered it and the food was very reasonably priced. We stayed in Suite 7F and it was perfect after a long day of adventuring in the city. We could easily walk to most everything we wanted to see as the Kimberly is in a prime location in Manhattan. I’ve never stayed in a 5 star hotel, the Kimberly is a 4 and I have no idea how they could improve upon that because nearly everything was perfect. My only issues were a persistent, annoying clicking sound from our heat/AC unit which NEVER turned off despite us changing the settings numerous times and our room safe didn’t properly lock. But those two minor things aren’t enough to take away a star from this review because the hotel went above and beyond our expectations in every other aspect. It will be awhile before we decide to brave NYC again, but when we do, we’ll be returning to the Kimberly. It helped make our vacation memorable. Thank you so much to all the staff of the Kimberly, you all clearly take pride in your jobs and it very much shows.

title: Fabulous hotel stay!!
text:
We just checked in and all we can say is WOW! From the way we were greeted by the doorman, to the welcoming and accommodating reception to the lovely, spacious and immaculately clean room, this place is a fabulous New York City find! Kudos to the management, you guys have done a wonderful job. Have not yet tried the restaurants though they were bustling and the menus appeared to be varied and reasonable for Manhattan.
So happy to be enjoying our stay in Manhattan at the Kimberly.

title: Not your everyday, “run of the mill” hotel.
text:
This hotel was such a great stop for a quick New York Vacation. The staff, excellent. 
The room, fabulous!  We had the one room suite, so nice with kitchen, fridge, sink, dcupboards with dishes!  Big balcony was a big surprise.  The doorman there to assist always. Restaraunt on premises. 
We just loved it!
Only thing we could critique was the size of bathroom. But who spends time in bathroom when in New York?

title: Fabulous vintage glamour
text: My husband and I have just returned home from this beautiful hotel. Traditional in decor and very welcoming. Seamless check in to a beautiful suite. Very large square footage, especially for NYC. Lovely lounge/kitchenette area, bedroom and bathroom. The bed was so comfortable it was hard to leave each morning. All staff were extremely courteous and helpful, housekeeping was excellent too. Great bar/restaurant on the top floor serving complimentary pastries and coffee from 4pm for a couple of hours. Delicious bar style food which is delicious but on the expensive side. Drinks are expensive too around 16 dollars for a glass of wine but then you’re on holiday and it is NYC afterall. We’d definitely return and also recommend the Kimberley hotel.

title: Our "go to" hotel in NYC
text: Elegance, spaciousness, location and least but not least, the friendliness of the staff!  The restaurants are wonderful, the Rooftop is great, you can walk anywhere and the rooms feel like you're staying in a NYC apartment.

title: NYE 2019
text: I had another great time during my stay at the Kimberly Hotel from December 31st to January 1st.  The entire staff was very helpful and very nice. I have been bringing in the New Years since NYE 2012 at Upstairs at the Kimberly Hotel and each time is a amazing experience.  I want to truly the thank the entire staff for a great time I have each time I have spending at the Kimberly.

title: Classy, old world charm, warm NYC favorite
text: The Kimberly is a smaller hotel that is able to excel at large scale hospitality. It maintains a classy guest oriented old world feel with beautiful large rooms, top flight white glove service that starts with the door man greeting your car. The front desk is staffed by an associate and a manager, They all know your name and are extremely pleasant, helpful and welcoming. The lobby has the most amazing, aquarium grade tropical tank I have ever seen. It is a huge display of very exotic salt water marine life. We stayed in the executive king bedroom suite on an upper floor. Had a balcony, separate eat in kitchen with corner windows, large living room with a stocked book case, and separate king bedroom. The furnishings were gorgeous. Jorge the assistant manager and Charles the manager were tremendously hospitable and genuinely friendly. If they had apartments for sale I would buy one!
