title: This is a fabulous gem of a hotel in midtown Manhattan!
text: My husband and I recently booked a one bedroom King suite for our anniversary overnight in NYC.   I cannot say enough about this hotel.  The room was gigantic for NYC  standards, along with elegant, warm and romantic.    I would categorize it as an "Old New York" style hotel with both doormen and Elevator attendants.    I travel to NY several times a year and this is by far my favorite place to stay.   It is in a fabulous midtown location, walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Central Park and a little further down the road to the Theater District and Times Square, but still walk-able.     If you are looking for warm and elegant, this is your place.  I loved the added touch of the Mackenzie-Childs pieces in the bathroom.   Also, a noon checkout time and if you call and it's available, they will allow for a 1:00 checkout.  All in all, FABULOUS!

title: Another Excellent Stay at the Kimberly
text:
I stay at the Kimberly a few times each year on business trips since its located just 3 blocks away from our offices on Lexington Ave.  I promised my grown daughter a trip to New York during the Christmas Holiday season, and so we stayed at the Kimberly for 4 nights (Dec 27 – Dec 31).  Once again, the Kimberly did not disappoint.

The Kimberly is a boutique hotel, so the lobby is a little small, although very nice.  The rooms on the other hand, are large, well-appointed and wonderful!  I reserved the Deluxe 1 Bedroom King Suite and was given Suite 6F which has a separate living room and 2 sinks in the bathroom.  This gave us so much room to move around, as well as allowed us to sit and enjoy leftovers from restaurants and the free bottle of wine and cheese tray that the hotel provided me as a return guest. The suite did have a balcony, although there’s no reason to use it as there’s no view since every building around the Kimberly is tall.  All of the rooms that I’ve stayed in at the Kimberly contain either a separate kitchenette area or a built-in kitchenette that has a microwave and refrigerator.

This time, I booked the Kimberly via the TripAdvisor website about 2 months in advance and received a very good rate that included a free breakfast buffet on the rooftop lounge for 2 each morning.  As expected, the breakfast buffet was wonderful with an omelet station, fresh cut fruits, bacon, sausages, eggs, pancakes, French toast, juices, etc.  It’s certainly enough to keep you full until dinner.  We also visited the rooftop lounge at night where the view of the Chrysler building is stunning and the drinks are excellent.  We had a wonderful dinner at the Empire Steak House, located in the Kimberly, which I highly recommend as the fish was fresh and delicious and the atmosphere is wonderful as well.  What a great stay we had.

The Kimberly is centrally located (on East 50th between 3rd Ave and Lexington) so we walked almost every place we visited including a walk down to 42nd and Broadway to see Aladdin, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Shops on Madison Ave, Saks 5th Ave to see its spectacular Christmas lights show, and so much more. 

The front desk staff, manager, doormen and baggage helpers at the Kimberly are all very friendly and helpful.  I've never had an issue with any of them, as each time I've stayed at the Kimberly, they were all wonderful to deal with.  Next time, I’ll take my husband for a visit to New York City and we will certainly return to the Kimberly.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Great hotel to end out three week trip to the states! Decor is lovely.  Rooms are very spacious, lots of cupboards and a lovely lounge area.  
Staff a very friendly and welcoming!

Would recommend to everyone. And would stay here again! Great location also!

title: Class and Charm
text:
This was our first visit to New York- Family of four (kids 8 and 9 we stayed Christmas day to New Years eve.

Of course, there may be hotels in a "better location"- although that depends I suppose on the mid point of everything you want to see and do. But,if, like us, you are running, walking, trying to see everything you can, the Kimberley could not be better placed (for all the reasons given by others).

Similarly, there may be smarter/ swankier hotels with bigger entrance lobbies and what appears to be more "amenities" but I would doubt that any of them come close to the character and charm of this gem. NYC is a mad house and within, to enjoy a business or social trip, you need a resting place that will provide whatever you ask without question.

Our room 6H was great- probably not the best- it certainly had no view- but it didn't matter. We probably could have asked for better- I don't know- we didn't mind. The Kimberley is that sort of place. You cant buy what this hotel has. Class.

title: Great place!!!
text: This was our second time staying at the Kimberly and each time we leave, knowing that we will come back! Great service and spacious accommodations, especially for NY. The bellman that works during the day, my apologies for forgetting his name, always greets you with a smile on his face.  Check in was ready when we arrived early and housekeeping allowed us to sleep in every morning. (That was a great in itself!) Thank you for another great stay!

title: Albergo vintage lussuoso
text: Il lusso di oggi è senza dubbio apprezzabile. Ma quello di ieri ha piú spessore e io a volte lo preferisco. L’inserviente sorridente che ti “srotola” la porta girevole, ti augura Buon Anno anche il 3 Gennaio e che preme il pulsante per prenotare l’ascensore, fanno molto Manhattan dei tempi che furono. Tra 20 anni questi hotel andranno a ruba. Voto 10.

title: Amazing Stay
text:
First trip to New York and was not disappointed. Hotel was stunning and staff very helpful. Very close to all midtown Manhattan attractions. 

Arian the waiter in Upstairs was very sweet and remembered our coffee order every morning was also on hand to offer suggestions on breakfast choices. Loved the omelette bar and huge selection of breakfast.

Piortr on front desk was also helpful in sorting out our mobile phone in our room and spare adaptor plug.

Gregory the porter was also cheerful and friendly in the mornings when going out. 

Thank you for a lovely stay.  Our suite had everything you needed.  One suggestion would be to have some lights fitted near the kitchenette area.

title: An Oasis in Midtown
text:
We stayed 4 nights during Christmas with my son and grandma. The hotel is very good located on 50th Street not far away from some main attractions in NYC.
The entrance to the hotel and decoration of the lobby is giving you hints about the history of the hotel. It has been probably opened years ago and didn't go any major renovations since then, but this shouldn't be understand as a criticism. It definitely adds a certain flair and character to the hotel and differentiate from all the chain hotels (such as Mariott's, Hilton's). Apart from that everything in the lobby as well as in the rooms are in perfect shape and properly working.
The reason for us choosing the hotel was the big rooms with a separate seating area and kitchenette. The room was superb; very nicely decorated with everything you need (work desk, complimentary cell phone for internet, coffee machine with complimentary coffee, umbrella, L'occitane amenities etc.) and offered also a very good sleep quality even on the sofa-bed in the living room. 
The service was very good; only the roof top bar didn't meet our expectations. 
To sum up, the hotel exceeded our expectations and we would definitely come here back in our next trip to NYC.

title: Always feels like home away from home!
text:
My family and I just left The Kimberly Hotel and as usual, it was a wonderful stay.  The bellman greet us with a warm welcome and efficiently take care of parking our car and checking inour luggage.  The desk staff is fabulous and helpful  Bijou, Sadia and others always take care of making our reservation the best it can be.

The staff at the Penthouse restaurant is equally as welcoming.  The breakfast omelette was delicious.  The restaurant was busy, ; but, attention from Aria and others made the meal run  smoothly.

We always enjoy our NYC adventures, Thank you to all at The Kimberly.  Happy New Year!!

title: Best of NYC
text: I've been staying at the Kimberly for more than 10 years. Luxury boutique style property beautifully decorated. The entire staff takes great pride in ensuring an unparallel guest service experience. Great east side Manhattan location. Upstairs at the Kimberly (rooftop) provides breathtaking views of the skyline while enjoying an after dinner cocktail. Hard to beat in NYC.

title: Top Service
text: I have stayed at the Kimberly hotel on multiple occasions and it never does let down.  Right when you step foot inside the hotel you can witness the care and high taste from the immaculate lobby space and really gorgeous fish tank. The rooms are very spacious for NYC standard which provide a nice home base for the hustle and bustling of NYC.  Staff was very courteous and professional - they were even keen on providing some great restaurant recommendations outside of their own establishment which shows the true service they provide their customer.  Last but not least, we had a great time at the roof top bar during both a brunch and evening session.  A high quality clientele but not too pretentious or snobby.

title: Excellent
text: We had the luxury suite.  Clean, updated and spacious room. Comfortable king size bed and even the pull out couch was top quality.  Nice kitchenette.  Balcony!  Every person we encountered was pleasant.  Better than most chain hotels we have been to.  Reasonable price we found for this area.

title: Top Notch and Great Value!
text: The staff is awesome! Our suite was top notch and very roomy. We never had a transportation problem and took both taxis and subways nearby during our stay. The fish tank in the lobby is very cool. This hotel's location made it easy for us to do all things Manhattan, which was why we came. Perfect experience! Great value!

title: Outstanding hotel and stadd
text: This was our second visit to the Kimberly hotel and it feels like a home away from home. We sleep well and our 9 year old son loves it. We had breakfast at their rooftop hotel and that was wonderful too. I highly recommend staying at the Kimberly. We stayed over the Thanksgiving break and it gave us a place to decompress and recharge even while New York was experiencing one of their coldest Thanksgiving’s ever. Thank you, Kimberly

title: Noisy and expensive
text: This is a beautiful hotel with a lovely location. Staff are very friendly. However, our 6th floor room was so loud we could hardly sleep. It wasn't just the traffic- it was also the construction work that started at 7 am. For $500 per night I was expecting to be able to sleep.

title: Best place in New York
text: My family recently enjoyed our first stay at this Kimberly Hotel and it is one of the best Hotels we have ever stayed in. Friendly staff and my kids loved the fish tank in the lobby. We will definitely be back!

title: Excellent
text: We stayed at the Kimberley on 2 occasions, firstly for 7 nights then for 4 and were extremely  happy both times. This is our first time at the  Kimberley, although have stayed at other hotels in NYC. Rooms were very spacious, bathroom and room spotlessly clean. Staff extremely helpful. Location excellent. Overall a brilliant experience and if the rates are reasonable we will definitely return on our next visit.

title: Last minute 17th daughters birthday!
text:
I cannot day enough wonderful things about our recent overnight at The Kimberly! From the first moment we walked into the lobby until we left it was a terrific experience! The lobby is elegant( a bit small) and lovely! Check in was welcoming! We were told we would be upgraded to a suite! What a suite it was! We travel to NYC from Boston about 5 times a year and have never stayed in a room...rooms so large and so wonderful! We had a large sitting area, cabinets with refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, sink..., etc... balcony(not a great view but no big deal!), large bedroom with 2 very comfortable queen beds, very nice bathroom and extra vanity/ sink area! Slippers too!
We were overwhelmed by the size of the rooms and all of the extras! 
After a busy day walking to Times Square(25 minutes) , Rockefeller Center(15 minutes) a great show “Once on this Island”, we returned to relax in this amazing suite and were treated to a thoughtful note and Chocolate covered strawberries...celebrating her 17th birthday! We were only there one night so did not get to try their restaurant or rooftop lounge but we certainly plan on returning! 
Many times I find hotels and reservations online and hope they will be what they say they are..... The Kimberly was that and so much more!!! I highly recommend!!!!

title: Wow, where do I start?
text: I travel to NYC on the train (from Maryland) with my granddaughter once a year, and in my view, The Kimberly is the only place to stay!  Centrally located for the Theater and Sightseeing, the hotel is more than comfortable and rather elegant.  The Hotel staff, including the Manager, Front Desk, and also the awesome and attentive bellmen keep me coming back.  I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Excellent stay
text:
Really nice hotel in a good location for sightseeing, shopping and eating out. Great staff, very helpful. We came for a weekend for our daughters birthday, the hotel staff helped us to put some balloons into the room and sent up a small gift for her. 
5th Ave, Rockefeller centre and Empire State Building all close by, three subway stations in easy reach. 
Thanks to the doorman for arranging our taxi back to the airport, very reasonable and prompt.

title: A very poor high end hotel experience
text:
We visited The Kimberley for a wedding our friends were holding in the Upstairs bar/restaurant. I was overall disappointed with the run down/in need of money spent on it feel of the hotel generally but the rooms are decently sized and clean enough. Yet from our first moments, it was clear this was not a “go out our way to ensure you of an enjoyable stay” hotel. The staff give a generally uninterested in their guests vibe.
On the morning of the wedding, the bride called down for a bottle of champagne. Now, given how much money she was spending at the hotel and the occasion I would have expected this to have been sent up without having to be asked. However not only did we have to ask, but they told us they were too busy and would send when they had time.
The wedding itself was very stressful given the venue was meant to be ready at 4 and on arriving at 3.30 we were told it would be half past and they had barely started setting up. This would have been fine had they offered a solution, which they didn’t even pretend to do but instead sent 25 paying customers out into the cold to find their own arrangements. Or we could sit at the fish tank if we wanted of course (!)
The hotel is very well situated for Lexington Av., Times Sq etc and the subway link takes you to most locations fairly quickly. But there are many hotels in this vicinity that I would suggest are significantly superior for the money The Kimberley charges its guests. Do not bother staying here.

title: My new favorite!
text:
I travel to New York about 6-8 times a year for work and this is the first opportunity I've had to stay at The Kimberly.  What a find!  The lobby is lovely and the check in process was smooth and easy.  Upon entering my room on the 25th floor I was truly awed.  It was huge!  The room was impeccably clean, comfortable bed, good lighting, extremely functional and really quite beautiful.  It seems as if management has thought about everything!!  From umbrellas to robes, to a shoe shine machine, the amenities were endless.  There was even a scale in the bathroom.  L'Occitane bath products were a welcome find and the mini bar had almost everything I could have wanted.  It is rare to find a hotel room in New York city this large and it even had a bathtub.  

We took advantage of breakfast at Upstairs, their penthouse restaurant.  The wait staff was attentive and the food was very good.  The knowledgeable concierge recommended a place for dinner that was exactly what we were looking for.  

My only complaint was that I was not able to get the room cooled down no matter what buttons I pressed on the thermostat.   Regardless, I was able to sleep quite well in the very comfortable bed and woke feeling refreshed.  

I was hesitant to write this review because I do not want more people to know about The Kimberly since it might make it more difficult to get a room there in the future.  I will never stay elsewhere!

title: Christmas Girls Getaway
text: This hotel is located in perfect distance to the holiday festivities of Rockefeller Center without feeling overwhelmed by the crowds.  Our room as beautiful and perfect for the two of us but could have comfortably fit a few more.  Our check-in/check-out process was warm and speedy.  Every staff member we encountered during our stay was extermely pleasant.  Would highly recommend The Kimberly to anyone.

title: Charming hotel
text:
Would highly recommend the Kimberly. 
The service, room and rooftop restaurant/bar were great.  We especially appreciated Harry, who went above and beyond in helping us get to where we needed during our stay!

title: Wonderful stay in NYC
text:
We stayed at the Kimberly Hotel for one night prior to a cruise. We were sorry it was only one night as we absolutely loved it. The staff were so helpful and friendly, our room was a very good size, beautifully decorated, lovely big bathroom with L’Occitane toiletries and a small kitchen area where we could make drinks. Everything was spotlessly clean.
The hotel is in a great location, we walked to as many NYC sights as we could within 24 hours! We had drinks in the rooftop bar in the evening with its spectacular views, and they serve coffee and pastries there during the day. It was an absolutely perfect start to our holiday and we can’t wait to go back.

title: Exceptional Hotel
text: We recently enjoyed a four night stay at the Kimberley over Thanksgiving weekend and Jorge and his staff couldn’t have done more to make us feel welcome. The hotel is in a perfect location as it is within walking distance of many attractions but serves as a haven/comfort blanket  to return to after a busy day sightseeing or shopping. Our suite was both spacious and luxurious and spotlessly clean. The rooftop bar was also a plus offering spectacular views and excellent service. We will definitely be returning to this iconic New York gem.

title: Thanksgiving 2018 à Nyc
text: Hôtel confortable avec des chambres de belles tailles. Wifi payant et de très mauvaise qualité. Impossible d’éteindre complètement le chauffage et garder une fenêtre ouverte n’est pas faisable si l’on veut dormir. Le système de chauffage devrait être rénové. Ce qui a été le cas pour les salles de bain ont été mise au goût du jour depuis ma dernière visite et sont parfaites pour des habitudes françaises.

title: Excelente
text:
Hace muchos días que estoy por escribirle al hotel y a toda la gente de la recepción, cocina etc.
Nuestra estadía supero las expectativas, no tengo nada que decir, todo increíble, maravilloso, impecable, recomiendo el hotel 100% 
Estuvimos la semana de maratón de Nueva York y la atención fue de lujo.

title: Superb hotel
text: Stayed at the Kimberly for 3 nights and i was very impressed, the staff were very friendly and the room i had was a great size. Would definitely stay here again if i am ever back in New York. Had a couple of drinks in the bar upstairs too which was pretty spectacular at night.

title: Outstanding Experience!!!
text: I often have bid on items in charity auctions and once in awhile I strike gold.  Earlier this year I was the successful bidder on a weekend visit to the Kimberley Hotel (145 East 50th Street, NYC).  Not having ever been there before, I did not know what to expect, but I was certainly very pleasantly surprised.  My wife is not necessarily a big fan of hotels of which she is unfamiliar and that was the case here.  Nevertheless, from the first moment we stepped into the lobby the Kimberley was an absolutely wonderful experience.  We were given our room immediately and it was very, very nice.  Large bedroom, separate sitting room, and very nice bathroom - all of which my wife loved (maybe the bathroom did need brighter lights).  The heated bathroom floor was a nice touch.  The staff were very helpful and courteous. Great location in Midtown.  Just simply a nice place.  We will be back.

title: un lujo
text: Hotel con una excelente ubicación, cerca del metro y de fácil acceso. Buena calidad de servicio, habitaciones muy amplias, cómodas y elegantes. Ofrecen wi fi gratis en el lobby y en los restaurantes, sin embargo cobran en las habitaciones lo cual, a estas alturas, está totalmente fuera de estándar para un hotel de esta categoría, debiese ser parte del servicio básico

title: A superb hotel!
text: We came to New York City to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. My husband loves boutique hotels and the Kimberly did not disappoint. The room was spacious and well-appointed, the bed was comfortable (complete with down pillows), the amenities were amazing (toiletries, robes, slippers, umbrellas, etc.), the breakfast buffet on the penthouse level was delicious, the location was close to midtown and Broadway, and the service was wonderful. I particularly want to thank Charles at the front desk. Upon arrival, we had 15 minutes before check-in. We had planned to just sit in the gorgeous lobby and wait, but Charles offered us champagne in honor of our anniversary. He had the bellman store our luggage, escorted us to a table in the restaurant, and then had the waiter bring over a bottle of champagne. We had expected a glass, not a bottle,  but the Kimberly and the staff are unbelievable in their service. We highly recommend this establishment if staying in New York City.

title: Misrated
text: This is the first time I've felt completely and totally misled by a hotel's rating. If this were rated 2 or 2.5 stars, I might understand but this was a big miss by a long shot. The hotel is beyond dated - my heart sank the second we pulled up to the shabby facade. The buttons in the lift reminded us of consoles from the 80s. The interior was dark in a not sexy, sad, dingy way. I was literally embarrassed at having booked this hotel for my family's one night layover in the city, and couldn't wait to leave. I simply cannot reconcile the positive reviews and beautiful photos I saw of it on the different review sites with the real thing.

title: Great location, super service
text: We stayed at the Kimberly Suites in July. The hotel has a great location. The Staff were all very attentive, and we enjoyed the hotel. It was at the end of a 3 1/2 weeks vacation, and we enjoyed the space this hotel has for its guest. Only regret, is that we never got to eat at the hotel. The rooms were big, and clean, I am sure, we will be back at this hotel, next time we are in NY.

title: Godt
text: Et hotel som har en rigtig god beliggenhed - centralt. Personalet er meget hjælpsomme og imødekommende hvilket helt sikkert gør oplevelsen bedre. Lidt problemer med rengøring på værelser. Ellers et godt sted at bo til pengene! :-)

title: Annual Trip to NYC
text: This hotel is beyond beautiful!  Every inch of the hotel is perfection. everything is so well maintained.  The staff is excellent, the restaurants are delish. The breakfast buffet was amazing! Cant wait to come back!

title: Promotion event
text: Very good venue for hosting a promotional event, staff really friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar and private room provides the ideal space for entertaining guests with back to back presentations and networking space.

title: Great accommodation in midtown
text:
We spent four nights at the Kimberly and were not disappointing. The room was spacious, very nicely appointed and very well kept. Everything was in great condition. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. 
The bed was comfortable and the linen soft.
Our room was on the second floor and yet was surprising insulated from the noise of the city.
The decor is not modern but rather quite traditional. I enjoyed this.
I would recommend this hotel.

title: Charles saved our trip!!
text: We have a new favorite hotel!!! I will keep the focus of this review on the Kimberly, but it was not where we had reservations.  On Saturday afternoon when we arrived in NYC in the late afternoon for our reservations at another hotel, we were told our two rooms were not ready and would not be ready for at least two hours.  As longtime members of their loyalty program, we were told there was nothing we could do but take a free drink voucher and drink in their bar.  We did not want drinks, we wanted to get ready for our son’s 21st birthday dinner.  My husband went around the corner to the Kimberly and Charles, one of the managers, had not just 2 rooms for us, but a suite.  He was as accomodating and helpful as his hotel was beautiful and comfortable.  We had a wonderful room on the 26th floor:  spacious, clean, light and elegantly decorated. The bed was comfortable, the rainfall shower head was functional and fabulous (sometimes they don’t work very well), and our son’s pull out bed was better than most.  We also had brunch in their restaurant on the 30th floor which was delicious.  The service was impeccable from top to bottom.  Thank you, Charles and all the staff at The Kimberly.  We will definitely be back!!

title: Best accommodations ever!
text: The Kimberly hotel is my favorite hotel of all  that I have stayed in my extensive travels; a home away from home.This boutique hotel is charming and the staff is incredible...a combination for a stay that is a tremendous  experience in and of itself. I highly recommend!

title: Another fine day at the Kimberly
text: The first time that I stayed at the Kimberly was when I was looking for an apartment in the spring of 1988. New York was a very different place back then, but then, as now, the Kimberly stands out in my mind as an exceptional place. After living in NYC for 20 years or so, I am very pleased to think of the Kimberly as my "Home in NYC" when I need to stay over for a dinner, an event, or just to relax. My wife and I deeply appreciate the friends the friends that we have made at the Kimberly and we are sure that others will too

title: Wonderful vacation
text: I took my mom to New York for her first time and The Kimberly was perfect for what we needed. A one bedroom king suite with two full bathrooms and literally the most comfortable couch bed I’ve ever been on and we’ve owned several.  The fully stocked bar and balcony looking out to the Chrysler building really topped it all off.  The staff was so friendly and helpful.  I would definitely go back when I can get back to NYC.

title: Gregory!
text: This man’s smile and charisma made my morning and afternoon walk everyday while we stayed in NYC. Great doorman experience, Gregory is the epitome of class.  He always has a smile for passers by and guests.  Really appreciate meeting quality people like this. #i❤️nyc and Gregory you are truly an asset to the Kimberley Hotel. I wish you were apart of my day everyday! You make my heart smile!

title: Practically perfect in every way!
text: Wow, did we love this hotel! We stayed at The Kimberly from Oct 27-Nov 1. I’d called the property a few weeks before our stay to let them know we were celebrating 20 years together, and to request a high floor with a nice view. When we checked in, the woman at the front desk wished us a happy anniversary, and informed us that our WiFi would be complimentary. When we got to the room, they had left little treats for us! It’s little touches like this that make The Kimberly special. Our room was a luxury one bedroom suite. The furniture was traditional, but lovely. It was huge, with separate doors to both the living area and bedroom. There was a little wet bar with a mini fridge, sink, coffee pot, and microwave. The bathroom was big, with a nice, deep tub, rainfall shower head, and a handheld shower head attachment. There was mouthwash, q-tips, cotton balls, L’occitane shower gel, shampoo, soap, etc. The floors were heated, which was a very nice touch!  A lighted makeup mirror, scale, and hairdryer were also included. The bedroom featured a flat screen tv, an adjustable, king sized bed, large closet with a safe, iron, and bags for laundry. There was a dresser, and the nightstands also provided plenty of drawer space. The balcony was a fantastic addition, such a special thing to have in NYC! It offered a great view of the GE building, even a tiny glimpse of The Chrysler building. We asked if we could have a little table and chairs to enjoy it with, and they were graciously provided. The bed was so comfortable, and there were plenty of pillows. The living area featured a comfortable love seat, desk, small dining table with two chairs, and a flat screen tv. There was a little mini bar with snacks, and although we never utilized it, the prices weren’t too outrages. There was also an extra closet. All in all, the room was perfect, and I have not one complaint! We also loved the location. Central Park, MoMa, Carnegie Hall, Times Square, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, Columbus Circle, and the subway were all an easy walk from this hotel. The service at this hotel was wonderful- friendly, but unobtrusive. The rooftop bar/restaurant, Upstairs at The Kimberly, was very nice, with great views. We enjoyed complimentary to go coffee there every morning, but never had breakfast there. It was too pricey- $29 per person. I just couldn’t justify spending that much when there were so many great little breakfast places/ diners mere steps from the hotel. Maybe we’ll try it during our next stay. The Kimberly Hotel is not the fanciest, or most expensive hotel I’ve stayed in, but it’s definitely the best. We are already planning a return trip, and cannot imagine staying anywhere else!

title: Top Botique Hotel in NYC
text: I love this property...perfectly located and superior customer service for a completely 5 star experience from beginning to end.  Also, breakfast up in the Pent House on 30th floor or going there at end of the evening for a cocktail is brilliant way to start or close out your day.

title: Voyage de noces idyllique
text:
Superbe suite avec lit king size ultra confortable, petit salon confortable et kitchnette très pratique.
Bémol cependant : le fond de la baignoire était usé et craquele, ce qui rendait l'aspect un peu dégoûtant. Au prix du séjour ca ne me semble pas acceptable.

title: si proche de la perfection
text: séjour de 10 jours fin octobre en famille avec 2 ados, grande chambre d'environ 40 m2 avec 2 lits doubles (160) et un espace salon (canapé, table basse, bureau) plus la sdb (grande douche et baignoire!). Mini frigo, cafetière et micro ondes ; parfait pour le pdj mais il faut absolument en prendre un sur le rooftop. Personnel admirable, aux petits soins, certains parlent même français. Service bagagerie gratuit le jour du départ. Hotel très bien situé dans Manhattan pour première visite à NY (proche Moma, Rockfeller, Grand Central) ; station de métro à 5 minutes à peine.

title: Just amazing
text: Celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday in this beautiful and friendly hotel.  The staff were all very polite and helpful.  Our room was a large deluxe - very comfortable beds and exceptionally clean.  An ideal location to travel to many attractions within New York.  We absolutely loved our stay at the hotel and also loved New York City... definitely will be heading back to this hotel and wonderful city.

title: Exceptional! Exceeds expectations.
text: Start to finish, fantastic stay. First time to New York for 4 nights. 1 bedroom suite was spacious, clean, and comfy. It was a nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the city. The breakfast at the Rooftop was great. Good location with easy access to subway. Also enjoyed the included membership to the NY Health and Racket club down the road. All of the Doormen and bell hop were fantastic as well as concierge and front desk. Really "Top Notch"!

title: Nice NYC Hotel
text: Staff were courteous, the one bedroom suite was spacious and clean, housekeeping did a commendable job, and the food and service at the Upstairs was tops. The hotel is within walking distance to shopping and the Rockefeller center and the St. Patrick's cathedral. Many places to eat nearby as well if one chooses. For my next visit to NYC, I know where to stay. I would recommended to friends and family.

title: Service with a smile
text: The wife has stayed here several time on a "girls weekend" but this was my first time. Will not be my last. Such a friendly group of people in the lobby, Check in, and  Bellman are always cheery and happy to help. Rooms are large for NY, clean, bathrooms are also large. Kitchenette was good.  Rooftop bar is a plus and includes a night time view of the Chrysler Building.

title: GREAT TRIP!
text: Everything was FIRST CABIN! From the proximity to CENTRAL PARK to the fabulous TIMES SQUARE, each day was as pleasant as the day before. The hotel staff members were courteous, knowledgeable, and most helpful. The room was EXCELLENT!!!

title: Perfect suite for 2 teens and their aunt
text: Fantastic hotel in a great location.  I stayed at the Kimberly with my nieces (21 & 18) We had so much room to relax.  I wish I could have had time to read in the penthouse area!  It was a great spot for drinks!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Stayed at the Kimberly Hotel for 7 nights and would go back if we ever get the chance to return to New York. Very welcoming reception team, courteous doormen with big smiles, comfortable clean room which is well appointed - large bed (compared to UK), brilliant kitchenette with large fridge, cooker / hob, microwave, toaster, dishwasher and complimentary water every day. The bathroom was good size and the rain shower was excellent. Big TV, plenty of storage space and cleaned daily. Did not have to wait more then 1 minute for the lift. Lots of restaurants and coffee shops within few minutes walk. Easy 10 minute stroll to 5th Avenue / St. Patrick's Cathedral and another easy 5 or so minutes to get to the Time Square area passing Rockefellers. Subway station within a few minutes walk and Grand Central was only a mater of 15 minutes walk. Enjoyed our stay.

title: Stay Here - Its great
text:
Before we stayed here, I thought a number of the Tripadvisor reviews were hype. I was wrong, this is an excellent hotel. Like other highly rated hotels you can tell that there is good management and the staff does a great job.My writeup does not do justice to how nice this hotel was and I spend 2-3 months a year in hotels.

We stayed for 3 nights in room 7a. When we checked in we asked for a room at the back of the hotel because there is construction going on across the street. Room 7a is next to and behind the elevators. We were delighted that we never heard the elevator or people in the hall. The view from our room was another building about 80 feet away; but, it was very quiet.

The room itself was large, well decorated and well equipped and lovely. It even had a small kitchenette.

The hotel is well located for public transit. Stations for the 6, E and M subway lines are nearby. Nearby buses go downtown on Lexington and uptown on 3rd avenue. There is also the 50 crosstown bus that runs on 49th and 50th streets.

title: New York Shopping Trip
text:
We stayed for 5 days for my daughter's 16th birthday and had an absolutely amazing time.
The location is excellent and within a fairly short walking distance from a lot of the major tourist attractions and neat a few subway stations which we used to see the World Trade Centre Memorial.  
The hotel has a couple of restaurants attached and also serves breakfast on the rooftop bar along with complimentary pastries, fruit and coffee in the afternoons.   This was a lovely touch and we were glad to put our feet up for this each day!   There are also loads of restaurants nearby for breakfasts and dinners.  
The staff at this hotel are an absolute asset.  Every single person we dealt with was extremely helpful and polite.  Check in and put were both smooth and efficient and our bill was correct which is rare at some hotel chains these days.   
We stayed in a suite on the 22nd floor and the balcony was amazing...such a treat in NYC.  Our suite was very clean and extremely spacious and serviced each day.  The only negative I can give us that we had to ask for more towels on 3 of the 5 days we stayed as only 3 sets were left when there were 4 of us staying.   
I would absolutely recommend this gem of a hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

title: review
text: The main change I found compared to the previous stage was that the refrigerator now are mini size (stauyed at 29 F). This is a clear disadbantage compared to my previous vistis to Kimbelry in the last 8 yeras, please revise this.

title: Still Great!
text: Our second stay at the Kimberly, and it did not disappoint.  The entire staff was friendly and helpful.  Highly recommend the terrace for breakfast and a late-night skyline light show.  The only "con" is that it's not within easy walking distance to the normal sights, e.g. 1/2 mile to Rockefeller Center, 1 mile to Times Square and 2 miles to the Metropolitan Museum.

title: A very pleasant stay
text: Keep up the good work. Every one we had contact with at the hotel were very pleasant and polite. I have to give special credit to the doorman as his was extremely helpful both with our luggage and our car

title: Amazing hotel, lovely people and great rooms!
text: We love this hotel so much, we stayed last year and it was so amazing that we stayed again this time too, the people are fantastic, the rooms are big and clean, Ralph on the door is a star! We can’t wait to come and stay again, we absolutely love it here, thank you so much, Charlotte, Steve, Mia & Dan Rhodes

title: Simply the Best!
text: This is a great boutique hotel in NYC. All rooms are suites and they are very large and the decoration is very elegant. The services is great and the location is very convenient. They also offer complimentary coffee and pastries on the roof garden weekdays 11-4. This is a great place!

title: Great staff, rooms a little dated
text:
I stayed during UN week. If you don’t know what this means, it equates to total chaos for the city. Several delegations were staying at the hotel. Despite this the check in staff were incredibly courteous and friendly. Rooms have basic kitchenette facilities. This is very useful but I always think it makes hotel rooms smell a bit stale. It’s an older building and the decor is “traditional” - dark. Many rooms face the street and deliveries happen out front. It’s not the quietest setting. Centrally located but there are quieter choices if that’s a priority (on business trips this is my #1 priority). 

I usu stay at the Peninsula. This is an ok backup.

title: Work or  Relax in Comfort
text: I had a great stay at the Kimberly Hotel. After completing the business related to my trip to New York I was able to relax for a few hours in the comfort of my suite before departure for my flight. Staff and service were highly commendable

title: Wonderful hotel, perfect location
text: My mum and I stayed here last week on a trip for my 30th birthday and I only have great things to say about this hotel. Location is perfect for exploring upper or lower Manhattan. Staff from doorman to reception to concierge were all so helpful and friendly, when they learned it was my birthday trip, we came back one day to find a bottle of wine and plates of macarons in the room which we thought was a really thoughtful touch to the stay. Rooms were beautifully kept with all the amenities you could want. We visited the Bistango Italian restaurant connected to the hotel and the food and service were wonderful here too. I'm sure we'll be back to NYC as it's one of our favourite places and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again as it's just that bit extra special than most.

title: SPLENDID FIVE DAYS IN NEW YORK
text: Had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at this old style classy hotel with wife and daughter where the service was first class from the reception staff, doormen, concierges and all other staff we came across. The Suite was ideal for us with my daughter having the sofa bed in the living area. Plenty of storage space and the additional sink outside the bathroom very helpful. Breakfast and service in Upstairs was of good quality, although slightly pricey, as we had only booked accommodation. Maybe if breakfast booked in advance you may get a better deal. Also enjoyed a very good meal in the Bistango restaurant on ground floor.  Wife and daughter already planning a Christmas trip to New York next year and this is certain to be the hotel they will book. Having stayed at a number of other big name hotels in the city The Kimberly stands out in comparison. Ideal location. The only real negative was the loud noise from the air conditioning system on the roof of a neighbouring building which could be heard in our room which was 27A. Unfortunately this is outwith the control of the hotel.

title: Happy Birthday weekend
text: A charming hotel in a central location with kind and attentive staff. The room was well appointed, clean and had a great view and balcony. Perfect for my daughter and a friend to celebrate a special birthday. The staff also provided a complimentary treat with a note of greeting which was much appreciated.We especially enjoyed breakfast on the rooftop and they served the best cappuccinos ever!We will definitely return.

title: Mom's birthday weekend  celebration in NYC
text: Just came back from spending a wonderful night at the Kimberly hotel in NYC.  My grown daughters, my mom and I stayed in 2 suites at the Kimberly this past weekend. From the moment we checked in until the moment we left everyone was so nice and accomodating. We had brunch and drinks in th penthouse restaurant where the food was very good and the drinks were well made and very interesting. The rooms were very clean with crisp white sheets and duvet covers and the bathrooms well stocked with  towels and toiletries. The only reason for not giving it 5 stars was that the decor was slightly dated but elegant and homey. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking to stay at a small hotel where you will be well cared for attended to.

title: Weekend away
text:
Fab hotel. Huge rooms, luxurious bathroom, great facilities and very central.

Most New York hotels are small but this little gem has suites which include a living area, a kitchen area, bedroom and a bathroom with a bath. 

There is 24 hour room service and a roof top bar and restaurant.  We went out for breakfast and there is a fab diner next to the hotel for breakfast.

Overall this hotel exceeded my expectation as hotel rooms in New York are generally fairly small.

title: Great location in Midtown with friendly staff
text: The doorman is so very friendly. The rooms are more spacious than expected for New York hotel. We enjoyed our stay in suite which also has a balcony. Unfortunately the view is of a building currently under construction but the room and staff our great. Bed is comfortable.

title: Great suite hotel in Midtown
text: Our “go to” spot when heading to NYC. Great location for exploring the city. The staff treats you as a friend... making you feel like you are returning home. The suites provide separate living and sleeping areas which accommodate different family schedules. Only knock is the living room furniture could be a bit more comfortable. The roof top restaurant is a great place to start your morning or finish your day.

title: The home away from home in New York City
text: The service at the Kimberly is always amazing, the location is perfect and the rooms are spacious and gorgeous. You cannot ask for anything more from a hotel that sets the standard for a city space. The rooftop breakfast area and bar is just icing on the cake.

title: Excellent - FIVE STARS
text: Spacious and comfortable rooms, great WiFi and set up for computer, etc to get some work done.  Great service and accommodating staff across the board, roof top bar/restaurant is a must visit and delicious steakhouse at street level.  Overall, great experience which lead to productive work meetings and an overall exceptional experience at Kimberly Hotel - highly recommend.

title: Most wonderful place in NYC
text: When you check in, one of the efficient, helpful, kind front desk staff will say “Welcome home!”   They mean it! Everything is fantastic- from the genuine smile of the doormen to the delicious breakfast at the Upstairs, to the delightful chocolate on my pillow to the outstanding Assistant General Manager, Jorge, who goes out of his was to make every guest feel like a treasured friend. Stay here. You’ll be glad you did!

title: Love The Kimberly Hotel
text: This hotel has a great location. The suites are spacious and updated. Most suites have balconies. The bed is super comfy! Great nights sleep! The concierge is very helpful. The doorman courteous. The rooftop lounge and restaurant beautiful views!

title: Best Accommodations in Manhattan
text: Travel to New York Regularly...Will Stay ONLY at the Kimberley Suites!!!  Centrally located at Lex & 50th...walk to everywhere and only 6 blocks to Broadway!  Staff treats you like their own family and are genuinely pleased to see return clients.  Enjoy!!

title: Vacation
text: Great staffWe stay here every October. This will be over 20 years I believe. We love the door and bellmen. They're very friendly and remember us every trip. We always want a one bedroom suite when we stay

title: New York Experience
text: My wife and I can for an Eric Clapton concert and a business seminar. The doorman and staff were very helpful and friendly. The front desk people were very business like.The Upstairs Rooftop bar was beautiful and was attended by the young hipsters crowd, but we older folks were welcomed. There was a great deal of construction across the street. So we were awakened to the common city sounds of a jackhammer every morning at 7:00 sharp!!All together it was a wonderful small hotel and a good experience.

title: Sunday night stay for business
text: I had a wonderful night stay at the Kimberly Hotel. I arrived early Sunday morning and was able to check in before 11 AM. The front desk staff was extremely friendly. The room was Beautiful and exceptionally clean. Next morning I asked for a late checkout and the front desk was extremely helpful. Looking forward to staying at the Kimberly again.

title: Kimberly
text: Overall I enjoy staying here, the price fluctuations are annoying and at times I think gouging the customer. The staff are excellent. Snacks and beverages in room are great additions, however food snacks were stale.

title: A Star in the Big Apple
text: Forget the sterile formulaic approaches of the big hotel chains, this is a personal, friendly and stylish location. From Marcia and the team on reception to Arian and the team on the roof breakfast bar and Miri who hosts the roof bar in the evening, this hotel is an absolute must. Wonderfully set out rooms, amazing room service, nothing is too much trouble for this great location

title: So much space!!
text:
The room is dated, it’s possible it hasn’t been updated in 25 years, but the service is great and the space is humongous. It’s the size of a classic NYC one bedroom - so maybe 500-600 sq ft. Plenty for my family of four and enough to host our relatives who drove into the city to hang out for the afternoon.

It’s midtown west so super convenient but not the trendiest/funnest area.

title: Fantastic Find
text: We booked at The Kimberly after having difficulty finding rooms in other hotels during a busy holiday weekend. Lucky for us as it forced us to discover this gem of a place in NYC. I often stay further west/closer to theatres but the location of The Kimberly was still convenient to those locales, while offering a slightly different feel. The rooms are huge, especially by NY standards and very clean. The beds are extremely comfortable and amenities are top shelf. The rooms also come with the very welcome fridge with room for things you purchase or bring back instead of being crammed full of overpriced mini bar fare most people don't touch. Shoe polisher, ear plugs, umbrella, robe and slippers, microwave? All in the room. And the entire staff was friendly and helpful. I very much look forward to returning to The Kimberly in the future.

title: TRULY A GREAT EXPERIENCE!👍🏻
text: From the Doormen to the FRONT DESK...Housekeeping to the Concierge...Everyone will make sure their guests are comfortable and had a GREAT STAY...always of assistance. That’s why we love staying at Kimberly Suites...we don’t stay anywhere else when we are in NYC!

title: Great Firat time stay
text: This was our first visit to NYC and cannot compliment the hotel enough, great check-in staff and very professional and polite door staff, not forgetting the concierge desk, helpful for any queries. Ate in both the steakhouse and Italian at the hotel and food was exceptional on both occasions. Stayed on 8th floor room with 2 double beds and plenty of space, bathroom and all amenities were first class, the little touches by housekeeping definitely make you smile after a long day of sightseeing. Would definitely use this hotel on our next visit, great location for ease of getting around the city. Thank you for a wonderful stay and making our first ever visit to the city a pleasurable one.

title: Our go to hotel.
text:
Great location in midtown. Beautiful suites. Friendly staff. Our room had a kitchenette with a balcony. Great restaurant downstairs. Cool rooftop drinks upstairs. 
Concierge super friendly. Great midtown location. 

Recommend!

title: Beautiful and classy hotel
text:
We stayed in a king size suite on The 8th floor. 
Gorgeous room with the comfiest bed I've ever slept in.  Luxury linens and feather pillows and duvet and loads of storage available.  Huge bathroom with twin sinks, tub and shower over and the softest, thickest bath towels!  
We both had a fantastic night's sleep, every night and never heard a peep from our neighbours or from the corridor outside.  Blackout blinds are great and the windows well soundproofed.  We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel, we used the diner/luncheonette next door but we did have cocktails in the penthouse and loved the views from there. 
There are only 2 lifts to serve 30 floors but we were never kept waiting long and they were very speedy. 

This was out very first (won't be the last) time in New York and we chose this hotel primarily because of the location.  It's perfectly placed for exploring Times Square and Hells Kitchen, we even walked to Central Park from the hotel.

There's a lot of reasons this hotel has such good reviews, believe them,  it's fantastic!

title: Karen B
text: A beautiful hotel with the finest most helpful staff,they all work very hard to please their guests. Everything was perfect from the rooms to the food. Love all of you at the Kimberley. I would definitely stay here again. A big thank you to all of you that made our stay so wonderful.

title: FANTASTIC HOTEL TO STAY AT IN MANHATTAN
text: We stayed in the Kimberly hotel for a week and can highly recommend this hotel.  The staff could not have done more for us in making us so welcome and making sure we had a great stay.  The beds are really comfortable and rooms spotlessly clean, furniture of a really high standard, food lovely , staff are wonderful.  We had a kitchenette with microwave, fridge, dishwasher and a lounge with balcony. Bathroom is well equipped. It is also well placed in Midtown for major attractions.  Will definitely return to this hotel again.

title: En fantastiskt hotell med perfekt läge
text:
Bodde 5 nätter med maken och yngsta sonen .
Vi hade ett stort härligt rum med stora goa sängar ! 
Frukost åt vi en morgon på ”taket” med fantastisk utsikt mot bl.a. Chrysler building . Det va inte en jättestor buffé men allt som man vill ha fanns .
Personalen på hotellet va hjälpsamma och artiga alla tider på dygnet .
Nära till Times square, central park mm vi promenerade runt varje dag och bara njöt å
Rekommenderar starkt hotellet

title: Great hotel to stay at in Manhattan
text: The Kimberly is a really delightful hotel.  The 2-room was very spacious,  with kitchen area, sofa and large comfortable bed.  But what really makes the hotel special is the absolutely first class service.  Everyone at the hotel I interacted with was super helpful and  warm.

title: Perfect for your NYC experience
text: Great Hotel, good position for all the sights.  Excellent customer services, staff are friendly, warm and welcoming.  Rooms are spacious and clean.  Restaurant good value for money. Everything you need for the perfect stay.

title: Exceptional Experience
text: We have stayed in other boutique hotels in Midtown but none compare in terms of room size(suites), amenities, rooftop bar and dining, and staff. Location is fantastic...The staff are friendly longtimers who will take the time to help you in any way. We will be back next year! Bravo!!!

title: Familiar faces
text: My husbands family lives in nyc. When we go there to visit them we are always looking for a family friendly hotel that meets the needs of our 4 person family. The staff is always super friendly and helpful. It's nice when people remember your faces💝 the room/suite set up is perfect for us because the bedroom is separate and the kids sleep on the pull out and a roll out bed. The size of the rooms are very spacious especially considering that we are in NYC. We also get a balcony that I love because it's so pretty at night with all of the buildings and lights. It also has a kitchenette which is great for heating up my daughters milk and having cereal for breakfast. I LOVE the aquarium in the lobby! We will for surely be back.

title: Great stay
text: We always stay at the Kimberley when we visit anew York, we have tried many hotels in the past but this one always reaches expectations.Friendly and courteous staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and great food in the two connected restaurants. Breakfast is buffet style and pretty good, it’s on roof top so great views

title: The best hotel I have ever stayed in
text:
My new husband and I went to nyc as part of our honeymoon and stayed here. They upgraded us and gave us a bottle of prosecco. 
They can’t do enough for you at this hotel. The doorman is an absolute legend as well (although I didn’t get his name!)

title: Very nice stay
text: Stayed overnight at this hotel on the front end of a trip to Europe.   Spacious and clean room. Very comfortable bed. Our room was located on a lower floor but we didn’t hear any street noise.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Lots of nearby restaurants.  Would certainly return.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Kimberly Hotel has Excellent service, beautiful rooms and amenities. Great location in midtown Manhattan. Concierge gave us helpful advice how to take subway to High Line, and helped get us a last minute reservation at the Oyster Bar. We will always stay at the Kimberly Hotel.

title: Kimberly Hotel - Lovely & Spacious
text: For my birthday, I wanted to pretend I lived in NYC, so the Kimberly Hotel was perfect.  The suites were spacious, it felt like it was my own apartment!  I loved the terrace, and the penthouse restaurant/bar is lovely with a beautiful view and wonderful staff.  The hospitality there is on point!  They even brought up a bottle of champagne for my special day.  Will return for sure!

title: Joseph Ponteri
text: The service was outstand and responsive.  All staff was excellent.  The doormen were vwey good.  Like to stay at the hotel, it is very convieant. Th PH restaurant and bar were excellent and the breakfasts are tasty.

title: Fabulous amenities
text: We had a seamless check in, and are stunned by the quality of the room. The soaps etc are lovely, with a charming china flower soap dish. There are earplugs and dental picks and even a scale. The bathroom has everything we could want. The beds are comfortable with plenty of pillows. We are on the 7th floor and it is virtually silent.

title: Couldn't Have Been Happier
text: I loved my stay at the Kimberley Hotel. The hotel is a lovely respite from the bustle of the city. The room was spacious, comfortable, and nicely appointed. The service was excellent and the public spaces were elegant. The location was good and we were able to walk to many places.

title: Lovely Hotel, Roof Top Bar Amazing!
text: Our first trip to New York for our 25th Wedding Ann with our two young adult children. Door men were so helpful and friendly. Reception is small but amazing with golden paintings and furniture and a massive tropical fish tank. We were on 3rd floor. Not much of a view but the room was large and beautifully furnished with a side kitchen. Towels and toiletries changed every day and bed made. Our kids were in a separate area using a different lift on the 5th floor. Again room was smaller but good. The best in my opinion was the roof top bar on the 30th floor. The weather was hot while we were there and they opened the large windows so you really felt part of NYC. Service was great as was the atmosphere. In the afternoon from 4 to 5 they do free coffee/tea and little cakes. The area is amazing. Bath and Body Works just 7 mins round the corner. As was Rockafeller Centre which we went to , no queues got in straightaway about 9.30 am. Views are amazing. Got the subway down to 9/11 and also Battery Park for the ferry to Liberty Island and Ellis Island. Very good trip. We got scammed at the subway early morning. a chap with an official badge and a key to open the big iron gate took us through and activated Metro Cards for us at $20 each....$80 altogether then he pretended to activate the cards. We were got to 9/11 we checked them in the machines and they were all out of date. Never thought we could still get scammed! Beware only go to machines or the people with yellow coats on. Anyway brilliant trip. Time Sq, food, people were all amazing. Also I got really badly bitten so take some bug spray if its hot.

title: Fabulous Hotel!!!!!
text:
We stay at the Kimberly when we visit NY. The hotel is well located as it is walkable to the theater district, great shopping and restaurants; however what really sets it apart from the other hotels in the area is the service. I cannot say enough about the assistant manager, Mr. Jorge Garciadealba. He is knowledgeable, helpful and truly professional in all that he does. The hotel staff is great. Housekeeping requests are attended to as quickly as possible. The concierges are well informed and available throughout the day and evening.  
We stayed in an annex room. While not as spacious as a one bedroom suite, it was well appointed with a coffee machine, coffee and tea supplies and bathroom items. The room was clean and quiet. The bed was most comfortable.
We love to stay there and highly recommend this hotel!

title: Nice place to stay for business
text: The rooms are very nice. Big and coozy. Nice amenities and good snack bar. The staff is always willing to help. Breakfast is served on the upper terraze floor 31st. A great view of the Chrysler building. Also use on summer time for some after hour drinks to chill down the business day.

title: 5 star
text: Staff/concierge are very friendly and helpful. Beds and pillows are super comfortable. Our suite had a balcony but it was across from a construction zone. Sound insulation in the rooms are great. We never heard sounds or noises from other guests' rooms.

title: Lovely hotel and stay in NYC
text: We stayed five nights at this well located hotel. Travelling with our two sons in their 20’s we took a 2 bed suite. This was spacious and fitted all our needs. Very traditionally decorated but clean and pleasant. Staff were very helpful when having got caught up in a Metro delay beyond our check out time they allowed us to quickly shower before we checked out eventually an hour late. Staff were all very helpful. We would recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent staff, great room and perfect location!
text:
We arrived a couple of hours earlier than check-in time.  But the gentleman at the front desk looked for a room and checked us in right away, which was SO NICE! 

The room was huge!  We booked "Executive One Bedroom King Suite."  The bedroom, living room, dining area and kitchen are all spacious. There were LOTS of storage. (The bathroom was pretty small though.) 

All the staff were so nice.  We met 2 bellmen, and both were always smiling and willing to help.

In the room, there was a sheet of paper that proudly says that many employees at Kimbery Hotel work long years.   Apparently average is 15 years and there are even people who have worked there for 30+ years.  I like the idea of making that as their selling point because staff is such a key for the guests' great experiences.

Location was also perfect.  We enjoyed walked around the area for lunch and shopping.  There are also subway stations a block or two away.  That was very convenient.

It was really a good deal for about $450 per night.  We will be happy to go back again next time we are in NYC!

title: Love the Kimberly!
text: Our stay could not have been better - from the lovely room with the awesome balcony, to the delicious buffet breakfast and cocktails on the roof!  We were celebrating a big birthday and the entire staff made us feel welcome and taken care of.  We will definitely be back and will recommend this special hotel to our friends and family.  ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Wonderful hotel
text: We loved our stay here. Our 1 bedroom suite with a balcony was beautiful, spacious and comfortable.  We ate breakfast at Upstairs, dinner at Bistango's and both were delicious.   The hotel and restaurant staff were friendly, warmly professional and superb at their jobs. The Kimberly Hotel will be our first choice when we return to NYC.

title: Fabulous
text: We stayed for 10 nights and could not fault anything. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Nothing was too much trouble Fabulous location and very comfortable beds. Rooftop bar is excellent. We Will definitely be returning.

title: Lovely Hotel with Phenomenal Staff
text: A beautiful hotel with exceptional service. You will fall in love with the staff. The rooms are beautifully decorated, comfortable and well maintained. From the moment the doorman greats you — you will be well taken care of at the Kimberly. Everyone on staff is friendly, courteous and professional. I felt as though the staff sincerely cared about making my stay a wonderful experience. By the end of my stay it felt like I was leaving friends and family. Jorge was amazing. His attention to detail, warm personality, and commitment to going above and beyond helped make my stat memorable in so many positive ways. Thanks so much for an amazing experience. I highly recommend this hotel. It’s a gem.

title: Excellent in almost all respects
text: Great rooms (2 bed suite is enormous) and fantastic staff without exception. The 2 bed suites have 1 en-suite (with jacuzzi bath), 1 other separate bedroom, another bathroom and then a pull down sofabed in the living area. Also a small kitchen with free coffee, daily water etc. And a balcony. Midtown Location is great (you don't need to cross a road to get to the subway). The only reason for not giving a 5 star rating is that the wi-fi was extra, other than that I would thoroughly recommend!

title: Extraordinary Service!
text: I had the privilege of staying at the Kimberly hotel last night. I have visited NY regularly but this is my first time in this hotel.  It definitely will NOT be my last.   The other reviews are correct when they say these are the largest hotel rooms in the city.  My expectation were closet sized rooms in which I could barely turn around — u know, the usual in NY!! Not at all.  We received oversized rooms that all had living room/sitting areas and kitchen-ish areas (sink, microwave, mini-fridge). What a surprise.  Then the staff — AMAZING!!!! Every single one of them from the doorman to the engineers... to the service folks in the service elevators delivering food and having conversation — The friendliness made me think  I was in my southern birthplace, not NY.  The best of all was Jorge, who set the tone in extraordinary customer service from the time we arrived.  He checked us in thoroughly and efficiently, while ensuring we were aware of all of the features of the hotel.  He checked with us again as we went out to dinner — making sure rooms were to our satisfaction and reminding us we had access to their rooftop penthouse.  When we called bc our a/c was on the fritz, he immediately sent up an engineer who repaired the a/c in a NY minute. We had breakfast in the penthouse — delish!! And had dinner before we left in their Italian bistro.  Everything was wonderful.  No down sides for us.  We will be back — without question— and we will tell all of our friends about this hidden jewel.  Please keep up the great work and service.

title: A gem in NYC
text: One of the nicest hotels I have stayed at in NYC. Large comfortable rooms, attentive staff and easy access to the theater district, dining options and other New York sights. I definitely would stay here again.

title: Great little spot!
text: I've stayed at the Kimberly Hotel in NYC now about 5 or 6 times and we always truly enjoy it.  The roomsd are larger than normal for NYC and alwaysh clean and well appointed.  The staff are always very helpful and friendlyb and the mid-town location is ideal.  I really enjoy the rooms that have balcony's as well as that is a great place to unwind with a glass of wine after a long day  exploring the city.  I have been recommending this Hotel to all of my friends and certainly have no issue giving it a glowing revue.  My only concern is a self serving one.....and that is if too many people discover this little gem of a hotel then I will probably have to pay more to stay here in the future!  On a serious note though.....give it a try.  You won't be disappointed.

title: We love the location and beautiful style of this hotel.
text: We were very comfortable and felt that we were lacking nothing in this great boutique hotel. I am so glad we chose the Kimberly Hotel. We were walking distance to the places we needed to go. We were safe and the hotel was quiet.

title: Nice NYC hotel
text: Hotel was very nice and staff super professional.  The room had a balcony,  a windowed bathroom  with huge tub. Could walk to Central Park, Broadway, lots of businesses and even to lower East Side in only about 40 minutes site seeing tons of get travel destination.  I would go back the Kimberly!

title: The best boutique hotel in NYC
text: Krystal and the rest of the staff made our stay outstanding! This is the best hotel I’ve stayed in for NYC. The rooms were extremely spacious and beautiful. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I’d love to return again and again.

title: can't fault it, great place to stay
text:
excellent location near subways. 
clean comfortable and very spacious rooms
great value
good service, v comfortable bed
helpful staff
we didn't eat there
room well equipped to make a drink and a snack.
Stayed in a suite.
noisy air con for us not used to it.

title: A great hotel!
text:
My wife and I just spent three nights at The Kimberly and we couldn't be more pleased with our stay.  

We went to NYC to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary.  We chose this hotel for the location and reviews.  I informed the staff that why we were visiting and they didn't disappoint.  Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by very friendly staff that brought our luggage into the hotel for us.  The front desk staff were welcoming and very friendly.  Although we arrived at 12:30, our suite was ready and we were allowed to check in.

Getting to our room, we were surprised to see we were in a one bedroom suite.  This suite had a very nice bedroom and a large living area.  This area had a couch, a couple comfortable chairs, a table and a wet bar.  The furnishings were very nice.  Off of the living area was a balcony that over looked E 50th St.  The view was of buildings across the street, but we could see traffic below.  Due to the amount of tall buildings in NYC, I realized a view of the city would come at a great price, so I was not disappointed.

After a great night's sleep, we had a wonderful day in Manhattan.  When we returned to the hotel, we found a bottle of "champagne" in our room with a lovely letter from the hotel.  They congratulated is on our 25 years of marriage and wished us well.

Every interaction with the staff at the Kimberly was professional and friendly.  They were knowledgeable and offered advice about NYC.

Some reviews talk about noise from the streets below.  I expected to hear noise and it didn't bother me.  I knew we weren't staying in the country.

The Kimberly is a wonderful hotel.  I encourage anybody to stay here.  It's just a few blocks from many popular locations in Manhattan.  The room we stayed in was very nice.  It was clean and very comfortable. 

Thank you to the staff at The Kimberly.

title: Another wonderful stay
text: We had another wonderful stay at The Kimberly. Everyone is so amazing, helpful, knowledgeable, top notch customer service. We stayed at a onw bedroom suite - clean, comfortable, everything our family needed.We will be back again and again! :)

title: Calm, welcoming oasis in central mid-town
text: First things first—the staff. From the moment you arrive at the curb until the minute you depart you are welcomed like family. Friendly smiles all around and always willing to assist or just have a  chat. Peter the concierge was particularly helpful when I had a Broadway ticket mix-up. I’ve stayed in several Manhattan hotels and this one is by far the most welcoming. The room—we booked a suite which was very comfortable and extremely spacious. Kitchenette, table and chairs, side chairs and a couch. Bedroom was very large with king bed, dresser, and comfortable bench. Couldn’t have asked for anything better. Location—Easy walking distance to all midtown attractions and short ride to Met, Lincoln Center etc. Easy walk to terrific breakfast place, The Smith. Restaurant—We arrived hungry and the restaurant on site did not disappoint. Great flatbread pizzas!  Prices comparable to other mid-priced ones in area. This is my go-to midtown hotel!

title: Felt Misled and Cheated
text:
Booked 3 deluxe king rooms . Checked in and was given a room without window. Confronted the reception and was told the hotel was full. Promised change to room with window the next day but again told windowed room was taken.
Deluxe room has no window. Imagine what their standard room will be like.

title: Fabulous stay
text: The Kimberley is perfectly situated for exploring New York. The hotel staff (particularly Jorge) couldn't do enough for us, I had made contact prior to arrival to explain that we were celebrating a big birthday and were upgraded and treated to champagne and free drinks in the roof top bar. The suite was great, very comfortable.  My only criticism is the air conditioning is very noisy (even when turned off). Otherwise everything was perfect, I wouldn't hesitate to come back or recommend to others .

title: Excellent Service, wish we were there now
text:
Stayed at beginning of NYC/Hamptons trip.  Having booked via Trailfinders and viewed the slightly old worldy style I  wasn't sure what to expect. Well, I'm in a tired, modern box on Times Square right now that messed up booking details and would like to be back with Jorge and his customer-focussed colleagues at the Kimberly.

This is an excellent hotel for families.  We have a we'll appointed suite (it was an apartment), 2 large bedrooms, 2 baths, 1 was en suite, ample toiletries (not like the one soap for 4 in current hotel).  Huge living area and properly equipped kitchen diner (microwave, coffee maker, toaster and decent fridge).

Not only did we have 4 nights for 3, but Jorge welcomed us to our NYC home with complementary 'goodies'.  Each member of staff with whom we came into contact was friendly and helpful and seemed to take pride in their work. The same applied to housekeeping and It  was lovely to have a break from housekeeping myself.

Breakfast was excellent as was the Italian restaurant. This hotel surpassed all my expectations.  My sons have a new phrase to reflect excellent customer service  "we've been Jorged"

title: Wonderful home away from home
text:
Stayed for 3 nites at Kimberly and everything is perfect. 👍🏻 big beds, amazing spacious and clean rooms with awesome 👏 hospitable staff. 

Room is always clean and well kept. 

Very nice location in Manhattan!

title: Wonderful hotel
text: We had a lovely stay at The Kimberly. Our flight was delayed 5 hours which meant we didn’t get to the hotel until 1:30am. When we got there we found that they had upgraded us to an incredible suite with 2 bathrooms. The bed was divine. The views spectacular. It was clean and quiet. The kids absolutely loved the aquarium in the lobby. The complimentary coffee and pastries on the roof are a nice touch as well the daily paper. We stayed at another hotel later in our trip and missed The Kimberly.

title: Average hotel
text: Good location, uneven service--front desk person(Bijou)was consistently nasty, scolding, refused to speak above a whisper and make eye contact, while concierge, bellhop, and housekeeper were lovely.  Odd configuration of shower, and rooms were kind of dated.  Loud fan in rooms, even when we turned air conditioning off.  Liked the domed ceiling of the elevator.  More attention should be paid to things like two, successive remote controls with dead batteries, nightstand lamp and standing lamp did not work, and no laundry bag in room.  No real visible dirt, but room just didn’t feel clean.

title: LOVE this Boutique Hotel
text: This was the perfect hotel in every way. The customer service is 5 star from the front door to housekeeping. The room is absolutely beautiful with quality furnishings, comfortable bedding and clean as can be.The sleep sofa felt like a tempurpedic mattress and you will find robes and slippers and L'Occitane bath products.There is a well appointed kitchen with snacks and a stocked bar offering a nice selection of libations. We had a Juliette balcony that overlooked the city.  The bell man came in with our luggage and showed us all the features in our suite and then took us on the patio and talked about places to go  and how to walk there.This location is close to everything you can walk to Times Square and local favorites.There is fabulous dining just steps away at The Empire Steak House and you must got to the Rooftop for cocktail and tapas after 5:00 or enjoy breakfast up there. We cannot wait to come back to The Kimberly we had such a great time and felt so comfortable and relaxed when we came back to our room after a busy day of sightseeing.

title: Fantastic hotel in mid Manhatten
text: This hotel was amazing.  First the interior.  The room was huge - living room and separate bedroom.  We had the best bathroom with a giant jetted tub.  Bathroom was accessible from bedroom and living room.  It was all lovely and updated.  Second, the property.  The rooftop lounge/restaraunt was loud at night, but lovely.  There is also a restaurant on the first floor.  Third, the location.  Easily accessible to subway and within walking distance of everything in mid Manhatten.  I have already booked my next trip at The Kimberly!

title: August 11th to August 12th
text: This is my 2nd time staying at the Kimberly Hotel and I had another great experience  at the  Hotel. The entire hotel staff treated me such kindness . The room I had this time was on the 23rd floor and room itself was amazing. Upstairs on the penthouse and always amazing. The views of Midtown Manhattan are truly amazing. I have experience Upstairs At The Kimberly Hotel since NYE 2012 and it is always a amazing experience.  My first time staying at the Kimberly Hotel was NYE 2018 was a amazing experience.  The overall hospitality of the  Hotel is excellent.  I would let my friends know about the Kimberly and tell them to stay there when visiting NYC. Once again, thank you very much for everything!!!!

title: Wonderful
text: Excellent hotel. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Everyone on staff was  friendly and helpful.  Good midtown location, walkable to Rockafeller Center and Times Square.Would definitely stay here again.

title: Family trip for 15th birthday!
text: our second visit to this great hotel. staff is outstanding, friendly and helpful. a definate return visit! even though sold out, very accomodating to make sure our two rooms were close by.rooms were spotless!

title: Run down
text: The Kimberly is very run down. The hallways smelled of smoke. The air conditioner didn't work well. The bathrooms are small and outdated. I would not recommend this hotel to others. The rooftop bar was closed for a private event one night of our stay so we were unable to enjoy it.

title: Great value for money, extra large rooms, perfect location
text:
Rooms are certainly larger than at most properties in NYC. Already the King size bedroom was very accommodating. The attached living room was even bigger. The kitchenette was a nice plus, especially for storing drinks and some fruits for a late nite snack. I also appreciated the news paper in the morning. Easy access to public transportation - subway just across the street as well a two bus stops right around the corner made exploring the city a real breeze. Two really nice breakfast restaurants within a few steps.
Staff was very attentive and always smiling. No unexpected costs at checkout. Great value for the money, will definitely return.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Just returned from a week in NYC and at The Kimberly. Our room was comfortable and clean and the location was very convenient to so many activities. The staff could not have been friendlier and made our trip even more enjoyable. Looking forward to our next visit!

title: Very happy
text: My husband and I just recently stayed for 3 days and could have been happier with the Kimberly. Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Best of all it was quiet. We both slept like babies, which is not always easy in NYC. Our room had no view but in the back it was quiet and personally I come to NYC to be in the view not look at it. The staff was incredibly friendly and the hotel is located perfectly to walk to the sites or use the E or 6 subway. We were very happy. Highly recommend.

title: NY stay
text: Great location, extremely comfortable beds, beautiful room and loved the roof top garden for coffee in the morning!I also , in good weather is a fun bar in the evenings. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. We had a wonderful stay!!

title: Sleepless in Manhattan
text:
