The Kimberly has many of the great features mentioned in other reviews. It is conveniently located with great restaurants, dinners and bars within a few blocks. The rooms are spacious and clean. A family will greatly appreciate the small well equipped kitchenette for the occasional breakfast or snack.

My gripe: The noisy “under window room air conditioners”. In our room, there was one in the bedroom and one in the sitting room and the both made a racket all night long. One can expect something like that in a low cost motel but in a 4 star hotel it is unacceptable.

title: Great stay
text:
We stayed here for 4 days for a family (2 adults, 2 teens) vacation to NYC. We had a bedroom suite with a sitting area and a small kitchenette. The room was comfortable, clean, roomy, and the view from the walk-out balcony was great. 

The room was actually BETTER than pictured and exceeded our expectation. We travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels and I would recommend this hotel for its great staff, location, and beautiful rooms. I had requested a quiet room and we were on the 29th floor, and there was still some noise from outside and the upstairs lounge area but it was not too bad and we were okay to get a good night sleep. There are slippers and bathrobes available to use. The washroom is small, but well equipped. The house keeping was on time and did a great job with the room cleaning.

We didn't use the restaurant and regret not using the Penthouse restaurant and lounge which has stunning views! The hotel kept out luggage once we arrived until the room was ready and on the day we were leaving. 

The day after we checked out a charge on our credit card was added for the bar soda and candy which we didn't use at all. We called the hotel and they removed the charges. 

I am glad I chose this hotel and will definitely consider staying here again.

title: GREAT HOTEL!!!
text: The Kimberly was the best hotel we have stayed at in NYC.  Large room, big bathroom, great location w/i walking distance of Times Square.  Included in our stay was a wonderful breakfast buffet.  All the staff were incredibly gracious and helpful, and David (the concierge we worked with) was terrific!  We loved this beautiful hotel.

title: Great Stay in Midtown
text: We stayed at The Kimberly for three nights and had a great time. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. There is a great coffee shop two doors down also. Makes getting breakfast on the run very easy.

title: Lovely Hotel, Awesome Staff!
text: Absolutely the loveliest hotel with the most awesome staff.  I was there for a family "girls" long weekend.  What sets the Kimberly apart from other hotels are not only the lovely suites with balconies, but, the little things, like the chocolate and the card with the next day's weather update left on the bed at turndown.  The doormen, Gregory and Harry are simply the best!  They are so welcoming, helpful and cheerful. Every staff member we encountered were professional and friendly.  The Upstairs rooftop is a wonderful place to enjoy their delicious breakfast, a drink later in the day, such a beautiful view, a great place to relax away from the NYC crowds for a bit.  I would not hesitate at all to recommend the Kimberly for your next visit to NYC.  You will not be disappointed!  I can't wait to go back!

title: This is the place to stay in NYC
text: It has been a couple of years since we've been here but I was writing another review on TA and realized I had to review The Kimberly.  It is my favorite hotel in NYC.  The location is perfect...the size of the room is unheard of...and the service is excellent.  Not to mention balconies and a rooftop bar! I wouldn't stay anywhere in the city now that I've visited The Kimberly...PERFECT!

title: 唔錯
text:
暑假的高峰期帶家人去玩，選擇了風評好的依間酒店。
總體感受，除了服務有所欠缺，其他都很好，是性價比極高的度假勝地。
服務的問題：員工熱情不夠，反應速度滿，電話溝通的內容並未實際落實！

title: Every bit as Wonderful and more!
text: The reviews here on Tripadvisor were a big part of our booking The Kimberly for our Girl's long weekend, and we are so glad to have follwed the advice. Our 1BR executive suite on the 21st floor was superb in every way. The staff were friendly and beyond helpful in every possible way, and we did call upon room service, house keeping, concierge, front desk, doormen quite a bit. This is absolutely our new favorite hotel in the city!

title: NYC one night
text: The front desk staff and valet driver were great! We had an early check in and an upgrade in our room. The rooms were HUGE and not just for nyc standards. The rooftop lounge had a beautiful view of the Chrysler building at night. Our only Hang up was with the Italian restaurant on the main level. I do not recommend this place for children despite their advertisement that they provide children’s menus (which they did not). The restaurant staff were not helpful. Otherwise the hotel was perfect!

title: Stunning
text:
We had a lovely welcome on arrival by the ever smiley staff who helped us with our bags and directed us to the rooftop café with free drinks and snack while we waited for our room to be checked. 

Our room was simply incredible; on the 17th floor it was a sweet with a kitchenette, two bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a lounge area. It was incredibly clean and very well layed out with lovely décor. While the balcony door was slightly difficult to open, once out the view was amazing - especially at night. 

The location of the hotel couldn't be better with café and tube stations nearby. 

My only complaint would be that I thought it was slightly cheeky to require guests to pay for their wifi when almost all other hotels would give this to you for free as you're staying with them.

title: Home away from home
text: This little gem is perfectly located in midtown Manhattan . It’s address is conviently located to the shopping Mecca of 5th and Madison Avenue , not to mention all the magnificent restaurants within walking distance .

title: good
text:
We were on the 27th floor which was quite high up so if we went onto the balcony we had an amazing view although it was quite acrophobia-inducing! The room was lovely although they were supposed to refill the free water daily and they didn't for two days so my mum asked reception to do it and they said they'd do it whilst we were out for dinner but they didn't which was disappointing. My mum had to enquire again which was not good. They were also supposed to return the sofa bed to a sofa during the day which they didn't. That wasn't a problem for us, but for those with small children who stayed in the room for longer periods of time it could be.
The lobby was lovely with a huge fish tank filled with spiky sea urchins, blue tangs and all sorts of other small marine species! 
All of the staff were extremely nice and we had a wonderful stay.

title: Best service on our trip throughout USA
text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment.  It was so spacious and clean.  It has lovely amenities and the kitchen was great.  As we decided to have breakfast in our room.  We did have breakfast on the roof area one morning and it was lovely also.  The staff in this hotel are really lovely.  Especially the front desk staff and the lovely smiling morning door man.  The afternoon door man, could take some advice from him - sorry you weren't as approachable.  The restaurant next door is great and we had lunch there once.  Lovely food.  This hotel is in a great location and walking distance to heaps of restaurants on 2nd avenue.  Highly recommend this hotel.

title: NYC Enclave
text: This spot is a true gem and I will surely return.  Great location, friendly, helpful and courteous staff along with a great breakfast joint next door and a rooftop bar with great drinks and superb views of the city.  Our room was spacious and well appointed and we will surely return.

title: Disappointed
text: Check-in time is 3:00 and when I arrived at 5:40 PM, my room was not ready and I was told to wait “briefly”, which was more than 10 minutes, so I went into the bar to have a drink (which they did pay for). How can the room not be ready?? I didn’t get into my room until about 6:30 PM. Although the room was nice (large and clean), it was by the elevator door, and the conference room. Both which were noisy (I think they were setting up for a conference the next day, but it was after 9:00. There was no view, I was overlooking a roof and it was half blocked by fake grass “fencing”. Overall, a disappointing stay.

title: NY Trip
text: The hotel was very nice and worked well four family of 4. the King Junior Suite was a good sized room and had what we needed. We did notice the air conditioner in the living room did not work as well as the bedroom system do we had to keep the bedroom door open. You may want to check that out. room 6B

title: Perfect accommodations!
text: From the helpful, friendly staff to the beautiful room, the hotel was perfect. This was my wife’s first time in New York and she was amazed. The location in Manhattan was close to Times Square and  shopping on Park and 5th Avenue. We will be back to The Kimberly!

title: A Great Place to Stay
text: Excellent location - the hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly.  A short walk to times square and grand central station and the subway was only one block away.  Bus tours left from Lexington.  The diner next door served great food and provided excellent service.

title: New York Summer 2018
text: We had such an amazing time at the Kimberly. The staff were so friendly, it is a beautiful hotel with great facilities and in the perfect location. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Thank you for such a great time.

title: Great location and some nices touches
text:
All in all, a very solid and consistent hotel in midtown, but with a few wrinkles

Check in was efficient but somewhat "business like".... arrived around 1pm and were told that if a room were to become available before 3pm we would be contacted by phone. This gave us the opportunity to take a walk to stretch our legs after a very early start (4am UK time) and 7 hour flight. We were told by a female receptionist that we had been upgraded to a suite, but on our return were re-assigned a different room in "the tower" by a male colleague, however this appeared to be a standard room based on a review of pictures on Oyster (single room and kitchen extension, with no balcony or seating area). Now I don't usually pay much attention to this sort of thing, but given that this was our wedding trip and had told the hotel of our plans (we enquired about a wedding photographer recommendation, plus post-wedding lunch) we were somewhat disappointed. I hadn't expected to be upgraded,  but when a carrot is danged in front of you.....

We were on the 9th floor adjacent to the elevator shaft, and in fairness there was no noise from the elevator during our 5 night stay, The room was spotlessly clean and well appointed with a large flat screen TV, plus kitchenette.  We could have done with a few more hangers bearing in mind the length of our stay (why have a large wardrobe, but only enough hangers for 50% of the space?) but we decided to make do with what we had. The room had a very limited view over the rear courtyard, but someone has to have it right?

The bathroom was also spotless, but felt a little small, the sink area had very little space around it for storing assorted toiletries, so we were constantly moving items from the shelf below to the sink and back again. 

Our main gripe with the room was the very noisy air conditioning unit. Although we stayed during a heatwave (96 degrees), the unit was horrendously noisy and often disturbed sleep. The hotel really needs to look into this.

The roof bar is great....lovely views to Chrysler and Rockefeller Buildings and a good vibe. Slightly expensive, but that's not unexpected in Manhattan.

Concierges were consistently friendly, cheerful and helpful and the main foyer and other public areas are spotlessly clean

wifi charges were a downside....$5+ per day.... wifi is routinely offered free in UK now

We breakfasted in the adjacent New York Luncheonette diner, and this was both convenient and excellent value for money with a wide range of choice. Plenty of bars on 47th street within walking distance. Subway was one block north, to travel up and downtown; 3 blocks further enabled crosstown connections - all very convenient.

As mentioned above, we were to be married on July 3rd, and we were overjoyed when we got back to our room that evening to receive a bottle of champagne and chocolate strawberries from the management; a lovely gesture that was very much appreciated.

We enjoyed our stay, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it as a value hotel in Midtown, but I can't help but think that the rough edges in the hotel did start to add up, mitigated only in part by the lovely wedding day gesture.

title: Excellent stay!
text: Our stay at Kimberly were excellent with absolutely fantastic service and politeness. The staff was wonderful and the room we had was big and perfect for a family of four. We will come back for sure. They even made our daughters birthday very special. Thank you all!

title: BEST hotel in Manhattan
text: We stay here every 4 months due to my visits to MSKC. They r the best ! I recently recuperated from surgery there for days before able to fly home. We used in room dining ALOT. The food from ALL their menus is WONDERFUL!!  It’s my home in NYC!!!

title: Wonderful surprise
text: The staff and hotel exceeded my expectations.  Never have I seen so many helpful and cheerful staff in one hotel.  From the doormen, to the front desk to concierge.  The rooms are spacious by NYC standards

title: Wonderful first class hotel
text: Beautiful, small, quiet hotel with old-fashioned service.  Our room was clean, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was HUGE with L'Occitane products. We ate at both restaurants, which were delicious. We will stay again.

title: Good bang for your buck
text: Excellent hotel and room quality for the price.  Upgraded by front desk to a duplex without even asking.  Good central location.  Room very nice with comfortable beds.  Only negatives that keep it from being a 5 star were the street noise (probably universal in NYC) and that housekeeping did not clean our room one day.

title: Do not stay here
text:
This is my first lifetime review of a hotel, but I feel an obligation to speak up. Do not let the combination of a seemingly good deal and good location lure you into the bate and switch we are experiencing. 

Reservations lied about room I prepaid for, stuck us and our kids in townhouse side of building after guaranteeing they wouldn’t. This after having NO room for us whatsoever at check-in time. Front desk people barely cared, offered to split up my family into different rooms, maybe find a new room for us  tomorrow, or maybe charge me less. Hardly useful concessions for tired family of 5 fresh off long a flight just wanting the quality room they paid for and were promised. 

With no other option that wouldn’t blow up our tight schedule, we took the townhouse room and deeply regret it. Nothing is as promised. Our room is a really loud, wonky, apparently renovated old apartment looking out filthy windows at the adjacent filthy building and HVAC machinery. 

Don’t stay here. You’ve been warned.

title: Great deal!
text: This hotel represents a great deal among pricey Manhattan hotel. The suites are relatively reasonable and roomy. And the midtown location very convenient. The only negative for us was the a/c was hinky and in July that can be a problem. That is the only reason I’m not giving it a perfect score. But the staff was very friendly and addressed our concerns swiftly.

title: Fantastic - location and amenities wonderful
text: It was a pleasure staying at The Kimberly Hotel recently while on business in NYC. The room and the staff were superior. Attention to every detail, I highly recommend The Kimberly Hotel while you explore the area. Close to many historic sites.

title: Our First Choice in NYC
text: The rooms are spacious, the staff welcoming and the whole experience wonderful. The front desk staff and the doormen make you feel like you live there. I go there every time I am in NYC. The rooftop bar and restaurant is great for any season.

title: Eccezionale
text: Bellissimo hotel nella 50sima, nel centro del distretto finanziario e vicino al rockfeller center. Servizio ai limiti del 5 stelle, camera con due letti queen non enorme ma sufficiente, Bagno piccolo ma pulitissimo, servizio ineccepibile e molto friendly. Hotel veramente di categoria superiore. Se acquistato con un’offerta diviene un must. Per alcune riviste uno tra i primi 100 alberghi al mondo.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: We had a sister-sister weekend getaway and we stayed at The Kimberly.  Excellent choice!!! This was a brilliant place to stay, only a couple of blocks from The Rockefeller center.  The decor was beautiful and luxurious.  And the staff was awesome!!!  But, what made the stay extra special was Ralph and Mentor.  They went above and beyond for our stay.  Our next trip to NYC will definitely include The Kimberly!!!

title: My sister and I had a weekend get-away and we stayed at the Kimberly.
text: My room at the Kimberly was fantastic...very nostalgic and grand.The staff was great and very accommodating.  On its own, the hotel is great; but Ralph and Mentor made it delightful and one to never forget.  When I return, The Kimberly will definitely be on my list; it was an experience that I will always remember.  Thanks...

title: The most impressive thing was.......
text: The hotel was awesome.  Best stay in NYC but what set this trip apart was the doormen Harry and Ralph! They went above and beyond for our stay. Hotel was spacious and clean. The area was quiet as well.  Thank you guys!
